My flood light works amazing in the morning and I get notified when people come up to my house but every time I get home around 8:30pm and sometimes 10pm and I pull up to my drive and the light comes on but I get no notifications about motion. It doesn’t even record anything. This only happens at night and it’s kinda bad when I don’t know if someone is there at night because that’s when a lot of things happen. I open the app to see if it recorded any motions but it doesn’t but the light comes on when it’s in the trigger zone. I love your guys products but I’m not gonna buy more until I know this issue is fixed. A lot of my friends tell me they are having the same problem at night and it only happens at night time. I would give 5 stars when this problem is fixed. I tried everything you guys told me, and you guys sent me a wifi extender thing and it’s still doesn’t work. Can you guys please look at this issue.

title: Terrible App
text: I’ve had my Ring for about 2 years now. The app worked perfect until a few weeks ago when they had a large update, now it’s absolute crap. My live feed will never pop up and instead says, “streaming error.” Thought it may be my new WiFi connection but I’ve tested it multiple times and the app says there is an excellent connection. Super disappointed because these cameras are not cheap, and the app use to be extremely user friendly. They have also changed the live feed to only include highlights, which seems like a bad update to me because then you can’t see what’s going on 24/7, just only when the camera detects motion (which it doesn’t always catch everything). On top of that, I don’t always get the notifications of motion until 10-20 minutes after they happen. Sad about the direction this app has gone. They have so many opportunities to make it great, but have been reverting backwards in the last month or so. Wanted to buy another 400$ worth of products for my new place, but I will definitely not be doing that now.

title: Broke my phone
text: The app does something with the volume and distorts other apps if ring has been opened recently. It distorted something so badly because I had just used the ring app that the my main speaker on my phone cracked. Also, the super tiny notification screen picture is pretty much useless unless you carry a magnifying glass. Also, if you get a notification that someone is at your door by the time your app loads up there will be no one in sight. The camera couldn’t even pickup someone trying to steal it from my porch. Sketchy. The 20 dollar camera I got from Walgreens is actually better than this all around because you don’t have to absolutely pay for cloud storage because you can add your own memory card that saves data to be watched on your phone. Instead of having Ring as the middle man for cloud storage. You also can’t change the ring doorbell chime. All this is being used with a Wifi 6 router on the 2.4 GHZ band pushing over 200mpbs. I would suggest just getting a camera with its own storage rather than trust this company to stay in business.

title: Horrible
text: I have had several issues with device from the start but things just keep getting worse. Live view does not work at all for a month or more regardless of updates. Can not open up motions until after they occur and most of the time the screen and recording is just black with no voice. There is a major delay in motion detection even when it works correctly the list is endless. My WiFi and internet are perfect. I dread needing to call to fix this as I have done so many times in the past as well as them sending me replacement parts because it was in fact the devices issues rather then sending me a complete new device had to trouble shoot hours of my time on the phone with them for them to send me a new back plate that took almost three weeks to receive complete joke. I had bought the flood lights and after that ordeal I returned them. Ooo and the best part with this ring experience is when the rims got stolen off a family car and device picked up not a single motion. Complete disappointment I have ordered new system and can’t wait for installation to be done with ring once and for all.

title: Still needs work!
text: Its a nice idea, but there are still bugs in the system. I’ve been using the Ring products for two years now, and I wish I would have simply just bought the ADT system. With the Ring, need incredible bandwidth on your WiFi for it to work “properly”. It may work with a weak, minimal internet service but your recording and video are going to be choppy. Which mean you’re going to need to buy the extenders, two in my case, at $35 a pop. The system always goes offline! And at the most in opportune moment. I’ve bought two flood light cams, and the video doorbell. All of which have given me problems! Both of my floodlight cams are down right now. Not happy with the ring products. In opinion, just invest in a real security system or try the Nest products. I’m putting all my Ring products on EBay and starting over....

title: Don't waste your money "AND PRECIOUS TIME"
text:
I should start by saying that this is the worst piece of device I've spent money on in my life, and Ring is the worst brand I have dealt with. If you're considering getting this.... Don't!
Ring as a company is a failure. I was an early adopter of this device and though it had some minor bugs, it still worked. It's been a year now since the device (multiple ones) started losing its functionality and it gets worse everyday --unbelievably.
The development team have to be losing their mind. They keep pushing out updates on integration and neighborhood alert functionalities; how do you expect these to work when the primary function of the device (real time surveillance/interaction) doesn't work?
Ring alerts don't work when you try to see what's out there --infinite camera loading loop. Live view is hit or miss --fails just when you need it.
It's unnerving to see your aggressive approach to commercialize this device yet you won't invest a fraction of the money to support it or improve it's functionality. The customers are getting fleeced. It's very sad and Ring as a company should be ashamed of it this.

title: Wired Rocks-Battery Brutal
text: The wired ring products are definitely higher quality with better connections. The battery operated Ring Cam is terrible. I have a very powerful 1TB speed internet with a mesh WiFi setup closest to the room that fronts where the camera is installed on the exterior of the house and it’s just crappy.  Quality is brutal for the price which was $200.  The batteries. (Holds 2) both die within weeks regardless of you use battery saver settings.   I’m lucky if I get a combined 2 months out of both batteries when Ring is promising up to 6 months with one battery.  Also they send you batteries that have born on dates from close to a decade ago. Manufacture some newer batteries for your customers.  Stop being cheap.  Wired is the way to go but Ring products are pricy. My only complaint with wired ones is that they only record for a max of 60 seconds with movement.  Some things take longer and video cuts off.  That’s not good from a security standpoint.

title: New update has glitches
text: Was loving this. Always saw what was going on at my house and added a device at my moms house so I could watch over her since she is getting old. Still able to do that and it still works well but I like to keep a clean inbox, so to speak. I would check my videos and delete the ones that I didn’t need or want. With this new update, every time I delete a video it leaves a “ghost video” behind. Sorry if this isn’t the right terminology but it’s all I can think of. What happens is this: I delete a video that said at was recorded at 10:10 pm. Now a new video shows up in my list of videos showing the same time of 10:10 pm. I try to watch it and it says there is a problem. So now I delete that and it’s gone. Now I move on to the next video at 9:30 pm and the same exact thing happens. I basically have to delete every video twice. Very annoying. As a note I am using my apple iphone 7plus to view theses videos. Please fix this glitch so I can get back to enjoying this service

title: Ring cameras and chimes break all the time
text: DON’T PURCHASE!  Ring products constantly fail.  Yes, Ring sends replacements but they don’t diagnose problem, they don’t uninstall their defective products and they don’t reinstall and set up.  Either you have to do yourself or you have to pay an AV company to diagnose problem, uninstall defective products and reinstall and set up. Each time AV company comes out there is a huge charge.   I suppose one can do this themselves if they are good at this type of work and they want to keep doing it over and over again.  If not, you will pay and pay and pay because Ring products break all the time.  And good luck with customer service; you will get nowhere.  I’ve been on hold for 30 minutes and then they disconnected me.  I can’t even get them to change my email address and they don’t allow you to do the change yourself in your account.  And they say they send you emails regarding updates.  I have never received an email from Ring. If you chose to purchase Ring products be prepared to work hard and/or pay through the nose.

title: Awesome product...with exceptions.
text: Initial install of Ring Pro failed when I had my regular Fios WiFi router.  Then installed eero pro mesh WiFi and it worked flawlessly.  I guess you could probably use a WiFi extender, but I wanted fast WiFi throughout and eero is amazing for that.  No delay in detecting motion or answering when someone rings the doorbell.  A lot of issues people have with Ring has to do with slow WiFi.  Seems like fast and strong WiFi signal it’s a must for it to work properly.  I love the alerts, but when there’s a gardener or other worker moving around, I just temporarily disable the motion alerts. I also installed a Bluetooth door lock and so when friends/family ring my Ring, I can let them in if I’m running late.  And the My Neighborhood posted videos are great to.  Can see suspicious people/cars around that other users post.  Can’t imagine life without Ring now.

title: Not as advertised slow video feed response
text:
Update: now having them for a few days I can say it’s worse than I thought. The live view opens about 20% of the time the rest it just crashes and never opens. Also it weirdly takes over my Bluetooth in my car and shuts off my music and doesn’t open back up once closed. Save yourself some headaches and the trouble of returning them and just find another camera. Mine are going back. 

I purchased 3 Spotlight cams and let’s say I’m disappointed. Just like everyone says the response time is painfully slow the cameras take forever to load the live stream even on strong WiFi, if they open up at all most of the time it just spins and crashes never turning on the camera. The clips take even longer to load. So actually stopping someone from taking a package off your porch would be impossible. I also have Nest cameras and they work and load way better. Not too mention the Nest cams send a snapshot of the alerts to my Apple Watch so I don’t have to open the app to see what triggered the alert. If you have the ability to power a camera outside go with Nest.

title: Made my old alarm system useful
text:
My house has an old ADT system that we weren’t using because the monitoring service was way too expensive. I purchased Ring’s retrofit alarm kit and a base station, and after a little elbow grease, was able to use all of my existing sensors and control the whole thing from my phone with zero monthly costs. Awesome!

Some feedback: 

I would really like more nuanced control over sounds from individual devices. For instance, when I arm my system at night from my phone, both the base station and the keypad announce that the system is armed. In this scenario I don’t want the announcement, but I don’t want to turn the sound off completely from these devices because I want arming / disarming directly from the keypad to make some affirmation sounds. 

Also, would really like the geofencing feature to work across multiple people. Right now it will remind me to arm my system if I leave the house, despite the fact that my wife is still at home and that I’ve added her to the system. 

Lastly, I would love some auto arm / disarm scheduling built in so that the system will just automatically arm when we are sleeping and disarm when we wake up. 

But otherwise the app and system are really awesome and very much worth the cost!

title: Adding additional “titles”
text: I’m a very satisfied Ring Doorbell user who also uses the app to check for crime in my area. Currency, there are five “titles” to choose from when you post a message/video (i.e. Crime, Lost Pet, etc). I live in Florida so capturing wildlife on the Ring is pretty common (i.e. bobcats), as it is in other places like Alaska, Montana, etc. I absolutely LOVE seeing these posts but there are SEVERAL people in my “neighborhood” that get all riled up that people post these videos, stating the app is for crime on. First, these people need to get upset about “real world issues” & let people post what they want - as the majority of us like them. I figured I’d post on here & privately reach out to Ring about the possibility of having a title for “wildlife” so the people that choose to view them can & the ones who get SO upset can block that setting. Who’s with me?!?!?!?!

title: 2 years later and still missing a  critical function
text:
Adding to to previous review - we still need a ‘snooze all devices’ function.  It takes too many button presses or taps to snooze all the ring devices and it seems like an easy coding job to add a ‘snooze all’ function.

The concept of the Ring is great - but you’ve got to have really good wifi for it to work well.  Also, the app could use some design improvements - we have a Ring doorbell and a Chime and would like to be able to snooze them at the same time and for the same amount of time. For example, the Ring doorbell allows you to snooze motion for 15 minutes, 30 minutes, an hour or 2 hours, but the minimum snooze time for the Chime is 1 hour!  And to snooze both just to let out the dog, you need to tap your phone screen 8 times!  Would like to be able to snooze both with just a tap or two for 5 or 15 minutes to let out the dog and not wake the whole family.

title: Great App and Hardware
text:
I don’t know what people seem to complain about on the comments. I had nothing but good experiences. I installed the pro version Bell and the spotlight cam. Both worked great out of he box. The spotlightcam did a software update automatically and got even better response times. The video is crisp and clear even on night vision mode. The chimes come in within seconds and the secondary chime hardware I setup in other rooms chimes immediately. Nothing to complain about. Very satisfied. 
Some additional nice things were the instructions. I am so use to the garbage instructions that look like they are Chinese rewrites that when I opened the box and found several manuals to do installations I was amazed. The manuals had plenty of pictures and appear to have been written by an American with consumer installation in mind. Very thoughtful. 
Also they included so much stuff from screws to screwdrivers with the unit I was impressed. 
This is how a startup earns raving fans. 
Last note. I called support on a Sunday afternoon to ask a very technical question since I am a nerd I wanted to know how the app and camera communicate with backend servers so I could isolate the network. The support line rang once and a human from America answered the phone. Very knowledgeable and answered my questions complete. 
Well done ring. 
Now how can I invest?

title: Pointless when it can’t access the video right away.
text: I have three ring doorbells because I think the idea of it is great, but they are totally unreliable. They typically capture people when they are walking away so it would be impossible to identify someone’s face. They rarely load when you try to access them live so don’t count on being able to talk to someone as they walk up unless they are willing to hang out for 2 minutes while the app “processes video”. Luckily I have hardwired cameras all around my house in case I need to access recordings. Also, it triggers ALL the time regardless of sensitivity. It’s either going off all the time, or not going off at all. I really hope they upgrade the software because they are pretty worthless at the moment. Just like everyone else who has left negative reviews, I have a super fast internet speed and no issues with my other WiFi cameras. If you have $100 to burn and are okay with them working 25% of the time then these are the cameras for you!

title: Good idea, still needs work
text: I have two ring doorbells, one original and one I guess is ring 2, no real designation on it. The idea is good, it works pretty well once you get it adjusted. One thing I find ridiculous is it’s ability to reconnect to WiFi if here is an outage. If it goes offline you can not reset it to WiFi unless you are home. Not very practical if you are NOT home. You have to push the button on side of it, which requires removing the cover as well...which you can’t do if you’re not there...so much for home security if it goes off line and doesn’t reconnect. It’s done this twice in two months of owning it. The other one has done it once in the couple months having it. Makes it kind of clumsy if you’re out of town and it goes down! Won’t work til you get back home to fix it! Most wireless equipment reconnects on its own, not this one for what ever reason...if you’re using it for security it may let you down!

title: Don’t waste your money
text: The concept is great but it doesn’t work for me. The motion sensors only go off after the person has already left. I can go dance in front of my camera for 10 min and nothing, no alerts. FedEx will come to my door, ring the door bell, open the screen door and leave a package, walk back to the truck and my motion sensors go off as he is pulling out of the driveway. So I don’t get a chance to say “sir could you leave that on the back porch please”. No one can understand anything I’m saying through the speakers anyway. And if I just want to look and see what’s going on in my back or front yard pressing live view takes several minutes to come up, if it does at all. I’ve been told this is an issue with my internet being too slow but my tv, computer and phones never have any problem. I have an open concept home and the router is a straight line from the door about 30 ft away. I purchased an extender though and it is 6 ft from the door. Still doesn’t work. I’m getting a professional wired system installed instead.

title: Great product!
text:
I love my ring products. I have the original doorbell, the doorbell pro, stickup-cam, and the chime pro! 

The products are amazing. I have had the original doorbell and stickup-cam almost a year now and the pro doorbell for 4 months. The motion detection were my biggest issues with the devices originally as I was getting too many alerts and then after adjusting some settings none! 

I called support and they told me that the doorbell and stickup-cam are heat activated motion detectors and that's why I was picking up cars and I just had to set the angle of my doorbell and stickup-cam better. It was easy for the stick cam but I needed a wedge kit for the doorbell. As soon as I received the wedge kit and put two on to angle it down it fixed my motion detection issue. 

I later wanted to buy the ring pro and it started to give me different issues. I had pixelated video and at times no video at all. I called support again and they told me the issue was the pro requires more bandwidth since it has a higher resolution. We did a Wifi speed test and they said all I needed was a Wifi extender. I got the chime pro and it fixed all those issues!

I love my ring products and I highly recommend it! Just make sure you have the speeds and bandwidth to run it since they are outside the home.

title: 3 for 3
text:
Great company, perfect for keeping your entire house (inside/outside) well protected and feeling secured. Notifications come through instantly allowing you to keep an eye on any and every section of the house you wish. It’s like carrying your house in your pocket, purse, or mobile vehicle of choice (no pun intended)!

My 3 for 3 (top 3 reasons for giving 3 stars)
1. When answering a Door Call (someone rings the doorbell 🥸) there can be significant lag from the time you’re able to open the app to the moment you can communicate with the person on the other side of the door.
2. When using the app to watch the previously recorded film 🎥, the volume rockets 🚀 to the MAX!! Even after I have lowered the volume all the way in an extensive effort to keep the 12 month old Olympic gymnast I have as a daughter from waking up and bouncing around.
3. Despite turning off the lights on my exterior floodlight cameras through every crevice of the app, they are still triggered by motion and turned on. So when I am hoping to enjoy a peaceful night on my patio, with family and/or friends by the fire pit, we are flooded by bug hoarding lights that must be tamed at the power source (we are forced to flip the light 💡 switch off; we sometimes forget to turn it back on).

Please fix these pain points and I will revisit my review. (@Developers, I understand the SDLC and will be extremely patient) thank you in advance!

title: I’ve been patient, but I’ll probably switch this year.
text: I installed the Ring Pro almost two years ago. I bought it because of the promise from Ring that it will be HomeKit compatible. My whole house is automated on HomeKit except my doorbell. I’ve seen the reviews that complain about motion triggering the camera, and I get a live view but not the event that triggered the camera. Let me add, I have a long history with electronics, computers, and networking, so the problem isn’t me. Ring promised HomeKit compatibly, but even if they keep that promise, will the device and software work better? I recently saw that there will finally be HomeKit compatibility, but I’d like to know when. I’ve given 2 stars for what can be a good product. Give me a date when you will release HomeKit compatibility and I’ll increase the review to 3 stars. Release it and I’ll increase to 4 stars. If it works reliably I’ll give 5 stars. By the way, I got three people to add Ring Pros to their homes. If I switch from yours, they plan to for the same reasons.

title: Big delays and poor connectivity
text: I bought the ring doorbell because of the amount of package theft and the growth in homelessness nowadays. The biggest complaint I have about the product is the “live view” option ... probably 90% of the reason I bought the product. I want to be able to see who is at my door (live) and exactly when. However, whenever I get a knock or when the doorbell rings, the app is great at notifying me; however, when I try to access live view, it takes minutes on end to get the live feed to load. By the time it finally connects (usually poor quality), the person is already walking away or is already gone. So...what’s the point. This defeats the entire purpose of why I purchased this product. I have the doorbell hardwired to my house, so it’s not a connection issue. I have spoken with multiple friends and family who have the same ring model as me, and it’s the exact same issue with them as well. I would not recommend Ring to those considering.

title: Nothing but a white screen...
text:
I was 100% happy with both the Ring doorbell and floodlight cam I purchased several months ago, but for some strange reason these last 2 weeks or so I’ll be away from home, get an alert for floodlight and when I go to view nothing loads just WHITE screen. Regardless of closing app, logging out, etc. etc. NOTHING!! Just WHITE screen. It only works when I’m home, but that defeats the purpose. Few minutes ago, I missed an alert for my doorbell and when I went into app to see who or what was at the door the event doesn’t show. Why? Before after a couple of minutes it would show in event history and now I’m lucky if it shows at all. Remind you nothing has changed since these cameras were setup other than the fact that I can’t do Live View away from home or view event history. I did pay for the annual subscription fee and I’m using iOS 11.4.1

UPDATE: Turned out the app needed to be updated.

title: No-go for nonsubscribers
text:
If you don’t want to pay every month to “subscribe” to your own video recordings, you really shouldn’t even bother with a Ring device in the first place. You’ll have a two-second window to whip out your phone at a notification to try to catch any live video feed or answer the doorbell, and if you miss this incredibly narrow window then you’re out of luck. Absurd. Or, y’know, just a typical company trying to screw their customers over for as much money as they can get away with. Business as usual.

[Edited here to respond to the dev response]
Yeah, I can pay an additional monthly fee for my multihundred dollar purchase to view the recordings that it’s always sending to YOUR private servers (Whether I pay for my OWN access to them or not!). I can’t look through my door camera whenever I want to. I can’t view an alert if I miss it by taking more than two seconds to view it. I can’t view anything unless I catch a live alert. I can’t answer the door if it takes me three seconds to do it. It’s a manipulative business model. You can make me happy if you change it.

title: Don't buy
text:
Video quality is not good, especially if you want to freeze for identification. Initially the Ring product worked well, I could view neighborhood alerts, great idea ! We've owned the product a few months, recently I cannot view the neighborhood alerts, only a black screen. There are no "Health" issues, internet speed, signal strength good, etc. The problem occurred around the same time they opened up access to everyone even if you don't have a Ring product, you can sign up for neighborhood alerts. Ironically I can "share" the neighborhood alerts to my email & view the video immediately.
Also the neighborhood alerts are arriving to our account 20-30 minutes after they've been posted, instead of immediately as occurred originally. I'm glad it's not an Amber alert where time is critical, but it's important to me. Their event history repeatedly shows, " No events", on every day when I know I've received many alerts. We never signed up for a beta program & we're very disappointed in the reduction of quality & service. It seems they've over sold their access to services.

title: Inadequate for motion alerts
text:
When Ring picks up motion (not a doorbell ring), I get an alert, then if I click on it within two minutes, it goes to live view. Sounds fine, but I want to know what caused the motion and by going to live view I can’t see what may have passed by the camera seconds before. If I back out of live view to view the motion, the recording is unavailable for another 2 minutes. 

Someone could be trying to enter my home, passing by a camera rather than idling in front of it, so this is a security barrier to me. I suggest giving the option to not immediately be taken to live view — as a setting option. Or just stop taking us to live view automatically and make the motion recording instantly available. I can choose from the UI where I want to go. Or split the screen so I can see live and the motion recording simultaneously. 

Also when I signed up for monthly service, the website was glitchy; confirming my subscription then it disappeared and I had to re-subscribe. This caused a delay in having access to my cameras.

title: Poor Quality in Comparison to Others
text:
I have had the Ring camera for 3 months now. The video quality is poor at best. During the day facial recognition is okay; however background images are extremely poor. For example, the camera is pointed directly at my mailbox and neighbor’s house yet the glare prohibits me from seeing what is right out my front door.

The camera is unreliable as far as motion detection. For example, I went out to start my car. The camera notified my phone of detected motion about 15 seconds later. When my daughter came out about 10 minutes later, no motion was detected or recorded. When I had ADT check my security system, he advised if there is motion occurrences close in time the Ring cam will not detect the 2nd motion.

I suggest trying the Vivint security system offered by Bestbuy. Lastly, don’t expect the live view feature to work. Most times the app won’t work. I have 100 mbps and still problems with Ring. Lastly, if you at least buy the door cam the Vivint security system uses, you will get a 360 degree image instead of the curvy distorted image/view the Ring cam gives.

title: Feature request
text: I have the Ring home alarm system with door sensors, motion detectors, range extender, and fire/CO detectors. My request is to have 2 different types of “Home” modes when arming the system:  one for when you’re leaving your home, where you have a countdown timer (user-definable) for exiting (this already exists, and you hearing chimes sounding for the duration of the timer), and one that just immediately *and quietly* arms the system when it’s late at night and everyone is already sleeping...no chimes!! Maybe you long-press the “Home” arming button, or maybe just add a separate button altogether. I’m happy with everything else so far (no cameras installed) and love the ability to tune the system the way I want and that fits my lifestyle, including volumes, sounds, timers, etc. Just add this very practical feature I’ve requested above and you’d have yourself a home run, 5 stars! Thank you.

title: Junk!
text: The ring two has been an expensive wall ornament since the day I hung outside my house. The issues started with the Network never connecting. So, set up took hours, even with the representitive help! Once joined, it only stays on sporadically for four-months, then later not turning on at all. The customer service representitive was helpful, but after hours on the phone coupled with the purchase of a new transformer and multiple Wi-Fi resets, it just stops working completely. I’m finally taking it off the wall. I would have brought it back to the place of purchase, but I reluctantly decided that since I purchased it on base at the Post Exchange I would trash it instead. In thirty years of shopping, I have never had to return an item for unsatisfactory performance. Besides, I never kept the receipt.  So, I would not return it, but I would write this review. I hope that enough of us complain about the product in PX stores that it will get removed from the shelves so that our hard-working service member never have the same experience.

title: Great products but not very accessible app
text:
This is a great thing and I really like the fact that I can use the phone to answer the door and hear who is on the other side without opening my door. The only thing I would say as to why I didn’t give it a 5 star rating is that there are many inaccessible parts of the app to me as a voiceover user. 
There are many unlabeled buttons, unlabeled radio buttons, even though I have no ability to see any motion that occurs that ring picks up I can show it to someone who is able to see except that in order to do that because I can’t use any of the buttons on the camera feed I have to turn off voiceover and basically hand my phone over to the sighted person I’m showing it to. 
I would be absolutely thrilled if you could look into making this app much more accessible for those of us who are blind or visually impaired. 
Your Ring Doorbell and Spot light camera  are outstanding.

title: Works great some of the time
text:
The app is pretty good. My only complaint with the app is that it’s buggy with reporting what is a new event or not. It will randomly indicate upwards of 30 new events and then zero. I’ve only successfully answered rings about half of  the time and it seems like he app stops responding. This could be issue with my phone, but I’d hope iPhone would be compatible. The actual doorbell is ok. It sometimes picks up a leaf blowing by and other times won’t register me waking right past it. Or sometimes it is slow to pick motion within the motion zones.

Edit: many of the glitches resolved over last few months- ring answering still happens too slow even with good connection. The new feature with multiple snapshots you can scroll either has a glitch with the time stamp and photos or there are lots of cars, people, and birds that become perfectly still in front of my house for 20 minutes at a time.

title: I was so happy
text:
I live alone in a big house with two dogs. I have a wrought iron gate a few steps off the front porch to keep my dogs in and my door safe. I have my ring doorbell attached to the gate. The live view as well as answering a ring is delayed and the picture from the camera has a fuzzy spot in the middle. I was told it was because the location of my ring was to far from the router for the lousy AT&T WI-FI. Had them move it closer and it’s still fuzzy and slow to respond? I do feel safer as I can look outside but get so many “false alarms” even after limiting the distance of the ring to flag? Would really appreciate an idea of what to do because I was going to buy a ring flood light but if the doorbell won’t work at 100% the floodlight sure won’t either. 

I think ring has a great idea and love the neighborhood heads up to thieves etc in the area but for the price I think it still needs some fine tuning. 

BTW:  AT&T said the WI-FI was set at an acceptable rate but I don’t know about that.

title: Don’t think is worth it.
text:
We’ve had our ring for about a year and a half. Great idea, IF it would work all the time. Alerts are almost always delayed. If I click on an alert as it comes in, most times it won’t even open. Motion is set up all day long by random things that we can never see; we’ve adjusted the range to the “shortest” range possible and it has not helped. It still goes off on cars driving by. My biggest issue, though, is the ring magically NEVER catches movement at night time. NEVER. Cars driving down the street, people walking around the neighborhood, NONE of it is ever caught on camera. So much so, that my boyfriend’s vehicle was broken into and the ring DID NOT CATCH A SINGLE THING.  The car is in plain view of the camera in the driveway. When he pulls is in the afternoon, he always sets it off and yet this didn’t catch a single thing at nighttime. 

Another big issue I have is connectivity. It hardly ever connects when I want to see the live view. Honestly, what is the point of this thing if it hardly ever works?!

title: Slightly unsatisfied
text: I am satisfied with the app and how I’m able to navigate through it and see who is at the front door but there is a slight downside that I really dislike. In the app, all my neighbors complain about the smallest noise that they hear and post every 10 minutes about “oh was that a gunshot that I heard or why is there a helicopter flying above.” There should be a two different forums where neighbors post real threats or actual videos from their nest camera and another forum for people that whine about the littlest thing or ask stupid questions. I hate getting notifications for the dumbest things. I want to get notifications for real footage that is concerning and not notifications for neighbors that are paranoid. I really hope that something is done for this problem and can be updated or that ring app moderators are more actively watching over these posts.

title: Like the concept; especially hate the delay
text:
Like most of the complaints, I too, experience the delay in receiving the video.  By the time the video is activated, the person is walking away, so I don’t get to see the face of the person.  Also, the first 2-3 seconds of the video is SO washed out or bright that you cannot make out the figure.  Yes I’ve tried repositioning the doorbell, moving it and even putting a shade over the top, but to no avail. I gave up checking the doorbell, unless there was someone at the door who was very patient or persistent.

When you share the app with someone, for example a family member who also checks the motion detection or doorbell at the instant your phone alerts you, I’ve noticed that only one of you will have access.  The other, won’t be able to have immediate access to the video.  I gave up checking, knowing the other person would check before me. 

I’ve played around with the zones for the motion detection SO often that I’ve concluded there is no happy medium.  Although I’ve set the zone as far in as it can go, it still senses when large vehicles, like a van or truck is passing by on the street.  I gave up with adjusting the motion detection and just let it detect whatever - even the Invisible Man!!!

Conclusion:  I won’t be extending my existing Ring doorbell with any other Ring products, I’m sad to say.  Like I said, I like the concept and there’s other similar products on the market  that I’ll be trying out.   I gave up on Ring.

title: Freezing Video
text:
I purchased my first Ring 2 back in May and it lasted until around October when most of the videos only showed a black screen.
We did receive the replacement one, but we started to develop freezing video for several seconds at a time on pretty much every video.  I called Ring Support who I have to say are very nice, but seem to blame the Rings issues on ones slow internet connection.  If I use their speed test off of their website called Bandwidth my download  speeds are close to 100 and upload speeds close to 6; by the router and by the Ring Doorbell.
When I use speedtest I receive download speeds of 120 and upload speeds of over 6, again by the router and the doorbell.
We received another replacement Ring doorbell and wouldn’t you know it, we once again have frozen videos for several seconds of the video.
I really like the product, but with solid numbers as it pertains to my internet speeds the freezing videos are annoying.

title: Response time greater than expected
text: Great concept but slower than what the ads show. I do like the product but for me it has a few issues. Don’t expect instant response to motion as the delay can be several seconds to much longer. I can usually get up and look out the window faster than seeing the video. This is especially frustrating when you’re away from home and want to see what’s going on. The system also disconnects from my wi-fi more often than I would expect, resulting again in not being able to view motion detection. Also, be aware you need 2 Mbps upload speed PER DEVICE in order to work. I purchased both Pro Doorbell and Spotlight Cam and couldn’t view motion detection on either because my upload speed is not high enough. I had to disconnect the doorbell as I felt the spotlight cam was more useful. Not sure if I want to spend $30 extra per month to upgrade with my ISP as I’m not convinced my Ring devices would work any better.

title: So far very lagging and not functional
text: Recently installed. High speed AC router in our home. Get notices but can't see anything a lot of the time or can't answer. The connection really seems to be delayed or not there at all. Instant notifications aren't really useful unless accompanied by the ability to see something, hear something and to be able to answer. So far it looks like it takes several minutes on average before I can even access any event info on the app. What if it was an intruder or burglar? That would be far too late. Disappointed especially given the price tag but will hope for improvement as they update things. We use nest cams and other gear without issue and was hoping ring could be a complementary tool. Jury still out for sure on that. Also, neighborhood beta is interesting but doesn't allow for any commenting or collaboration which really needs to be there for the neighborhood tool to be an effective means of expanded awareness.

title: Customer Support is not helpful
text: This company has gotten too big too fast and can no longer support its product.  It is impossible to get a support rep that knows how to fix your problem.  My light schedule for flood light cam rarely works as it supposed to and it is completely random.  Lights will come on as scheduled (maybe) and then go off at some random time before they are scheduled to go off.  Even if I turn them on manually they will still often turn off at some random time later.  The support rep tried to check the time zone setting but I told him when the lights do come on it is at the right time and then of course the chat session ended because no activity because he never came back.   If I did not already have a complete ring system I would go with a different system.  Way too many quirks now and they just keep getting bigger.  Then need to fix their stuff.

title: Useless app, bad product, awful cust. service.
text: It takes at least 30 seconds to load live view which is more than enough time for the thing or person that alerted you to be long gone. Sometimes it doesn’t load at all. The only way around this is to pay for a subscription to see recordings which still doesn’t help the load time or sluggish app performance. Also they removed the night vision toggle option and my doorbell is stuck in IR mode. I tried to get the unit replaced but I just happened to be 2 months out of warranty and wouldn’t you know it, I didn’t buy the warranty extension when I had the chance. After an hour on the phone with three different people, Ring admitted the device shouldn’t be broken and offered me 35% off a new doorbell. I told them I’d rather not replace my doorbell every year and a half. They then assured me the doorbell should last at least 3 years before needing to be replaced. I’m not sure how this was supposed to make me feel better. Don’t buy Ring or use this app.

title: Burglars can’t be reported to app by outsourced labor checking!
text: This app is good for nothing! It comes with a neighbor report social media page for a neighborhood watch. TWICE I reported creepers. Once looking at my hardware tools under lock and key in my backyard trying to break into my fence by hand until they saw it was locked, and two last night when another couple walked by loitering photographing my home surely to rob it later. Each time I get told by someone paid nothing by Ring likely in India that these reports cannot be posted under suspicious people or any category because I am making “false accusations.” This app is trash. The cameras look like 2002 homework project camera footage you made. I can excuse that but no, I’m having people trespass into my yard to steal my tools and now trespassing taking photos of a home not for sale, and Ring won’t let me out them to my neighbors???!? Please go use Nest or any other service. I would rip everything out if I hadn’t installed Ring myself!

title: In theory, great. In practice, probably not a product they should be charging for
text:
I’ve had so many problems with my ring doorbell. I can’t imagine I’m the only one. There are two main types of problems I have. And they only started happening like a month or two ago

First, I’ve set up the location of my porch so that I only get notified when there’s motion on my doorstep, and not just when people walk by on the paths. The feature simply doesn’t work. I’ve set it up multiple times, but it constantly notifies me when people walk or drive by, nowhere near my porch. 

Second, when somebody rings my doorbell, I click on the notification, which takes me to the screen to show my camera, except it mostly doesn’t ever load. I can let it load for ten minutes, and it still won’t show me who is at the door. It works sometimes, but less than half the time. Kind of defeats the purpose of having a smart doorbell. 

I also can’t seem to get any sort of support from Ring. Their customer service forms seem to be unusable. Like when it asks for your email address. I’ll type it in, but when I submit the form it clears the text field and tells me I need to input a valid email address. (To the developers, If you make the form submit before clearing the text field, this won’t be a problem anymore.)

Anyway, it’s just frustrating. Considering switching to Nest. Wondering if that’s any better.

title: Potential to improve
text:
After a month long use of this app with my new ring doorbell pro, here is what I think about this. At this stage I see the cons overshadow the pros which is a shame considering how good the hardware is. 

Pros: 1) Does a good job in detecting motion. 

Cons: 1) There is a lag from the time the notification is sent to the time you are able to view the video. As soon as you click the motion detected notification, most of the times you won’t find anybody at your door. If the courier guy left the parcel, you wouldn’t know who caused the alert until you go back to the video that got recorded. 
2) If you want to view the video that was recorded due to a motion detected, you have to refresh the app and wait for atleast a min before the video is available for viewing. Within a min, the guy has already left the door, what’s the point if I can’t view the video immediately at the time the motion is detected.
3) The response time of the app needs to be improved. It takes a few secs from the time you click the live view to the time you can actually view the live video.
4) Does not allow 2 way communication using echo show. Currently can only view the live video using echo show without communicating. That means at night, I have to look for my phone, turn the app on to talk to someone on the door when I have echo show right next to me.

This is a brilliant hardware that cannot live to its full potential due to software integration issues.

title: Ring is on a quest to make the least functional app
text:
Here’s what I don’t get: I’ve had a ring camera for 5 years now. I’ve updated them, added more but the one thing that never changes is that they have taken a semi-functional interface and continue to big it down with features nobody wants or uses. So it’s buggy, slow, dysfunctional. The most recent update’s ‘bad to worse’ angle is that when I click on a notice, it literally opens up TWO windows with TWO spinning wheels that I have to wait to load. God forbid someone actually break into your house, the thief would be in and out while the app is still trying to process the signal thanks to Ring’s inability to manage their interface. Sorry Ring, no more devices for me. There has to be a better competitor out there that works the way Ring’s app and hardware USED to work. 
I am on a phone that is less than 3 months old with the latest system software…if this thing won’t run Ring’s buggy and slow app, it’s not working efficiently on any iPhone.

title: Worked good last year, concerned with privacy issues
text:
I’ve been a Ring customer for almost a year. Lately, the app and it’s functionality have been faulty. The Ring bridge doesn’t work as it should. The group lights says they’re on when they aren’t. And if you turn the switch to off, it switches back to on and yet the lights are actually off physically. When you turn on the group lighting, it doesn’t work or turn on as a group as it is supposed to do.  It was working before I upgraded the app recently. The lights connected to the bridge also turn on and off intermittently. And when checking the history, it says that it’s been turned on and off when we haven’t done so.

Is this Amazon’s way so that I would link Alexa to Ring? It’s the only thing I haven’t tried.  It should work properly regardless of whether I connect to Alexa or not. 

I’m concerned about the privacy issues with Ring. And the fact that its employees have been found to tamper with private home accounts. Furthermore, some employees are said to be offshore employed in Eastern Europe and I don’t really feel comfortable with that idea of those employees having the ability to check on American homes. 

This is unacceptable since I’ve invested over $2200 on Ring equipment including cameras, indoors and outdoors, lights, Chime Pros, sensors, all of it. Again, the group lighting doesn’t function as it should.  My wifi signal is strong and yes, I’m familiar with tech (IT admin). 

Please get this working. Thanks.

title: Too slow to be useful
text:
I have the Ring Door bell. I have it connected to power. The battery is always at 100%. So power is not the issue. My WiFi is very strong. The router is near the front door. It seems like I’m always recording people’s backs as they are leaving. The only way I can improve the trigger response time is to run the sensitivity up all the way. But unfortunately, I have a street 40 feet from my house. EVERY car triggers the motion sensor. I’ve tried every possible setting. I finally decided to leave the sensitivity up all the way. I set the alert volume very low and I simply ignore all the false triggers. Luckily, there isn’t much traffic on my street. It’s more important to me that everything gets recorded. 

I never try communicating with visitors. There is too much lag time before the live video stream starts. By that time, people are already leaving. 

In summary, it’s better than just having a standard door bell. But it’s certainly not what I expected.

title: Ring Changed My Life
text: I know that sounds like an extreme statement but the Ring cameras replaced thousands of dollars of cameras on my properties that never worked right and required constant maintenance from a company that was very hard to contact. Ring always gave me the assistance I needed to take care of any issues -which were rare -with a human being on the phone. No appointment necessary!! No extra charges for service!! They have 100% given me the ability to keep track of my home and my business. They have saved me money with my insurance company. They have given me a sense of security I never had before and I am grateful for Ring every day. At this point in my life I could not live without the Ring family of cameras and security and the solar panels are an added bonus. Thank you Ring!

title: Issues with the most recent app update
text: While I appreciate having an app on both my iPhone and my iPad for the ring cameras, and it mostly functions well. I am annoyed by apps that will not keep the iPad in the landscape mode, and rotate the app screen when I’m holding the iPad width-wise. While most of the ring apps screens work in the landscape mode, a recent update changed this orientation for just the timeline view. So when I select a camera in the app, while holding the iPad width-wise (landscape mode) when the timeline opens for the camera, the ring app rotates so that the top of the screen is rotated 90 degrees counter-clockwise. But when leaving the timeline screen, it goes back to the landscape mode. While it does not make the app unusable, it is annoying. I’m hoping that ring will fix this, but there does not seem to be a way to submit any bugs or issues with the app specifically. So having a feature in the app to submit issues would be helpful as well.

title: Every time I think ring has they do an update
text: The latest update is killing my hardwired ring doorbells. I have five of them and all five are hardwired and the batteries are not charging.  During a time like this when people are out of work and I would feel safer with cameras, I feel a lot less safer with ring putting out bad updates and killing the batteries. It says in the app that they are all hardwired as they have been for some time but the power state for all are all well below 100%. I used to feel safe with ring and was a fan but I am not having much faith in this time of need.  And the ring light cameras are not doing much better since the update, I have four of those.  It constantly says poor connection despite being right next to a router on the wall or an extender.  Takes for ever to connect.  Same thing is new with latest update.  And I am sure as with the last time an issue happened with an update it will take over a month to fix and the crisis with the virus will be over.   An unhappy ring customer here....

title: Worthless Device - Lame App
text: Was an expensive doorbell compared to other options. Hired a electrician to install it. It would not setup. Literally spent 2-3 hours with tech support for them to decide to send me a new one. The new one arrived, same deal. Another couple of hours, this time on the phone with tech support. Basically the guy wanted me to turn off my router’s firewall so this doorbell would work. I figured out it was a different issue all together. Any way, it’s been installed for 18 months and has never been consistent in its performance. Yes there is a wall between the router and the doorbell. The doorbell is outside. The router is less than 10 feet from the doorbell. It had never connected fast enough for me to be able to communicate with the person before they left. There is no, none, not even a seconds worth of recordings without pay a hefty monthly fee. I am in the process of selling this piece of junk and buying a standard doorbell and a separate camera. Good luck if you just bought one. I’d try to return it.

title: Disappointed
text: I have had the Ring 2 for less than a week and I will be asking for a return and refund.  When I get a notification on my phone and click the notification, I can see my door, but after a car has gone by or my husband is almost in the house.  The camera and the notification does not give you much of a pre-warning when there is motion.  I walked out of my house, went to the mailbox which is around the corner and came back home.  I was never picked up by the camera walking up to my door, stepping on the porch or entering my home.  NEVER.  I did a test the day before of walking up to my door, by coming from the garage to the door.  I was never picked up on camera.  I find when the chime goes off when my husband is leaving the house, it takes at least a minute before I can see the video.  Plain and simple, someone will be in the house before the chime goes off.  When I called Ring, I was asked what type of material was on the floor between the downstairs and upstairs, what was the trans something speed of my doorbell. REALLY? Why would I know that?

title: Finally works
text: This App finally works like it’s supposed to. After numerous phone calls to the support desk complaining about opening up “ Live View” and it took almost 30 seconds to open up if it ever did and the other times it would just keep spinning indefinitely. Support would just pass it off as if my internet connection was bad even though they were at Rssi-45 and Rssi-38. Finally ,now when I go into“Live View” or get a notification it takes less than 2-3 seconds to view which is now acceptable. They knew it was bad because they offered me credit on my yearly subscription. Whoever fixed this deserves a raise because I was about to trash these Ring products after my contract was about to expire. Keep up the good work and keep those updates going!

title: Fix the lag!!!
text: The entire concept behind having a Ring doorbell is that it allows you to answer the door immediately, even when you are not physically able to do so. Unfortunately, with the lag time, you can’t answer the door before people leave. I had a delivery from FedEx recently, and the FedEx man rang the bell, waited about 15 seconds, and headed back to his truck. Had I been able to pick up the ring doorbell immediately, I could have told him to hold on just a second, as I was heading downstairs. Not being able to answer the ring immediately defeats the purpose. Also, I’d like to know why my ring doorbell doesn’t pick up any movement from midnight to 5 AM every day. I know there are cars that go by, because I hear them. I have checked my settings, and I don’t have it set to turn off during that time. My ring doorbell is hardwired, so it should not have such a lag time. I have a good Internet provider. Please, for the love of pete, FIX THIS PROBLEM.

title: Forced subscription, no HomeKit
text:
Edit: the device just stopped working a few days ago. Never ordering from this sham of a company that infringes my privacy and yet doesn’t fulfill its promises.

Pros: The UI is nice, the chimes are a good feature for a multi level home. I can customize the motion zones and see notifications from neighbors.

Cons: I hate that they almost force you to pay to subscribe. The video takes forever to load (live feed) by which time the event has already passed, and then I can’t see the recorded video of the event if I don’t have a subscription. They sent me a new device and that worked better but it’s still quite slow. Not to mention that the long promised HomeKit support is probably not going to happen, because that’s going to eat into their subscription revenues. I can’t believe I paid $250 for this crap on top of the $30 subscription. LaView has launched a $100 doorbell camera that lets me record onto my own NVR. I’m going to dump this device if don’t see HomeKit soon, which really is the only remaining motivation.

title: Peace of Mind!
text:
We recently moved out of state, and since we were unfamiliar with the area, we wanted more security. ADT recommended the Ring doorbell, and I'm SO glad they did!  We got a device for our front and back to monitor motion. LOVE being able to see who is at the door while I'm away and before I answer. Communicating while I heard the dogs outside for repairmen (lol) is a huge plus. Hopefully we never have to use the recorded video to prove something, but it gives me peace of mind. 

App is super easy to use. You can set times you are typically home to avoid getting a motion alert everytime you step outside. 

Customer service is awesome!  We were having difficulty with live view on our front door due to house layout and router location, so Ring sent us a Chime Pro to extend our wifi free of charge. Great service! Definitely recommend.

title: Ok for very basic needs
text: This is not a sophisticated system it is not a real security system if you have real security concerns pony up 3k and get a professional hard wired system installed. I have two wireless solar cameras buy the solar panels no ladder needed every week to charge batteries!! They pick up motion well in day or night. But, they record only 30 seconds, so it’s only a snapshot of what’s going on. And it won’t record movement shortly after the initial 30 seconds meaning you might capture someone coming up to your house briefly but then nothing of them cleaning out your house if they hang around. The one feature I like the best is the live view it lets me see what’s going on around the house when I’m away or I can see if my garage door is open or closed. I can talk to delivery people or friends who I know are there. Cameras picks up things blowing on the wind or bugs buzzing around. Overall it’s a ok limited system for very basic monitoring of your yard.

title: Don’t buy
text: Constant connectivity problems, devices need charging way too frequently, solar panels for charging are available but unsightly- we got them bc we didn’t know otherwise we wld have to take the cams down for like-constant charging. So if u position them high like any normal user of security cams, u have to be able to access and reach them to disconnect them and charge them. On top of this hassle, the screws and screwdriver are proprietary and not sold even at Home Depot- was a total pain when I needed a new screw to re-fasten a bracket. Lastly, the app is a POS-clunky and super slow. Several motion alerts have come through that I tap to answer and the turtle-like app processes for a solid 2 minutes before popping up a live view- totally unhelpful for security purposes. It’s also not a connectivity issue- I have a dedicated T3 special WiFi connect for my home business, and ALL of my other devices stay reliably connected and my apps whiz open and closed. Just the ring hardware has problems, and just the ring app doesn’t work. This was a giant waste of money and time.

title: Saves going down and up the stairs
text:
Don’t know about your neighbourhood but I have several people ringing my bell, often times after dark. The ring doorbell does exactly as advertised. High quality video, even at night. Save me time and having to trudge down the stairs only to find that it’s a solicitor or religious group I don’t belong to. Storage is cheap and well worth the low price. 

I’m also used to have concerns for my wife’s safety when I’m not home. With the ring she knows who is at the door and can talk to them. Good sound and great video. We have been in Florida and talked to a person.

I had some problems setting it up and getting reliable connectivity however Ring engineers walked me through the troubleshooting process and now it works flawlessly. Only suggestion is to improve the time to bring up the app on my iPhone and be ready to talk. It’s not terrible but it could be improved.

title: Not reliable (Fixed)
text:
The cameras are supposed to let you set schedules so that you don’t receive alerts at certain times of the day.  Setting up the schedule is a piece of cake.  The problem is that half the time, the system doesn’t turn the alerts back on and they will remain turned off until you figure it out and turn them back on manually, or come home to an empty house.  I’ve spoken to seven “support” people at ring, nobody can figure this out.

Update: Kaitlyn got me in touch with a different team that was able to get my alerts to turn back on when coming off schedule.  Updating to 4 stars until they provide an update that will allow us to control the motion alert schedule based on the status of the alarm.  In other words, send me alerts to motion in the yard if the alarm is set to Away.  Don’t send me alerts when the alarm is Disarmed (I’m home so it’s probably me).

title: Keeps getting worse!
text: Have over 100mbps and can stream Netflix quickly half a block away. My router is next to my door and the speeds are there. I have reset my ring and tested different bands and channels to get it to function properly. Complaint is that the lag in the app is horrible. I cannot look at video when people ring the door bell. Again I’ve tested network streaming 4K video on tv, 2 iPads and a phone streaming HD video. Not only does the lag make the app pointless and useless, it is also turning into Nextdoor. I see less videos and more posts about a dog loose or “Was that a gun shot or firework?” After barley over a year of ownership and 6 months of frustrating use I am starting to look elsewhere. When it does work the camera misses crucial moments or doesn’t start recording at all. We had two scooters stolen in front of our house. They stole one by carrying it and the camera didn’t pick up until they were almost out of view with the second one. I feel the product cheated me and the social media aspect of the app is making it worse.

title: Great, but...
text: I enjoy the convenience of being able to see what’s going on around my home while I’m away. The Ring, coupled with my home alarm system, gives me a little bit of peace. The camera functions as intended and I really haven’t had any issues. My only complaint is video playback. It is entirely too time consuming to playback an entire day worth of motion alerts when you literally have to sit there and watch without the ability to fast forward. This is the only functionality I think the ring app is missing. It would be so much easier to fast forward and quickly identify if the motion alert was simply some random passerby, just a car/animal, or an actual threat to your home. My ring sometimes will record for up to 5 minutes and I have to spend an entire 5 minutes watching the video only to see that it was nothing. Please, please, please implement an option to speed up the recording to save us some time!

title: Pretty incredible honestly
text: I upgraded security recently and was nervous about finding the right system. I researched for weeks until I found a couple that I was pretty much looking for. Obviously I went with Ring - and let me tell you - Ring delivered. It doesn’t get easier than this. The instructions are seriously some of the best I’ve ever seen in a product - ever. Amazingly the interface is incredibly easy to navigate as well. I found out each camera is very simple to customize and play around with. The app is a joy to use, and it’s incredibly useful to making sure your system runs smooth. Highly recommend Ring. I am pretty impressed with the overall quality and features. I think they’re totally worth the investment.

title: No longer impressed
text: I bought this ring doorbell about a month ago for peace of mind and security. However the lag time when trying to review something that just happened is concerning. It takes anywhere from a minute and up to be able to see who “was” at your door because they are no longer there. Also when the doorbell is rung the same lag is happening where I’m not able to speak to the person because they are no longer there. If I am able to speak the boi e is so distorted I can barley understand. But tonight is what made me write this review. There motion at my door and you can clearly see a still image of someone but when trying to review the video, magically, the is no video to be viewed. My daughter was home alone and she could hear the man talking on the other side of the door but I couldn’t say anything to the person because the stupid video was evidently erased. I am truly regretting buy this product, would not recommend.

title: Improvements needed
text:
Purchased three spotlight camera for a vacation home in 2017 and at first they worked really well- clear images, good sound quality, timely alerts.  A few months later we purchased the solar panels hoping this would alleviate us from having to go up to the house to charge the batteries (we didn’t want to run hard electrical lines).  The panels worked well, for a while....

Pros: 
- easy to install on your own
- aesthetically pleasing 
- Monthly fee is reasonable (especially if you have multiple cameras)
- picture quality is very high
- sound quality is good

Cons:
- maintenance is on your own with some guidance over the phone
- solar panels do not work.  The battery/camera loses charge even faster than before we had hooked them up to solar.
- a black bar appears on the video for the first few seconds which blocks the view of what is moving AND you can’t remove that black bar
- the video capture is delayed too long.  The time of motion to video capture is too wide of a gap.  There have been too many occasions where we’ve missed who ran up to the door and dropped off a package
- starred videos are supposed to stay in your queue forever, but they don’t. They disappear after a month.  Best to download any videos of interest to store them on your own.

With the development of video surveillance there may be better options out there now.

title: Spend more $$ to upgrade to Ring Pro with worst results
text:
I have been using the original Ring over 2 years and had no real issue besides the delay wake up when motion is detected. I contacted support and they have been great. They helped me with setting up an upgrade from the original ring to the ring pro. After the upgrade, there has been nothing positive that has come about this change. 
I no longer am able to have any voice conversations with the person at the door as the audio and video skips every 2 seconds. Before saying my WiFi is bad, I have checked and it is at RSSI -53 and at 4044 for the voltage. I just upgraded the transformer as we thought it was most likely there wasn’t enough power going to the ring pro. I also have a Ring Chime Pro installed halfway. It’s going on 3 weeks now troubleshooting with Ring support and they don’t seem to know what the issue is. I am leaning towards the issue with the App since viewing live view on a windows PC doesn’t have any lag for audio or video, but the problem occurs no matter which iPhone/iPad I use.

title: Not dependable
text: Just before my 1yr warranty expired, I started experiencing (1) delays when trying to answer an alert. It will spin for over a minute before providing a live view, by which time, the person has left. I’ve checked my wi-fi connectivity both at home and when away and there are no issues so not sure why it’s so delayed (2) the doorbell randomly going offline and I have no idea it’s offline until someone tells me they stopped by and I check the doorbell and it’s offline. I’ve taken it through the troubleshooting and haven’t identified any issues with power or WiFi. For these two reasons, my Ring doorbell is no longer reliable. However, as another reviewer stated, the customer service is excellent and they will patiently work with you to resolve issues but the above issues are ongoing so not sure if it’s a defect in doorbell, incompatibility with updates or something else but would like it to work again.

title: Just…..terrible
text: After all these years, this Ring app is still horrific. The multi-select for deletion has not been updated in ages, if ever, and continues to be a cumbersome error-prone process. If you don’t touch that little select circle perfectly, it starts playing the video and you’re back to square one. Then when you are successful at one page full of videos, there’s a delay telling you that you just deleted them. But there’s no option for undelete…….so why the confirmation?? You give us no choice! Finally, if you use motion detection as so many do, and you choose to snooze motion for a predefined time, it only snoozes on that device that you’re using at the moment. So if you have an iPhone and iPad as an example, and you snooze on your iPhone, then you go mow your lawn you come back to 30 videos on your iPad! Motion snooze is a best pointless, but definitely useless! Make the snooze universal, not device-specific. Otherwise it’s a major battery drain (unnecessarily) for the wireless cameras.

title: Much left to be desired
text: The concept of this security system is very nice. That’s why my family invested in a few of its products. I must say, however, that I have been left underwhelmed. The alerts are 19/20 delayed and you can’t even see that someone has been at your door. Some alerts come from nothing even with the sensitivity not super high. We also have the system connected to our 5GHz WiFi, yet the ring app will often say “activating device” when trying to look at live view. We’ve had the same problems with low and high battery. These issues are not unique to just me as I have seen several other customers express them. They need to be addressed, and to be frank, it’s not going to help for a person to reiterate what they said in their review in an email. All we want is for someone to fix these issues. That’s it. Otherwise it would be a great investment.

title: Used to be good
text:
The app used to be so simple and easy to use. I want a simple list of my events. I do not like to scroll sideways through events when on the camera view. This is not user friendly at all. Perhaps allow the customer to select the view they want. 

The app no longer records many events such as when people ring my doorbell. Also, I like to watch deliveries when the doorbell is not touched and these events are not even recording. 

I like the home/away feature but why does it have to take up 20% of the main screen. I never use this because I want my cameras recording all of the time. There is already a timer setting for when we do not want it to record or not receive notifications when we are home. Why does this have to be the first and most obvious setting on the page? I want to see my cameras and subsequent list of history of events with dates and times. Please change the app back and keep it simple.

title: Getting Ridiculous
text: Equipment wise, I only have the doorbell.  Though folks have been complaining about the delay to record issue for years, it seems to fall on deaf/uncaring ears.  The one redeeming quality was that people can share videos of crimes or suspicious people.  Lately, however, the app is being used as a social media platform that has nothing to do with Ring videos.  If someone hears a siren, a police helicopter, or some noise, invariably there’s a half dozen people jumping on the app “Did anyone else hear that?  What’s going on?”, as if someone else is clairvoyant and magically knows what only the police do.  Given that a post causes an alert to be sent out to a whole bunch of people, Ring should restrict posts to only those associated with a Ring video.  The NextDoor app is where this other nonsense should be taking place, particularly since Ring posts are anonymous.  When posts are anonymous, kids get on the app and send out bogus alerts as well.

title: Devil in the details - needs more work
text:
So I have several cameras and the security equipment/sensors - that seem to work ok. But the app is trying to do too many things at once (security, alarms, and cameras) and sensitivity needs to be improved. 

I hate that I get a notification that someone is at the door (motion or doorbell), click on the notification, then it takes upwards of 20 seconds to load (if at all). I usually get the backside as they’re walking out of frame. 

The settings need to be improved to distinguish between a car driving by and someone standing at my door. With multiple cameras facing a busy road, I was getting so many false alarms to the point I just turned them all off. (What’s the point?)

Also with bad settings, we just went through the first snow storm - every flake seemed to be a new notification. If that monitor setting can’t be changed, at least give me a wider range (like 12/24 hours) that the alert can be snoozes. 

When it does correctly sense motion, it doesn’t do a good job or recording prior to the event. My videos typically start as the person or car has turned around. 

The security side also needs some TLC. For example I received alerts that the water/temp monitor had detected cold temps - ok, how cold? I do like that each sensor can be adjusted as needed. Love the integration with Alex - but wish I could add it to the routines. (Like leaving the house, turns off all lights, sets the alarm, etc.)

title: Worked fine until the last update
text:
I loveD using this product. However after the latest update about 6 days ago, I have been having so many problems with trying to use it! First, i will get a notification that there is a motion and when I go to view it, it completely disappears and says it’s not available. Second, I have been trying to use the live view option and I can’t even get through to that either!

It is not my WiFi connection because my WiFi was tested over 20 Mbps for both download and upload. I also took the battery out which was only around 70% to try to give it a little break and charge it up all the way- that didn’t help!

We had a motion at 3am the other night and because of the stupid update I am not able to see who it was and what they were doing outside that late!!! It currently feels like no security at all because it’s not working correctly. Please fix these issues.

title: Love it and hate it...
text:
We have had our Ring for a year and a half.  What I love about it:
Able to answer wherever we are and I can log in to see what's going on in the area with my fellow Ring neighbors.  If there are shady characters in the neighborhood ringing doorbells you can send out the video and alert others.  Net like is you can set the range of motion!  At first I was getting motion announcements every 45 minutes to and hour!  But then I found out you can set range of motion.
What I don't like:
My door is set back from the front of the house and all I get is backlight, unless there is actually someone standing right in front of the camera or when the sun starts to set.  And when someone rings the bell, it takes up to 30 seconds for my app to actually bing to tell me someone is there.  By then they have given up on someone answering and turn to walk away and all I get is their back.  Last thing is motion capture... If I receive a package... The motion turns on after the driver is taking off!  And I have the the distance set for 30 ft. 

All in all I would rather have it then not.  It is a great product and would recommend to anyone.  Last note....  you need high speed internet to make it work!  We tried with minimum and the picture was blocky if it worked at all!  And make sure your wifi router or wifi extension is close to the door for proper video quality.

title: Depends
text:
The camera is great….just depends on the level of determination from those that have malicious intent….aka professional criminals.  Speaking to ring support my issues were not the camera it was interference from outside source.  I agree. Cameras are great, infrared night vision fantastic. WiFi interference from those that want to get on my property at 2AM and I have no ability to get my cameras back online.  Customer Service was great called three times, called the sheriff also, and at 8AM called the fourth time to speak to a higher level tech specialist.  

Before this WiFi invasion/takeover happened, my camera captured suspicious events. Never a person, just there flash lights, or them triggering my security lights and other weird incidents. I posted the appropriate videos showcasing suspicious activity on Ring’s Neighbor app, but my videos/posts were deleted because my descriptions did not prove safety concerns.  Thanks Ring.

title: Love the concept, wish it worked
text: Love the concept of a video doorbell. I have encountered several issues with the ring app. The first being the delay in when the video starts recording. I will always get notifications of trucks driving by my house and will see the truck driving down the street but for some reason when people are walking up to my house the video does not start to record until the door opens and they are already in the house or once they are walking away from the door, which isn’t helpful for me to see who is coming to the house. The second issue I have is with the processing time when I get the notification. When I get a notification that someone rang the doorbell and open the app, it takes about 1-2 minutes for the video to process and for me to be able to watch the 30 second clip of who rang the doorbell. By the time I am able to see the clip the person is long gone.

title: Late recording
text: Overall a good product but I have to say I’m a bit disappointed with the response time for recording. Often times I can enter my house and the video doesn’t start recording until after I’ve close the door which is extremely disappointing considering package theft which happens within a matter of seconds and the camera is not detecting movement soon enough. I have adjusted the sensitivity to a wider zone which actually picks up trash trucks going down the street 20-30 feet away from the camera but yet things in close proximity often don’t get picked up soon enough for proper video capturing. I’ve noticed this problem while viewing other ring user videos on the neighborhood app and it seems to be fairly common problem. The device was operating perfectly for about a year and then something happened (possibly from an update) so now there is a delay in the sensitivity and video capturing.

title: Service from good to bad
