text: I bought the ring security system starter. It comes with a motion sensor, a door window sensor, a base station and a keypad.  I intended to add sensors once I determined that it all works. I had some start up problems and called Support. The response was excellent, I connected by phone quickly with a tech who worked with me patiently. After several calls they determined that I needed a replacement contact sensor and promised to ship it to me immediately. After 10 days I had not received it. I called and was told that there was a shipping error and that they would over night ship the sensor. This was followed by an email saying it was shipped and would arrive in one to two days.  The next day I received a notice that a replacement sensor  had been ordered for me and I would be advised when it was shipped. At this time I have no promised delivery date but have been advised I will be charged for retail value for the sensor if I don’t return the old one within 30 days of this notice.

title: Disappointing
text:
We had issues with our ring doorbell pro about 6-7 months after buying it. The picture is very very fuzzy/distorted, the voice option makes this loud squeal periodically and you can’t hear and the person at the door can’t hear. My biggest issue is the live view not working. We bought this for safety of our family and daughters. It doesn’t work seemingly when you need it most! It’s a gamble to open it and see live view or will It be not working. We have written the company several times asking them to please replace the doorbell because there is definitely something wrong with it. We have yet to have a response after 7 contacts with the company. I recently sent one last email to ring asking for a replacement of an obvious defective product. If not rectified quickly, we will be researching another company/ product and replace the ring.
I will Update on ring replacement or the products we have researched and their pros and cons in 2-3 weeks.

title: Pretty good, could use some minor tweaks
text:
I haven’t had a lot of the problems that other people seem to be experiencing. I get notified in time to see people heading towards my door.

 I do have one small issue that I think could be improved. I want notifications when there is any kind of movement in my front yard or driveway. I have it zoned perfectly and it worked perfectly...until the sun went down. After that, when cars would drive by the shadows they cast would trigger motion in my front yard. Would it be possible to be able to put different sensitivities during day/night mode? Like “people only” mode during night and “any” during day? I think that would be perfect. Then I could know that someone pulled into my driveway during the day and have it so it’s not alerting me any time a car drives by at night.

title: Love it but.....
text: What I don’t like is it doesn’t pick up the motion I need fast enough! Most the time it doesn’t start recording or trigger till the person is walking away.... works great though to double check if my kids got home on time. Or if they was to go out after I was in bed. So seeing their backsides are able to be detected on which one is coming or going, but I’d like it to trigger sooner to see faces of unexpected guest. Backsides won’t do me any good if something bad happen... also my speaker is don’t loud enough to talk through it....also should just sell it with a second battery! Battery only last a few weeks and takes hours to charge.... so then your without a camera for that time.... I ordered a second one of course, but the experience would be better if you just sold it with two :) I definitely like it, enjoy it and will keep it! But needs those improvements.... maybe we can get a software update idk

title: Trash
text: The app works 50% of the time. And when it finally does work, the person who was at your door is now gone because it takes forever to open. Customer service will tell you it’s you wifi that’s the issue. It’s funny how the ring app is the only one I have a issue with. They also said if I want a better picture with less white wash, I need to buy the newer gen ring. So basically they said the one I have is not good. They told me my ring was no good? Really guys! That’s smart. And don’t try to use the neighborhood chat to ask questions about the app or how others are fixing issues. They won’t post it. The chat is for crime or lost pets only. But when people heard a loud car drive by that’s big news. What a joke. Even if you follow the listed guide lines for the chat, if they don’t want others to see you asking questions about app issues or how to fix it, they flag it and email you saying it doesn’t follow their guide lines.  What a joke. If I could give it 0 stars I would’ve.

title: App delete function
text: Although I love the system (5 stars) it provides peace of mind and is easy to use I have an issue with the app’s functionality. There is a real issue with the delete function on the app (2 stars). It is almost impossible to delete more than one event at a time. If you don’t click EXACTLY within the circle in a list of events you are tying to delete, it halts the process and you are then not able to continue deleting the list of events. When that happens the little trash can vanishes from the bottom of the page and you must start all over again. This is extremely frustrating. I do not have large hands, and do not use a stylist on my phone, there needs to be larger circles or they need to be less sensitive and allow for larger area to be tapped. Also, the trash can should not disappear when you are in the delete view.

title: Good app: it informed me of Ring's invasive, absurd data-collection & -storage practices.
text: Seriously--check it out right here in the app-store listing's "privacy" section. And be sure to read the fine print in the section UNDER the one about Ring's "on by default" practices one can opt out of, because you'll see that the most objectionable stuff, you can't opt out of. And I'm talking about info isn't at all reasonably connected to my home security. I, in a very, very high-floor apartment with only one entrance and a patio that no one's going to be crazy enough to scale this building to get to--I can stay safe with a simpler, less invasive system. For folks in houses, I hope ADT or some other company will serve you well without appalling data-collection & -storage practices---unless you're not that concerned about your info security & privacy, which is likely not very wise. The closest I've come to "criminal activity" was a few pieces of printer paper yesterday from the business center where I live. But there's that saying: even non-criminals put curtains on their windows.

title: Something is going down and it happens to be the quality of Ring all around.
text: I have the Ring Pro and service is very slow. App takes forever to load and display video when answering rings. The ring device is even prioritized on my router. My connection speeds are top notch and all other devices I use function extremely fast. The neighborhood portion was awesome at first, but hasn’t worked since they moved it’s location in the app. I’ve removed the app and reinstalled with no changes in functionality. I just get a white screen with gray lines where posts should be on the neighborhood portion of the app. There’s also no way to remove neighborhoods from the neighborhood section. I was considering adding the lights and other cameras around my home until everything stopped working. The cloud recording service is definitely a good thing though. And is a must have if you want to take full advantage of the Ring device. Honestly the cloud recording is the only thing that has prevented me from tossing the Ring Pro into the trash.

title: Ring is a bust
text:
We live in the north east. The video doorbell has a battery, but it is hardwired to keep a trickle charge to the battery. As soon as October arrived the battery started rapidly draining. It simply cannot handle the cold. Ring technicians simply cannot handle the truth. They will try to sell you things to improve battery performance. They don’t work. They will send you a solar charger replacement bracket. It doesn’t work unless your doorbell is in a sunny area. They will tell you story after story of how it’s an isolated incident. But I have friends all around me experiencing the exact same draining dead battery issues as me. It’s because the product does not work as intended as soon as the temperature outside dips below 40 degrees for any length of time. We have MOTION turned off and STILL the battery dies every few days. It’s a terrible product and we would never recommend it to anyone we know. 

And the Neighborhood part of the app doesn’t work for us at all.  It works for some friends and not others. Ring is totally unreliable and completely over rated.

title: Getting away from it’s original purpose
text:
The main purpose of the Ring app and doorbell is to monitor and communicate with who is at the door/ camera. Over time the app takes forever to connect or does not connect at all local and remotely . It’s to the point that when I get a notification from the ring, I check my other lower priced camera because I know it’ll connect. Nothing on my network has changed. Edit: It looks like I never submitted the the review above, since then I’ve updated the doorbell transformer and the router along with ring software updates the connection issues went away. In the last few weeks, I’ve been getting dashboard loading problems in the app and the camera is back to not connecting for live view. Maybe something in the last update or two is causing this.

5.41
Dashboard still having trouble loading

title: Received my 3 stick up cams on Saturday 5/2
text: The app may have some flaws here and there but very small (this has to do with connectivity). You must have 2.4 GHZ WiFi connection to be able to use the cameras which was a pain and caused many issues for me this week. However, now that the connection issue is gone.. these cameras work AMAZING. Just caught some teenagers breaking into vehicles on my street and called the police immediately. I am so happy and thankful I purchased my Ring cameras because they have brought peace and comfort. Only thing I wish I could change is that they could record constantly and not just with motion or Live view. This does not change the fact that I will definitely look into buying more cameras from Ring in the future.

title: Works well
text:
I have the door bell and a stickup cam using just batteries on both. Batteries last quite a while but I bought a spare so I'd have continuous usage. Simple setup. Easy to use app. Plus the help desk is available 24/7 on the phone. Very responsive on Twitter as well.
Follow up review: Still very happy. Set up door bell for a friend who had a tricky front door situation.  Basically right on the street so cars kept triggering it all the time. Had to buy one of the after market adjustable wedge mounts because we needed more horizontal angle. Then falsely set the street distance for 15-30 ft so we could zone out the roads. Worked a treat. 
The house WiFi signal was weak also. Got a Google mesh system which fixed the whole home and of course the Ring.

Love the gentle chimes alert. Not intrusive like a cell phone or text can be.

title: Crappy “security” device
text: A lot of issues with connectivity (and it’s not WiFi bec ever other device in my home with WiFi works fine). For example it’ll “record” movement, but when you view the video the first few seconds it’s all black and you hear the front door open in the video and then when the recording actually shows the front door is already closed. If that were a burglar, the person and their entrance into the home would not have been recorded. (Not WiFi related bec every other device worked fine.) It also completely did not pick up motion two separate times when someone came inside, even though nothing changed in my settings and 90% of the time it records motion fine. So someone was able to walk up to my door, turn a key, and enter without any of that being recorded. Low rating bec even a 10% margin of error is unacceptable if it won’t record a potential burglary. This needs to work 100% of the time (and yes, I’ve called customer service a few times to troubleshoot).

title: Ring Video Doorbell/ Stick up can/ Ring pro
text: I have all three device plus a chime pro. I love "always being home" with my ring devices! I feel much safer with having these products and it benefits our family a great deal my husband and his dad and is unable prior to having these devices able to answer the door or no when somebody is approaching our property he cannot hear dogs barking and would not be able to hear somebody trying to come into our house since I am at work every day and my daughter and husband are home alone I feel much safer knowing that I can check on them at any time and I will get notifications of something funny is going on! Thank you so much ring for making me be able to feel safe about my family being at home while I'm hard at work

title: Unreliable
text:
For the price and mainly for the reason we all purchased the Ring devices, the products and app are mediocre at best. We have both the doorbell and the garage floodlight. The signal strength is weak on both. We have 125Mb  fiber optic internet and over 100Mb wireless speed at the door bell, and still 1/2 the time someone rings the bell we cannot connect in time to answer the door. Ring techs suggested we get the Ring range extender. That made zero difference. The garage floodlight is even worse despite my adding an additional Netgear Access point 20 feet from the camera. 
The movement alarm goes off, and it takes several seconds to connect, and 1/2 the time it never connects. The Ring techs blame it on interference yet none of my Wirleless Foscam security cameras have connection problems. 
We have too much money invested in these products, but I’m ready to switch If I learn about anybody’s else’s product that actually works. Buyer beware.

title: Still on the fence
text:
The live video feed from the doorbell makes the camera close to worthless. My internet speed is not the issue, the ring doorbell is. On the plus side, the non-video alerts such as the chime, phone and watch alerts are close to instantaneous. 
Then there’s the ring alarm... it somehow manages not to recognize pets but my prior old school alarm does. My 30# dog trips the alarm if we don’t kennel her. My other beef with the alarm is that there’s no Apple Watch app, but my old school alarm has it. There’s also the issue with the range of the motion sensor.. it’s horrendously short. I combed the ring website to find the published range of the sensors and couldn’t find it, so I did my own test by comparing distances my sensors detected motion and guess what? The old sensors reach much further than ring’s. One also can’t use the phone app to trigger emergency services. 
I like the ring products I currently have but I’m not totally sold on them.

title: Camp one
text:
Hi,
I took my RingPro doorbell and returned it to Bestbuy on 1/15. I had trouble last night because I was breaking up a lot and called customer service and had a very nice rep to resolve the problem, which we did. I had to many issues with the Pro. 

Today I pushed the ringer on the doorbell and all I heard was a loud static noise. Then the RingPro went into record mode but you couldn’t talk because of the static. Then when my wife and I were testing it she tried opening the app but it showed a blue circle ⭕️ just going around and around never stopping. The app never opened up to live view, we tried several times but no success. I have had the same problem for days too. I also bought the RingPro ringer that is supposed to act as WI-FI extender, well that was worthless too.

Sometimes it would give me and error message that it couldn’t connect to my iPhone. I then walked around my house outside and down my driveway and my iPhone showed I had full bars on my WI-Fi I also walked inside my two story home and in every room I full bars.

Why the phone couldn’t connect to the Pro baffled me. I have very strong internet I stream two movies at the same time so my internet service is not the problem here. I paid a lot of money for headaches. I would receive a notifications of motion or someone is at your front door. I would then open the app and sometimes it would go to live view and other times it wouldn’t . The RingPro is not dependable and not worth your 2 cents.

title: Poor service: watch your credit card!
text: I used Ring Pro doorbell and two Stick Up cameras for 2 years.  There is a significant delay between motion detection and recording.  The result is that the recording often misses the action in the field of view.  Wireless network strength is very strong, so that was not the problem.  If you use the cloud service then watch your credit card closely!  I found repeated instances of product purchases and recording fees on my credit card that were not associated with my account.  After several very frustrating phone calls to Ring customer service and their billing department, they found the root cause was that Ring customer service does not always follow their internal process of verifying an account before they submit charges.  The end result is that they charge the wrong account.  I understand mistakes happen, but this occurred on 3 separate occasions so I ended up removing my credit card from the Ring server and have since removed all Ring devices from my home.  I am now looking at alternative products.

title: Constant notifications
text:
My parents and I have a ring in both of our homes and we have the same issue. The ring notifies us of movement constantly when there is none. It must be the sun shining on it, but that's considered movement to it. When there is a beam of light on the ring caused by god knows what, it tells me someone is outside. It happens well over a hundred times a day. We tried moving it and my parents even have it between two doors of their apartment building and still it constantly goes off when any light shines on it from a window. 

It also starts video about 1 minute after a person has come and gone. All video is showing a car driving away or once we have already left our driveway. What is the point of it recording nothing? It only records doorbell rings, by its supposed to record movement when it happens not 3 mins after it's stopped. I bought two for my home and it has been the most frustrating thing to own. One of them just stopped working all together. I'm ready to just throw it in the garbage.

title: Gets worse every update
text: This at first was great to have. But like all companies, they want to get fancy with the updates and performance suffers. The last update makes it so bad I’m calling about getting a different doorbell from another company. The latest update makes it that when someone comes to the door or triggers my area the camera goes black. It’s like answering the door with a hood over your head. That isn’t what I paid for and definitely isn’t what I want. It was so simple at first and everything worked perfect. Now it is simply pathetic. Save your money unless you like to be frustrated each and every day someone goes or stops by. Wish they'd buy this piece of garbage back. Hopefully I get one installed by some other company in the next few days and I can cancel this because if I can’t see who is at the door, why have it? I’m better off with nothing than keeping ring after this update! Ring must have lost the smart people and now hire idiots.

title: Ugh!
text: I seriously can’t hate this app more. The more they update it the more I hate it. I can’t stand the timeline and now I can’t get rid of it. When I get an alert that something is afoot I don’t want to have to navigate through more screens. I want to go to it in as few clicks as necessary. The other day I had a substitute mail carrier trying to leave mail on my back porch. By the time I navigated to the screen she was beyond the audio which is kind of crappy on my flood light camera. PLEASE let us remove the timeline again. Work on speed of video processing instead of tooling up you app with bells and whistles not needed. We want to quickly see what we are alerted to and timeline doesn’t do it. What would be helpful is to back up the video when (IF) you can access it while the feed is current. You actually are better off closing out of the alert video so it can process and then you can see if it was a car turning around in your driveway or someone kicking in your back door!

title: App update
text:
The recent app updates have really slowed it down.  There is always a delay now to watch a video associated with a notification.  Also have to constantly refresh live view as it freezes.  It has become very difficult to watch something real time once you get a notification. 

Small functionality annoyance is the History screen.  A select all/delete option would be helpful rather than having to click each one.  There also isn’t enough of a function difference between clicking to edit vs. viewing.  So as I am trying to click things to edit I always end up opening videos if I don’t click it just right.  

Would like to see record schedule settings similar to motion schedule settings.  Right now the only way to turn recording on and off is to toggle it manually.  So I may turn it off when I’m home and forget to turn it back on when I leave.

title: Notification sounds not saving
text:
I have had ring for about three years. Since Saturday, March 20, it’s been stuck on windchimes, even though my other preferred sounds are showing as selected on the settings. I have Navi and Ping Pong for motions differentiating for front and back yard motions. Since this update, no matter what I do, it’s windchimes. Mailman comes to the door, windchimes. Hubby goes outside to start the grill, windchimes. Raccoon walks across the yard, windchimes. Front or back yard? Take a guess. I have to constantly check because the sounds aren’t saving correctly. Right now, the app is annoying the bejesus outta me.  
And I hate it. I’ve logged out and back in. I’ve deleted and re-installed the app. I’ve sent emails. I am annoyed. It’s not fixing. And it’s just my iPhone, but not my husband’s. 
Do the notifications work? Yes. Are the modifications I make sticking? No. Are windchimes annoying? Yup.

title: Nicely packaged garbage
text: Wow three steps to setup I thought that is great!  I so wanted to make cute viral videos with my kids and couldn’t wait!  Sixteen steps later and 40 tries to connect to my network and still nothing.  Complete garbage.  Even though I could see the device connecting to my router it would still fail the setup.  Suddenly I felt used, all my personal info had to be given before the setup and now I had to figure out how to delete it.  That wasn’t three steps either but I found it and got a message that it will take up to 30 days to delete my info!  Ironic that it took seconds to setup!  Now I feel hostage to a system that doesn’t work and doesn’t live up to the expectations.  I did try the “hard” reset but ghat didn’t work as described either.  However, a few hard resets with a carpenter hammer has me feeling better.  Another high tech product that fails do live up to the high price and high expectations.  We’ll be looking for other ways to make cute viral vids.

title: It’s OK....more options needed
text: It’s an ok app.  I have the Doorbell Pro.  I wish it would have one additional option. I wish it would have a toggle option in the app that will automatically turn on the video when it senses motion or someone rings the doorbell.  You have to click on the notification in order for it to open.  If I’m using an iPad or other device to view video, I would be able to see who is at the door while my hands are full with cooking, changing kids, eating dinner, or just relaxing etc. If it did this, I would rate it 5 stars and purchase a few more Ring devices for security around my house.  Other security video options have this ability so I recommend those options at this time.  If this ever changes within the Ring app, I will change my fating and update my review.  If you don’t see an updated review, then you know this is still an issue. Thank you for reading my review!

title: Great idea, execution is ok.
text:
We bought the doorbell, the chime pro, the chime, and the flood light. The chime pro was intended as a WiFi booster/extension for the flood light, but it didn’t help the signal at all. So we returned it and got the chime. Right now it’s taking about 30 seconds for the doorbell to signal the chime when rung. We do get motion notifications, but it’s usually so delayed that it’s defeats the purpose. And it takes so long to get into the app when you get a notification that even if I wanted to answer a door bell ring, the person likely would have walked away already. 
Overall, I like the idea of the system, but it needs improvements. We live in an older home so hardwiring is not an option without hiring someone and even with expensive boosters / extenders, the connection many times is so poor that we can’t even live feed the cameras. I am hopeful that software updates continue to make the products better.

title: Good products; OK app
text:
I have several Ring cameras up around the outside of the house.  The wired cams are certainly better and more reliable, but I haven’t had much issue with the battery cams.  Would be nice if the price of the battery cams was less to reflect the absence of a couple of features that make the wired cams better.  

The app is decent, but could be better.  It would be nice to have the ability to “snooze” and/or set schedules for multiple cameras at once rather than doing them one at a time.  It would also be great, if at all possible, to set custom record times following a motion event.  Too often the activity gets cut off when the recording stops if you don’t catch the alert and begin watching live. 

I’ve been pretty happy with my Ring devices.  A couple of enhancements to the app would do a lot to make the overall product much better.

title: Can’t Open The Luve View
text: I like the concept, but there are issues. I set up cameras a few feet from my WiFi router and you still can’t see live video. It just doesn’t connect. And when there is a motion, the start of the recording is delayed a minute or more. And if someone is leaving the house, they are not seen in the video because they have long passed the video range by the time Ring starts recording. It really only works after perhaps 5-8 seconds of someone standing on my porch. As well, I signed up for the cloud storage of my video when the trial period ended. The web site took my credit card info just fine. But the subscription didn't start until I discovered an issue several days later and had to call Ring to fix their mistake. And with the gap in time that Ring caused, it resulted in having no video recorded when I really needed it. This is a very, very expensive product to have these kinds of issues. I would not buy another Ring product.

title: Frame Freezing- Floodlight security camera
text:
I’m having the same issues as so many others, the frame freezing. Also it’s very slow about picking up any movement. If it’s a person getting out of a vehicle that parked in front of my driveway, they have already exited and on the other side of their car and walking up to my home before the camera turns on. 
I was extremely happy with my purchase in the beginning. After initial set up any movement in the perimeter was picked up immediately and the camera started recording. 
But now that I’m paying and with the updates it’s just the opposite experience. I’m not happy with it any longer. :-( It’s to bad, it was a good purchase in the beginning. I wouldn’t recommend buying it, not unless they get it back as good as it once was. Ms.T

title: Update of Oct 2017
text:
I think the Ring system has been a good value for me, using cameras at 4 locations all on one account.
Only technical complaint is my ISP can’t supply more than 0.5 upload speed at one location, which makes the video unusable at two locations.
The system used to allow me to rapidly review past activity of all cameras on my iPad, displaying all cameras and times in sequence until this last update- now It displays my cameras as four different accounts, making reviews of activity much more inefficient and time consuming.  My iPhone display has remained OK, displaying all of “my devices” simultaneously.
This last update seems to have been done solely for financial reasons with no regard to customers needs or convenience.
I fear Ring has begun the typical corporate process of putting their profits above customer convenience - In the meantime, I will stop adding cameras until I see what happens over the next few months.

Well have I been surprised!
Apparently I wasn’t the only one displeased with the last update.
The problem has been corrected- the display on my iPad has reverted to the older efficient form - displaying all cameras and activity simultaneously.

I congratulate Ring for listening to their customers!

I’ll now increase my rating to 4 stars.

Reddoch Williams

title: Great if it worked all the time
text: I love the idea but this thing drives me crazy. I really want it to work but More than half the time I just watch the video buffer instead of connecting. The bad guy will have broken into my house and hurt us all before the video comes up. Killin me! I had someone lurking at my door in the middle of the night and he was long gone before the video came up 5 minutes later and the only thing the video caught was the back of his head walking away. I also wish I could toggle between cameras. Instead, I have to back out of the app each time then reopen it to go to another camera. It also doesn't update. When I take the battery out of my ring doorbell to charge it, it still acts like it's in and shows that's it's charged on the app. It also goes offline all the time. A few days later you realize it's not been recording or tracking anything. I constantly have to reset the system daily. So bummed! App people please fix this!

title: Sound is unstable
text:
The problem I have with this product renders it unworkable for remotely communicating with someone at my front door. The sound goes on and off constantly, making conversation impossible. This problem at some times can be better than others and I can occasionally figure out what is being said, still a great inconvenience, but at other times speech is completely undecipherable. The app tells me that my signal strength is strong, so maybe I got a defective product. Any advice from the Ring app monitor?

Update: after watching a few neighborhood incidents videos, it seems that this is not an uncommon problem, perhaps explaining why this post received no Developer Response. I have a hard wired Ring Pro connected to an ac4000 router with plenty of speed and added the Chime extender for good measure. It’s just an overpriced security camera. Once you’ve drilled the holes to mount it, they’re counting on people leaving it in place. My advice: don’t drill until you’ve tested it.

title: Needs to add the following to the Neighbors Feed.
text: The Neighbors feed works a lot like Facebook but it has one serious and major downfall. Often people will report and post video or pictures of  missing pets, or intruders, or neighborhood creeps and stalkers. In the comment thread beneath these posts, there is NO way to post a photo so that the people reading the thread can compare one photo to another. For example today a person made a post about a white late model truck with full description— stalking her 2 young daughters. I had to create a brand new post including a photo I have of a vehicle matching the same description , and hope the person sees it and can show it to her children for verification. There needs to be a photo option within the comment thread. It annoys a hell of a lot of people that there isn’t a way to share and compare. It’s the number one Complaint I see many people have about this app.

title: Live View
text:
Live view is a joke. I like the concept, but it is far from perfect.  I installed the Ring 2 and found that when using Live View, it would not connect 80-90 percent of the time. It works fine when recording and I can go to the list to watch the videos, but if I want to see who is ringing my doorbell, it’s a crapshoot if it’s going to work or not. 

I called their tech support and they said it was not getting enough of my bandwidth from my router and that I might benefit from a chime pro extender or maybe something to boost the connection. I opted to purchase a new router. I went with the Orbi Mesh system for homes less than 5000 square feet. My house is considerably smaller than that. Now my RSSI is better, was 48, now 38-41, but the live view is still inconsistent. My internet speed when checked at the Ring is 51-58Mbps.  

I’m considering returning the device and looking elsewhere. I don’t want to have to watch a recording to find out if I should have answered the door or not.

title: Getting notifications late!
text: Now with this update we lose video recordings and ability to share unless we pay now?? It used to be free. With this new update which is terrible, we're not getting notifications until around 5-20 minutes later! What good is that if someone is trying to break into your home or car?? I think Ring creates updates just so we can purchase new products. I suggest everyone having or who've had "multiple" issues in the past & present like us with these products, to contact consumer protection agencies and file complaints. This system was TOO expensive for what it does or actually, what it "doesn't do". Contact Apple as well and file a complaint about the app. Also, my husband and I use this app but it's under his name, yet under my email, so why can't both of us be co-owners and be able to delete, adjust, comment Etc.?? It's beyond ridiculous. Fix this. We've already filed reports with consumer protection agencies.

title: Good but could be great. (Five star hardware and 3 star app)
text: I’ve had the outdoor spotlight cameras for almost a year now and they are definitely good quality. The camera / night vision / spotlights are definitely awesome pieces of hardware. The issues come with the app. For the longest time it worked pretty good with some slight issues. It never really connected to the cameras lightning fast but that may be due to proximity to a WiFi source. As of the past couple months, the app has become very glitchy. When you check on one camera and view the history it seems fine but when you go back and look at another it just seems to stall out. It never crashes but it becomes unusable to the point I have to swipe it off the screen and restart it. I’m using it on an iPhone 8 Plus FYI. This really needs to be addressed and would make this 5 star again.

title: Worst update ever...bring back 12hr snooze
text: Just updated my ring and I’ve never had issues before but someone thought it was a good idea to take away the 12 hr snooze on my chime.  So now it only snoozes for 4hrs!  every five minutes that ring chime is going off during the night from our neighbors cat going in our driveway ultimately waking everyone up in the house.  Ive tried to change my setting to people only but it doesn’t seem to pick up much movement so I have to keep it at the setting it is and live with getting alerts from animals.  It was never an issue because I could shipyards the chime off at night.  I would always get the alerts on my phone just in case something happens but would always snooze the chime at night so I wouldn’t wake everyone up.  Now it’s no longer an option.  What were you thinking??  PLEASE bring back that feature.  It’s not safe to disable the motion at night because people’s cars are being broken into in our area and it defeats the whole purpose of having the ring.

title: Delays and lack of neighbor controls
text:
There’s a serious delay (yes we heckled the WiFi strength) from when someone is at the door or in range to when it actually rings and by the time the stupid app loads...

MAJOR ISSUES with the neighbor feature. People are abusing it with 90% nuisance posts. You should have categories that people can post under and users can opt to get or not get alerts for posts in categories. Like LOST & FOUND, GENERAL INQUIRY, CRIME ALERT, and WHATS HAPPENING are the main categories to need. I’m so tired of alerts because someone had the mailman come up to the door!!!! And when you make the categories you need to have a “report” option so users can report incorrect category postings and warn users to stop making non-sense posts because they want to know why there’s a police siren down their block.  That’s not what this device is for. Please monitor this and use a solution like category postings.

title: Moving along
text:
I hear there are updates a comin’. Things I’ve been thinking could be done. 

For now, motion sensing, night viewing, speed of live view power up, notification speed, reviewing of recorded video, reliability, 2way talk seem to all be working fine. No reports of an issue there. 

I gave four stars because I have noticed that in live view during night and sunny bright days, the view and also when zoomed in slightly can be seen very fuzzy and seemingly it’s quality changing constantly which is creating a choppy live view feed. That’s not good. Upon review of the recording of that live view you can see there is not that problem. The video is clear and smooth. Not sure what is going on. Is it changing frame rate constantly? Also, the colors look blown way out of proportion at night when you first watch reviewed videos and over the duration of the video, it slowly adjusts back to a more natural, easy to view picture. 

I have the floodlight cam and an excellent connection likely always below -36rssi between it and router with a 32x8 modem and super fast internet package. Customer service was great the one time I had to communicate with them about a single time I had the issue where the video recorded an event with sound but the video was black.

title: Ring Neighborhoods Does Not Work At All
text:
Aside from other issues I’ve had with my Ring  Doorbell, my main concern currently is that the “Neighborhoods” function does not work at all. Every time I try to view my Neighborhood activity, it says, “Sorry, Nobody’s Home. Please try again later. Please try again.” 

I called Ring customer support thinking this should be an easy issue to fix. Walked through several steps including rebooting, reinstalling, and deactivating and reactivating my account. Nothing worked. Still unable to view Neighborhoods feed. The answer I received from tech support was, “This will be sent to the ‘desk’, and will hopefully be remedied soon. It may take some time to function properly again.” Basically saying there’s nothing we can do currently because we have no clue what’s going on with it or why it’s actually happening. (Just for reference, this hasn’t worked for over a month).

Needless to say, I’m pretty frustrated. Especially when I asked if I would receive any feedback and was told I’d receive an email detailing our conversation. Nothing on the topic of a fix or communication when the issue was resolved. 

Ring, it’s time to step up your technical support and start actually listening when people have problems with your products. 

Funny enough, the “Neighborhoods” function  works flawlessly on my husband’s iPhone X (I’m using an iPhone 8 Plus).

title: Live video always locks up during actual Ring/motion
text:
Been waiting for over 3 years for Ring to get their act together on this app. Preface...I have incredibly fast wifi, one of the strongest and best routers, and a top-of-the-line iPhone. 

The Ring video feed always locks up and just spins and spins waiting to render anytime you receive a Ring notification and click to view the live video on your phone. If you just want to randomly check the live video when it doesn’t matter and no one is there, it’ll work. But...if someone rings the bell, or there is movement, and the app notifies you on your phone that someone is at your door, if you click to open the app and view the activity... guaranteed it won’t work over 90% of the time. It’ll just spin and spin as it tries to load and show you the live video. Then 5 minutes later, after it’s too late, you can watch the old video to see what you missed. Just so pitiful. It’s been years... fix the app, Ring.

title: Just a better idea?
text:
Just started to use ring bell 2, the latest? Newest version? Here to share the following after few days use: 

First, the  installation totally end user easy, 5 starts and couldn't be better... 

Setting up is a snap, wire free is a plus, battery usage claimed (by customer service) to be 6 month to a year? But monitor daily use about 8 -10% so went bought an extra for swap without service been down.... 

Real use that important to all users!
All use are under good network condition/ WiFi well connected. 
Video claim to be HD? 1080p? But I found it hard to believe! I can hardly recognize any object or have a clear face view just few feet out if I never seen the person before, a stranger ! using iPad zoom the picture even worst! Don't even compare with WHAT YOU CAN SEE  from your HD TV! Is it because I'm still use in free trail period ? Maybe I should wait till paid service started... 

Next,  Motion detections: it alerts about every 10 minutes or less!? Even nothing is there? Annoying or false alert... so you must go through so many recording to see which is important or really need to pay attention to...  no better way or recognize a person?

Anyone have experience the same please share... 
I'll keep testing it, hope for the better improvement.

Update 1/31. Thanks for CustomerCare's attention and looking forward to see improvements on video quality, motion detection , possible Apple home app support!

title: Not working the way it's advertised
text: I bought this camera doorbell because it doesn't need to be wired to an existing doorbell which is great because I don't have an existing doorbell. I wanted to be able to see who is at the door since I also don't have a peephole. The issues I'm having are that the video takes forever to download after I am notified of movement. Half the time, it tells me there was an error and it won't download anything at all and other times, the person is walking away by the time I'm notified they are there. Very frustrating and doesn't make me feel that safe.   I'm sure I would be told that it's my wifi but the signal is strong and my wifi is fast.  Why don't I have issues with other wifi enabled products in my house?  It serves its purpose to show me who is at the door (most of the time) but definitely not a trusted source for security. I'm hesitant to buy other Ring products for fear that I'd have the same issues.

title: Never Captures What’s Needed
text:
Someone stole something off my porch. The Ring only caught video before they got there and after they left. Literally one video shows the item there, the next video it’s gone, nothing in between.

Someone stole my bike out of my back yard. One video it’s there, the next video it’s gone. Nothing got recorded in between. 

A police officer was outside my house buying drugs. I witnessed this with my own eyes. I didn’t have my phone on me but I just KNEW I would have the video on my Ring. Literally shows the cop car turn the corner to drive on my block, camera stops recording. Next recording started 20 minutes later.

A man pulled up next door to my house but definitely within view of my camera. The man jumped out his car, started throwing trash and breaking bottles in the street. Trashed the whole yard next door. I even got into a confrontation with with him. The Ring video shows my car driving toward my house but cut off just before I even pulled into my drive way. The next video shows me walking inside the house after the street was already trashed. Didn’t record anything in between. 

Thus far, it hasn’t done me any good. Actually, it really just aggregates me. And stupidly, I spent about $1200 on a whole 5 camera setup that has never caught a single crime committed at or near my house. I’ll be moving soon and will not be installing the Ring in my new home.

title: Smart floodlights are pretty dumb
text:
Just installed 2 smart floodlights, the wired version to replace 2 older incandescent floodlights only to find out that the only way to turn the lights on other than motion detection is thru the account owners app, all other shared users are not able to turn the lights on or off if they need to. So if they are outside in the area where the lights are installed for a BBQ or any other reason, if the account owner is not available, they are unable to control the lights, pretty ridiculous for a so called “smart light”. My old “dumb” lights were able to be turned on or off whenever needed by whoever needed them. 
Ring really needs to address this issue along with all the other issues with the app if they want to keep up with other companies such as Arlo and Nest!
They have really gone down hill an continually ignore all complaints by customers.
If you want a reliable smart lighting product that works as expected, “DO NOT BUY RING SMART LIGHTING PRODUCTS”!!!

title: Great ideas, poor equipment and service
text: I love the concept of Ring and I like how Ring can help integrate home security allowing residents to have control of their system and avoid the ridiculous costs associated with many security companies. However, we constantly have issues connecting to WiFi and the support is terrible. The first floodlight cam I received was defective. Thankfully, the retailer I bought the product from replaced the device at no cost, but Ring support was worthless for helping me solve the problem. After speaking with a representative that was probably in another country, he told the best way to follow up was by email. I sent several emails outlining all the issues with the defective device and got only one reply that fixated on one of the minor issues I had brought up in just one of my messages. Ring says they want to provide good customer service, but inability to actually read and respond to email inquiries nullifies their claims.

title: Useless!
text: This is my 3rd doorbell I’ve received from Ring. I’ve spent countless hours with them on the phone “troubleshooting” problems and things get worse and worse over time. The first bell was the best, but last about 6 months before there was a problem with it. The second bell lasted less time than that, and this current bell has been installed for less than 30 days and for about 90% of the last 30 days it has been “off-line”. It will come on line for about a minute and then become useless again until it decides to come back on line. I am able to stream movies on multiple devices without problems, but for some reason this doorbell can’t stay connected to the modem, which is only about 10 feet away. Nothing has changed other than over time this product has become more and more unreliable. It is unfortunate that the company can’t provide a reliable product. I have a $250 piece of junk that I can’t use and can’t get a refund on!  Save your money and buy something else!!

title: Works great
text: Ring records any movement coming up from the street in front of doorbell.  Good quality videos too, in color.  Can see who delivers any packages, everything.  Videos have a wide field of view too.  Notifications can be turned on or off.  I have mine on and can hear the notifications bell when I am downtown over my cell phone-I can stop and view right then, even answer or talk to anyone standing at the door.  Just got a ring update, it worked great before, haven’t tried yet with update.  I decided to get the monthly service package, it will record and hold videos until you delete them, good if someone comes up and takes your mailed packages, you have the video proof of who did it for police. Again very good quality, you can see exactly who it is.

title: Was working great and now is not
text:
I loved my RING doorbell 3 for the first month I had it. Every motion at the front of my house sent a notification to my phone. Now, after paying for a years service, it seems as tho people walking straight up to my door does not send me a notification to my phone. They have to actually hit the button for it to send me a notification. I DONT KNOW WHAT YOU DID IN THE UPDATE BUT FIX IT. The whole reason I got this was so my phone would get blown up with notifications when packages got delivered to my door. It’s no longer notifying me. I checked all my settings and they are all correct. I even took it off of person mode so that ANY motion will trigger it but alas I do not get notified of any motions anymore.

Oh and I have an iPhone 12 up to date and works great so it’s the app or device that is the issue.

IT SEEMS REALLY WEIRD THAT ONCE I PAID FOR A YEAR OF SERVICE THAT THIS THING ALL THE SUDDEN STOPPED WORKING PROPERLY!

title: Slow to show video and it is choppy....
text:
Their service need help during daytime events. When an event happens, using this or the Rapid Ring app for live view, the video if choppy... people move twice as fast as normal, then pause, then twice as fast, then pause, rinse, repeat. This only happens during daytime video(nighttime is fine) for ALL of my cameras(2 floodlights and a Pro doorbell). My 200down 11 up is fine and my connection numbers are all in the -40’s. It’s not me, it’s their system. There are MANY, MANY people reporting the same issue.

Fix it please. And while your at it, please make better use of space on the iPad version. While you have the main hamburger menu icon all the way to the left, the video preview windows are contained to only about a third of the screen in the middle, instead of expanding to use the entire width of the screen.

title: Deceitful marketing
text: I bought my doorbell because of the packaging and online pictures showing very clear footage. When I got my doorbell and set it up, I immediately realize that the quality was an absolute joke. It is so unclear that I can’t recognize my brother when he’s standing 3 ft away from it. It is always glitching and even though I have fast WiFi the video will never load when I get an alert. By the time the video uploads on the app, the person who was ringing the doorbell has probably moved into a retirement center and died of old age. I contacted their support team to inquire of the quality issues I was having and the tech who helped me, admitted to me that they doctor their photos to make them look better in their advertisements. He told me he had a couple of the cameras himself and none of them are as good of quality as the packaging and online pictures show. Overall I am extremely disappointed with RINGS deceptive marketing and garage products, I do not recommend purchasing them at all.

title: Stick up
text:
I have had my ring Stick Up camera for about month. It was easy to set up and install. Had an issue with improving my WiFi connection. Spoke with an assistant at RIng. They are extremely knowledgeable and helpful. We tried a few things with out much improvement so ring sent me an extender at no charge. Once that was installed all problems were solved. I did have to play around with angle of unit to get the coverage I wanted but after a few try’s I am getting the results I was looking for.
I would like to see a little faster response time from activation to notification. It only takes about 10 seconds now. But we all want it instantaneously.
My other suggestion would be that when motion detector is activity it wakes up a sleeping phone or iPad .

title: Worked ok at first, now utterly worthless
text:
At first it was ok... sensitivity was all the way down but I still got about 10 movement alerts a day. It was annoying but it worked about 70-80% of the time... Maybe 3 stars. 

Fast forward a few months and I’ve since turned movement alerts off, set for only doorbell ring alerts and it’s become completely worthless. If I get a ring alert and touch it, I’m immediately brought to a screen asking me to sign up for cloud recording - not a live view of my front door. By the time I back out and go to “live view” I could’ve just walked to the door and back at least twice (there’s a terrible lag despite “good” WiFi connection) and/or I’ve completely missed whoever was at my door. So what’s the point of this overpriced doorbell?!!

To add insult to injury, if I DON’T address the alert, the next time I unlock my phone the alert pops up again as if someone was ringing my doorbell again! At least I didn't pay full price! Stay away until they get their >stuff< together!!

title: Decent app but still a lot of room for improvement
text: I recently got Ring and was overall impressed with it. However, there are several issues for me--the main one is that this app doesn't let user choose between microphones. Unfortunately for me, my front camera microphone doesn't work, so I can't talk to whoever is at the door. I contacted Ring regarding this issue, but customer service rep pretty much just said "too bad." I'm really hoping an updated version of this app will include this setting into it. As for other minor issues, I feel like sensitivity setting can improve a bit. I changed the settings so that movements within 7 feet would be picked up, but my Ring camera is still picking up cars driving on the street. Overall, I think this is a decent app, but as I mentioned, I really hope the app development team can add settings to choose between which microphones to use.

title: Love this Product
text: We were one of the after an incident customers. Wish we would have had this a long time ago so we could have avoided being victims. My husband and I have since installed 3 cameras (door bell, flood light and spot light) and literally have a ring of security around our home. We did a complete test of the system of walking out the door l, around the house and through the back yard and you can see everything. Despite what happened, we were very lucky because the person was captured and we have our things returned. But, now we feel more secure having the capability of keeping an eye on our home all the time. We’re going full in with Ring. Now just waiting on the whole home security system to be released. We love this product.

title: Do not use this company
text: My boyfriend and I moved into a house where this door bell was already installed. After getting moved in and everything settled I hooked up the doorbell to the app and paid for the year membership so I could get live feed from it when someone was at my door. I have been trying to get it to work for a week now with no luck. I reached out to a customer service rep a few days ago and hadn’t heard anything, so today I logged on and spoke with someone. I’m glad I didn’t waste my money buying the product to find out how much of a scam artist this company is. Instead of trying to completely solve the problem and get this to work, they want me to spend money on a brand new one. Absolutely ridiculous!

title: Ring cameras great security
text:
Having had ring cameras now fo4 about 6 months I have grown to really like them. Took a bit of time to get the settings to a point I like. Live in a high traffic neighborhood and it’s important to set perimeters so that the camera doesn’t go off with every movement. Selecting people only motion helps as well. The wireless / battery operated cameras are great for moving to the best location- provided you have sufficient WiFi. Had to get an additional WiFi extender but this solved some early connection issues. 
My only significant negative is the clarity of the cameras - even though they are 1080 clarity the focus does not get real clear when your trying to read license plates or see faces distinctly. For the money these are great tools to protect your home. I currently run a wired motion light as well as several wireless/battery operated cameras.

title: Initial review good
text: Setup took a couple of tries of deleting the app and starting over to get it finally setup and then had to go back into settings and tweak a few of the settings and options until it worked the way I expected. I’m guessing that the recent update poor review were from people with either old iOS or that the update caused a conflict with the iOS update. I would suggest to those complainers to update their phones to the latest iOS (which is properly what the ring update was made for) or if already on the iOS 14, then delete the app and reinstall and go through the setup. This may correct your issues. Just my opinion since I didn’t encounter any of the problems with my setup or Ring doorbell. (FYI, my device is the Ring video doorbell 3 plus)

title: My new ring doorbell
text: Since I just had it installed on my home, I have to say although my picture is clear. I do not understand why I have such a delay in seeing who is walking up and that the notice shows me people walking up but they are at my door faster than I can actually do anything. Not to mention the fact that I have got to purchase more in order to share anything or keep it. I’m not sure if my cloud account can be used to store things. I have an ADT system in my home. But I so wanted this doorbell to be more. Unfortunately the way my entrance is on my home the whole right side shows nothing and I won’t be able to see my garage area either-which would require more cameras. But the price is so high to add them,I can not. Don’t know if I’m as impressed as I thought I would be. Expected more and felt like I got less than thought. UN ABLE TO SEE MUCH MORE THAN WALKWAY AND PART OF DRIVEWAY.

title: App seems cross-platform
text:
This is more a quick note about the Ring iOS app, vs the hardware itself. The app seems like it may have been built using a cross-platform kit rather than written natively for iOS. It feels distinctly like a Google Material Design app.

That in itself doesn’t bother me to much, but may be what is preventing the developers from making use of native APIs, like CallKit. CallKit would allow an incoming Ring to show up just like an incoming call on your iPhone. It might even allow answering the call on Apple Watch via Handoff.

Also agree with others that motion events should show the start of the recording by default, perhaps with a button to jump to live view. A preview still image would be helpful for each recording in the list view. Extra points for showing a face. Same for the push notification itself: include a still image. 

As to the hardware, it would be so nice to at least have the option of an Ethernet jack with PoE. That’s what the Pro model really should have. I’m certain wireless interference and congestion is causing the majority of poor reviews. My neighborhood gets worse by the month as people add more IoT devices, repeaters, printers, cable boxes, etc. I prefer to use wire for things that don’t need to be portable.

title: ** HUGE WARNING **
text:
Ring is suddenly and without warning blocking VPN services and probably other IPs. This makes your alarm system NONFUNCTIONAL without warning if you happen to use an IP address Ring doesn’t like. And of course, you generally do not get to choose your IP. 

This means you may no longer access your account or get notifications, like maybe a notification that someone is breaking into your house. 

For people who for security reasons use a VPN, many of whom are required to use it, this basically renders the entire Ring system unusable, and you can throw your alarm system in the trash now. Oh, you don’t have time or money to suddenly research and set up a new alarm system? Tough luck. Did your alarm fail to notify you when an emergency was occurring? Ring should pay for everything, but you’ll probably have to sue. If you do, maybe try to find an attorney who knows class action, because that’s where this could be going.

title: This app is full of bugs! Ring needs to update and fix!!!!!
text: This app is full of bugs. I’ve been trying to set up my account and security devices for about an hour and had had to quit and reinstall the app several times to get certain things to work. I received several error messages while creating an account (I had to try going through the entire process about 5-10 times before it finally worked), the buttons for setting up new devices don’t seem to work for me, whenever the buttons for setting up a new device do decide to work the app is not able to recognize the QR codes on the devices, and my app reads that my base station is not connected to WiFi even though the light on it says it is according to the manual and so does my WiFi app which is able to test connections with devices. I was looking forward to getting my system up and running and this is definitely not a good first impression! >:(

title: Decent but few flaws with app
text: I have two doorbell 2 rings. Great concept, app just needs work. The picture is great and it alerts me promptly. However, the live view hardly works, I’ve had my back doorbell almost 2 years and I’ve maybe got to use the live view 2-3 times, every time it loads and loads before saying there’s an issue. So it’s kind of pointless if someone comes to your door, because you can’t get the live to come up to talk to them. Also, when it picks up motion, you have to wait a minute before you can play it. My reasoning for getting these was to be able to protect my home when people come up, and it’s worthless when it comes to that. Basically just to go back later and see what’s already been there and gone for the day. I wish they could fix this issue because it would be nice to use the live and other features that I am paying for.

title: Better “Ring”
text:
I am very satisfied with the Ring Alarm I installed in my house. Does 99% of what I want. 

The only feature that Is missing on the iPhone app is that when the alarm is triggered, it only gives a  simple notification onscreen (and an email) that are easily missed. Instead, it should be a nagging “ring”/sound to alert about a triggering alarm while you’re asleep for example. A solution similar to the iPhone timer /alarm where it rings/sounds until you stop it or snooze it. Now when I am asleep at night and have the Do Not Disturb feature, I am a bit skeptical that I will be notified if the alarm is triggered. 

I hope you see this as a great addition to a new update on the app. It sure would help make the app more useful to people that do not use your monitoring plan, and bring peace of mind to all users

title: Great concept, needs work - few ideas below
text:
I operate an iPhone X. When my phone is locked, iy takes about 15 seconds to be notified of any activity or ring. When it is unlocked, it is almost immediate. 

Next issue, it takes too long to wait for the camera to load when attempting to view an alert. Between the lag described below and this issue, it takes about 30 seconds - most of the time the activity of interest is over. 

I have been waiting for them to provide the ability to snooze motion by zone instead of all or none. This seems to me to be a very basic function, especially when you have the ability to create different zones. This is almost a must have. I have to sacrifice security in order to try and avoid nuisance alarms. 

I need to have the ability to physically switch night vision on or off, independent of, and overriding, the automatic system in place now.

Lastly, i should have the option to always record. I pay for the cloud service, i should be able to use it as i wish. 

I enjoy the product, but if this does not start becoming more streamlined and useful, not only will i not continue to invest in the company, but i will divest my household completely of the product, since there are other services that provide much of what i would like.

title: Auto playing videos are annoying
text: Mostly the app is good. It does what it says it will do. My main issue and the reason for three stars is that in the neighborhood section the videos begin to play a immediately anytime you do anything. Even scrolling down the page will start the next video playing. And I hope you didn’t want to see the first few frames of that video because even if you pause and drag the marker back to the beginning it goes ahead and starts it again. There is no way to have the video paused at the first frame because the app insists on starting it for you like it or not. According to their tech support there is no way to change this behavior. I requested a feature upgrade for it. If they put it in then I will upgrade the star count because it will then deserve better than three stars. Until then though, 3 stars it is.

title: Only 30 seconds of motion alert Video
text:
Kind of disappoint. It installed well, the quality it is well however it let me down

I had a situation in front of my house where I was involved and the motion alert grabbed it but only for 30 seconds, so I researched it and an article from their help site from early 2017 said they were going to give options to adjust that time and we’re almost in the middle of 2018 and still no update. After speaking to some of my app developer friends, this would be an easy fix from programming standpoint. Don’t really feel like spending another couple hundred bucks on the camera so I hope nothing really serious happens in front of my house where I’m going to need more than 30 seconds. 

FYI this is when I don’t respond to the notifications which is usually when I’m sleeping and should be the time when this camera works the best

title: So good!
text:
I personally love the ring app! I have a ring Doorbell Pro at my front door. The video is crystal clear color video feed and alerts you at the same speed if someone rings your doorbell as if you were 400 Miles away than at your house. I travel to faraway places and it’s nice to know if anything suspicious is happening around here. Most of my neighbors have ring security products like the ring doorbell, so I feel protected. If you haven’t got a ring doorbell yet, get one! They are cheap and very usable.
I have one small complaint. I really would like if the ring referring program came back. It a dangerous world out there and I want to have a safe home for me and my neighbors. Please get back to ring team and everyone out there! Don’t hesitate to buy ring! It’s worth it!

title: Greatly Improved since 2019
text: The ring eco system of devices has gotten much easier to use since the last time I tired to set them up in 2019 which failed miserably when you have ultra security home networks. On the app and service security side can you please have a place within the app, like the dashboard, where you can see if someone is streaming video or has access to the system either from an app install on another phone or from the Ring website. Also please add FACE ID or Touch ID to the app login, this + sms verification codes would be ideal and make super secure logins possible. Thanks for working hard to improve your products and looking forward to even more common sense security measures to lock down this service and make it best in class.

title: Corrupting wifi settings
text: When I put the Ring2 doorbell on our wifi, it will record cars passing (but not all visitors knocking or approaching) for 24 hours.  Then after about 7 days of the initial setup, every day out of nowhere it corrupts our wifi settings (with no alert or notification, we get no more recordings).  I have to reset the password on the wifi and reset the doorbell.  After going through this process four times (and calling support) i decided to try leaving it off the network as just a basic doorbell.  No more corruption.  Wifi works great, but only while the doorbell is stupid and disconnected - not smart and - not what we paid for.  We had plans to purchase the continual monitoring for a year, but no longer.  We will be returning it. Don’t waste your time with them trying to make it work, they are very willing to just get it returned and refunded without really looking into the issue.  Everybody - just get your money back.

title: Filter the users
text: I’m giving this a poor rating not because of your services. I’m satisfied with your services, however I have one major complaint; the users. I really think you need to add a ‘report’ section to each video users post because people post so much garbage that you can’t even get to the videos where real harm is being done. I think the option to ‘report’ and take down a video if it’s not a lost pet, crime, and the like needs to be there because a doorbell is there so that we can talk to who is at our door but people should not be allowed to post something unless it’s serious. I really feel this distracts from the purpose of this app and I’ll say the same thing on the neighbors app to make sure you see this review and implement this. title: Equipment and Service Not Reliable
text: I was traveling recently away from home. I have two plug-in Ring cameras, which are set up to monitor two different parts of my home. For some reason, one of the cameras simply went offline. There had otherwise been no power or internet outages, and all other devices were running fine. The camera, which is closest to my WiFi router,  simply quit working. I thought I would be able to reset and reconnect the camera remotely via the App. Nope. Not at all. Here’s the rub: According to Ring Support, one has to physically press the camera reset button to reconnect the camera to the network for remote monitoring. For a device that’s meant to be of most use while you’re away from home, that basically renders the device useless. Very disappointed as I had been pleased with the camera up until now and was considering adding more Ring devices. I’ve now lost confidence in Ring and their products.

title: Notification feedback
text: Hi, it would be better i think if the notifications on the Home Screen could have a short preview of the clip when you clicked on it. Currently only shows an image if the motion captured on my floodlight pro and you would get a better idea of what the motion was if it was a small clip. (Like how nest has their notifications) Coming from Nest I like the advancement of the ring capabilities but I still like how smooth the nest app is to navigate through your video. I also don’t like that this doesn’t run 24/7 technically. The app is also sometimes slow to load the video I think because of how much tech is behind the video being taken, which again Nest does a better job at. Overall, quick clips during notifications, quicker loading of your videos, and 24/7 recording.

title: So far so good
text:
So far we are loving our new Ring 2 video doorbell! It was easy to install physically and the app is pretty intuitive although I wish the "Answer" button lasted longer when I get the push notification. It would be great if I could control the number of seconds it shows on the screen because I try to click on it and before I know it - poof.

But that's the only small minor change for the app I'd make. The sensor is super responsive and our add on physical Ring doorbell works great too!

I wasn't sure my 70 year old mom would like the system but to my surprise as soon as our 30 day video save trial ended she asked me to sign up for the plan. She likes being able to see who is coming and going from the house right on her iPhone.

title: Not what I thought
text: This product is NOT for instantly catching in the act. If you want a video to be used at a later time, it might pass as ok for that. Sorely disappointed in both Ring products and App. If the app even lets me connect at all(does the constant circling trying to connect and mostly minutes later it fails) it takes so long that whatever motion was detected is long since done and over. So the talking through the microphone to try and scare someone off, is useless. It doesn’t always detect someone walking or parking in front of my house, yet it does detect almost every single car that drives by on street. So I spent even more money on the “wedge”, since that’s what was recommended to help with the camera angle detection and not pick up cars driving by. Didn’t work. Tried adjusting sensitivity and range settings. Ok that worked for both the cars driving by AND someone closely entering my yard. Terrible! Oh, and did I mention the camera battery only stays charged for about 2 weeks.

title: Starred events
text: I am pretty happy with my three ring products, doorbell and two solar panel cams. Like others have mentioned, there is a short lag time on notification and hope that it may be more instant in the future. One issue I have noticed and didn't get a satisfactory answer when I called Ring, I have a starred event I one camera. That event is just a couple days less than a month old. I was told that it should show up when I touch on the start icon. It does not. I get a prompt saying no recent activity. Only after loading from the "more events" icon, and then selecting the star icon again, does it show.I was told to dump the app and reload it. I did. Same issue. Wondering if this is system wide, or just a problem on my devises. Otherwise, love my Ring devices and thinking of adding a fourth camera.

title: Horrible experience overall!
text: I have had a horrible experience with Ring in all aspects so far. First when I ordered the ring doorbell I received the wrong product and I had to call 6 different times and explain each time the same situation to each representative, and I have not received my Ring Doorbell after 2 months still but it is on the way (I hope). Then while i wait for the ring doorbell I purchased a Ring Camera Indoor and finally received it today and I have spent the las 5 hours trying to get it to work and I have not been successful. Everytime I try setting it up it gives some error and does not set it up. And the one time it worked it stopped working so I removed it to my account and attempted to set it up again and have not been successful. At this point I will probably just switch to a different company. Im scared that if I ever get it to work, this will be my experience with Ring from here.

title: Pretty good.
text:
I’ve got 2 Ring Pro 2 doorbells and 5 spotlight cameras. I’m happy with it, but Ring had to replace the doorbells due to problems with the earlier models. The new ones work great. 

To the people who say the doorbells activate too late, make sure the motion detection setup can see the person before they get to the door. You might need to reposition the doorbell if it’s 90 degrees to the door and looking towards the street. Mine catches them about 5 feet before they get to the door.  Also, if you do a live view when the doorbell activates, the person may have walked away before the video comes up on your phone. You can’t force people to hang around your porch! You’ll have to review the event, which will take about 30 seconds to upload to the cloud.

title: Pointless
text:
Barely works. Will pick up a bird flying past but not a person delivering packages right to the front door. Lags terribly, takes 5 minutes to alert you of a doorbell ring. Audio goes in and out whenever it feels like it. When it alerts to motion, if you open the notification the video takes forever to load and have to close app and reopen several times to see notification, then wait while it “processes”. Ridiculous. Looking into other, more reliable brands now.

Edit: it still barely works, but now even less so. Now, it takes minutes (up to 20) to be able to use live view. Even when I close out app or restart phone. But eventually if I go view notifications history, there will be a live view video from when I was previously trying to access it, as if I had actually gotten the live view to open. So if it’s recording live view, why can’t I watch it LIVE??! Defeats the purpose...

title: Waiting over a 3 minutes for video to load
text:
Too bad you cannot add video to these reviews otherwise I would be able to show you how long I am waiting for video to process from a ring notification that I received about three minutes ago. And as I am still writing, the video is still processing.  Oh, have to touch my iPhone right now because the screen almost timed out.  

No it is not my system or anything like that.  My home Wi-Fi is running over 250 mbps, and the range extends over the distance from the device.  It is their system.  The camera I am waiting for is the outdoor camera hooked into the solar panel.  Both batteries are fully charged.  Still waiting for video to load.

Funny how the commercial tries to make you believe you will actually catch someone in the act of breaking into/trespassing at your house.  Still waiting.  Hope my family is ok.

title: Would rate it 0 stars if I could.
text: Let me start with the insufficiency and struggle just to connect to a family! I have a ring doorbell and my family member owns it, I get the invite in my emails but when I click on it, it takes me to the App Store download even though I’ve already had it up to date and installed! I click on open then I wait for 10 minutes and finally realize nothing was happening. So I had to manually connect it by uninstalling it from the door and connect many others to the device. I had it installed and it was very low in satisfaction, it reminds me by giving me notifications from every single movement that happens including wind and noise. I only want the notification when there is someone at my door when they ring the doorbell, it’s so hard outrageous! And there is a huge delay on movements and there is crappy quality on the camera, I’d rather get an Arlo doorbell then this trash! Please do not waste your money and time on this piece of junk!

title: Neighbors feature is a useless ad
text:
Several of my posts have been blocked. Ive spent hours dealing with support and they cant find anything about my posts that violates their guidelines. Apparently the only thing you can post is solicitors and yard critters. No explanation at all. I posted a parking violator who everyone of my neighbors would know is a student from across the street at the high school, and ring neighbors team apparently doesnt follow their own guidelines as the neighbors team best explanation was “we didnt feel it was right.” 
Oh and amongst my hours talking to support I found out that if anyone contacts them and asks for any posts to be taken down, that they do. So just make sure you realize smart criminals will take advantage of this. 
This service is simply an advertisement for their doorbell cams. My suspicion, they like posts that are of people acting scared and worried, what they dont want is it turning into a neighborhood watch service - which isnt a guideline, just their own special form of censorship.

title: Product not totally what I expected
text: I agree with the previous review. My system is a bit delayed at times as well. I have had delivery drivers ring the bell and by the time my ring connects and I’m able to see who’s at the door they are back in their trucks pulling off. Sometimes if I’m on the phone & someone is at my door I won’t get the notification until once I’m off the phone which means that person is already gone. Also, I find that certain times my ring doesn’t pick up at all. I have entered and exited my house and there has been no notification or recordings to show my activity.
