I have also realized that if someone exits the door I will get an alert, but if they come back in within the next minute or two my ring does not pick up the activity. I wish these issues could be fixed to enhance the performance of the product.

title: App OK ... terrible system
text:
The app, as such, works OK; the system is terrible:

The Ring doorbell came with our new home and, to be honest, it's pretty bad: (1) everyone in the household has to have a smartphone, and run the app on that phone, and have the phone with them, to know someone is at the door. My wife has missed at least a half-dozen UPS deliveries by being on the porch without a phone, which brings up; (2) there is no physical ring in the home that you can hear; (3) it's an IoT device, a world notorious for hacking and running bots; (4) the rechargeable battery lasts only a couple months, and that’s with minimal use, and is a nuisance to take out and takes hours to recharge; and, (5) the prior owner cut out part of the door frame and part of the brick front to install it (the front of the house has no flat surface) so that, if I remove it, which I would like to do, there is an unsightly rectangular hole in door jam that would need an extensive rebuild.

It’s the single worst home product that we currently have.

title: Needs alerts for device failure
text:
This app works for the most part, but it could definitely use some improvements! Probably the easiest one would be for the app to alert you when your device loses power, or network connection. I bought the Ring doorbell to provide better security for my home, but if the device is not working that obviously defeats the purpose. I do not regularly check the app, unless there is someone ringing the doorbell, but if it’s not working I would never know, and the app does not alert me to an issue. Please fix this! 
Also the video is incredibly slow to show up if there even is someone at the door and I choose/wish to answer using the app. By the time it loads up, I’ve already had time to finish what I’m doing and answer the door myself, or the person leaves before I get a chance to answer through the app.

title: Great camera, but notifications should be better!
text: I have had my ring doorbell pro for over 2 years because there hasn’t been a lot of competition that does it better. The camera is great, and motion works awesome when you set the motion area. The alerts come to my phone fast, but there is one huge issue that has me giving this three stars. Alerts only state if it is a ring or monitor and shows the ring icon. Whatever triggered the motion is always gone by the time the app opens. This means I have to wait for it to store the video 30 to 40 seconds. The app also has to load before you can see who is at the door, by that time I am typically already to the door. Ring needs to send clips with alerts if they want to get 5-stars. I’m going to move to the new Nest Hello doorbell because they send clips to show you what’s at the door before you have to open the app.

title: Remote comfort
text:
As a peace officer, I know the importance of security and evidence collection. This provides both. A common practice of the criminal is to approach the house to see if someone is home before attempting to break in. With the ring doorbell, even if they approach the door, there is a strong possibility of getting an image. With the added bonus of two way communication, it gives the impression that you’re home. 

I have not had any issues with connectivity between the app and the doorbell. The only issue I have had is phantom motion alerts. When I review the video, there isn’t anything within the boundary that was set up. When I called for assistance, they were very helpful and the false alerts went down drastically. 

I have recommended this device and app to several people and will continue to do so.

title: Ring doorbell
text: I’ve had a Ring doorbell for a little over a year now. For the first couple of months it worked great an I loved it but ever since it has been terrible. I had a Google phone and the live feed would never load even though I have really strong internet speeds. I chalked it up to my phone not being able to handle it and got a new iPhone 11 Pro but it got even worse after that. I barely ever got notifications when someone is at my front door even with sensitive settings and 9/10 when I go to check the live feed it doesn’t work. When it does work it usually disconnects pretty soon after it starts. I’ve tried troubleshooting and have put up with this app working terribly for 10 months hoping that I did something wrong on my end or a software update would fix it but nothing has helped. I looked into buying more Ring devices but I definitely won’t after my experience with my doorbell.

title: Doesn’t Work Most of the Time
text: When I initially had my RING installed, I thought it was the best thing ever invented. The delay was there but my video would come in eventually and I could see what was going on at my front door. That was a year ago. Over time the video recordings have become less and less. Most of the time I open my phone to a black screen after notification. Sometimes the video won’t open at all. Seldom can I see who is at my front door. I went from “tickled pink” to “extremely frustrated” with this product. Whenever I’ve tried to troubleshoot it tells me that my modem is offline. I’m sitting in my house and know that my modem is working fine when this is going on, so that is NOT the problem. This could be a fantastic product if it worked. MOST of the TIME it Does NOT WORK. I had many of my neighbors get RING installed after me. Very sorry I made the recommendation. When asked now, I discourage my friends from making the sale until I see some changes.

title: Delay and static
text:
So I recently replaced my alarm system with a ring alarm. I added 3 cameras, a ring pro, and alarmed my whole house with ring sensors. We spent a good fortune and fully invested in ring. We felt it was worth the investment for $100 a year with all our doors, windows, garage, and even electrical box protected. Here is why I only gave it 3 stars.

1. When talking to people through the doorbell, the reception is very choppy, static, and hard to understand. Ring attempted the fix by replacing our doorbell pro. Reception improved with people hearing us talking to them but we still can’t understand the door bell ringers. Even after upgrading our internet, our wifi to a fast speed of 130mbps.
2. No integration with apple home kit. Unable to control the cameras through SmartThings. Would be nice to have 1 app to control alarm system, cameras, door locks , lights, etc. All through Siri
3. When calling tech support, the customer service personnel, they are very courteous and nice, but sometimes repetitive and sometimes it would be nice to just get routed to tier two tech support and get our issues handled. 

4. We had an issue the other night where one of our keypads lost connection and the hub lost internet access, it took me 24 minutes with tech support and two transfers to get this resolved.
Don’t get me wrong, we feel that Ring has great potential, we only hope it gets better sooner than later.

title: I’ll pass
text: Response  and techs okay. I have no idea what limits are set. When more than one person owns same property, they should both get exact same notices. I have no idea when it is set to snooze, it should reflect on all owners. 1 family member not even living near here kept getting added with one of his old emails, funny it stopped when I confronted him by email, was told it was old, never used. Email was supposed to be switched to family, yet it is only under spouse, he uses it to watch my movements when he disappears and won’t answer communications. How can you use 2 different, all was supposed to be switched, yet both still appear. Garage off all day today. No idea if it is snoozing or just off. Sick of phone blowing up & have to open each one,why not just open on screen. Don’t have a use when you have to open each one, only use live view if it goes off. Don’t have boxes to scan upc and do proper set up. Sorry guys, not any good for me, more of a nuisance, spy tool.

title: The app is not as responsive as it should be.
text:
I’ve had Ring Doorbell Pro for about a year now. I receive all notifications which is great. The Ring chime functions as it should. But my gripe is with the app. The app frustrates me to the point it’s practically render unusable. Device Health is very good, signal strength ranges from good to very good keep that in mind. The issue I have is the app is not responsive if I open the app after the doorbell is rang. If someone is at the door I no matter what I do I can’t see who’s at the door. Which makes the app just about pointless. Whether I’m connected to Home WiFi or I’m connecting over cellular. The app video feed just shows a connecting circle but never shows the camera feed. 

The second gripe is when motion is detected you go to the app and you have to wait about 20-30 seconds before you can see the recorded feed. It’s such a pain. 

The final gripe is the iPhone X has been out since October. Why hasn’t the app been formatted to look beautifully on the iPhone X.  There have been plenty of releases since then Ring has done and not one update shows the updated format. 

As of today I wouldn’t recommend the app or the product due to the inconsistencies with failed connections and lack of keeping up to date with the phone design changes.

title: The video recording and live view took forever to watch.
text: I’ve never written a review unless it’s too good or too bad. I’ve been using Ring for over a year and My experience with ring was horrible. It takes forever to connect to the live-view through ring. And it’s not about my wifi connection, Ring gotta do better. What’s the point of having a security camera, that won’t let you check what’s going on as soon as it gives you an alert. I even had someone tried to open my door at 4AM but the ring just alert me as motion detected ( I set it up at highest sensitive), and it took over a minute for the live-view to be active, and after I heard the noise I have to went down, checked the window and yelled at the burglar to make him ran away ( police reported ). And I’m seriously thinking about cancel my subscription with Ring and move on to another service.

title: They erase and monitor neighborhood alerts
text: This is literally what we wrote for our alert on the app: “A huge FYI to everyone- Last night, we had an emergency occur in front of our RING camera. It took place for over 5 minutes with people going by and in and out of the house. There was a LOT of motion. We just checked the footage this morning for a timeline of events and LITERALLY, the footage stops recording after the first 30 seconds and goes to taking photos. In those photos, there are no people, just grass. It is our assumption that RING decided to conserve battery power with the motion occurring and CHOSE to not record. This is a MASSIVE issue, especially for those who’s houses get broken into because the RING won’t necessarily record it. We are reaching out to them today, but this defeats the purpose of owning one. We just changed our ‘motion frequency’ from standard to frequent. Hope that works.” And it was deleted within 1 minute. Nice.

title: Subpar
text: Found it humorous and slightly baffling that a technology app hasn’t found it necessary to link the subscription service they are desperately trying to sell its customers within their app... instead they make the user leave the app, do a google search and sign in all their information again somewhere else.  Your app should be capable of performing these functions or at least linking to your webpage...  Also noticed after my subscription service ended, that nearly all of my motion notifications set off about 5 minutes later when they are no longer useful.  They used to trigger immediately upon someone approaching the driveway.  I’ve done nothing to change my motion settings before this became a problem, happened the day of the trial subscription ending.  This doorbell is now just a novelty item.  Wish I would've known before purchasing.

title: Bad bad bad
text: This app is terrible or the whole system is terrible where do I start The motion detector goes off by it self..it takes you 6 to 7 attempts to look at your doorbell when somebody rings but technical support tells you my Wi-Fi is low how can the Wi-Fi  low if my doorbell is 6 feet in front of it the bell .... I would try a different system or a different company that has better technology than ring I recommend Ring to a friend I go to hook up it don’t hook up I call ring and of course the system is down while I wait 30 to 25 minutes on the phone to talk to somebody poor customer service. .Like I said I would recommend a different company or system that friends have that on much better so do your homework stay away from this app product. Don’t say I didn’t warn you when you write a bad review about it to cheaper ones out there that are better this system needs a whole new update I can’t keep up with the demand get a company that will  . )======ChezTrap)>>>>>

title: Cameras frequently and randomly won’t connect
text: Very long time user. Same old issue with reliability. For no diagnosable reason the cameras just won’t connect to the network at random times. It isn’t an internet issue. It isn’t the location of he cameras. It is simply at random a camera might say goodbye. My cameras have never been moved nor the router(only to diagnose). They may be reliable for weeks…and then one day when you hear a noise outside and want to take a look…nothing, no connection. Other cameras work fine at the same time accept the one you want. At random. Sometimes a camera won’t work for days then suddenly it’s connected up and fast to access. Had three cameras now down to two. And won’t be using this type of extremely VULNERABLE system in the near future. Hard wired battery backed up with local storage is the only reliable system. Too many things can go wrong with a ring system.

title: Motion Sensor Problems
text:
We’ve had our ring doorbell 2 for about a year and have really enjoyed it. However, about a month ago it started sensing motion constantly. I’ll wake up in the morning with 30-50 moron alerts. It’s possible it’s our tree in blowing in the wind, but I trimmed all the branches back and we turned the range to the smallest setting we could and we still have all the problems. We didn’t have this problem before, so it could be a new glitch in the software. 

We are very unhappy with this; our battery is draining so fast now, and we no longer check on our motion notifications. So if something was happening, we’d never know. At this point I would not recommend to anyone.

Update: this stopped for several months but has since started up again. I received well over 200 mention alerts last night. If this keeps happening I will have to uninstall my Rong doorbell and look into Arlo.

title: Hype - it’s ok, not great
text: All my videos at least have a moment of freeze, strangely enough it’s during a moment that actually catches the moment I would want to see. Getting into the app when someone is at my door never seems to work.  I have 300 mps, it’s well in range and the ring app gives it a good rating for connection.  My daughter was outside, it kept telling me their were alerts at my front door.  I’m fine with that.  But the moment a UPS guy came to my door it ignored it.  That I care about.  It should be able to detect another person and over ride its “not alerting” you life if it sees a new motion outside of existing range it’s been detecting.   I will say battery life on devices have been good, picture is decent non HD.  Like I said, it’s ok, but it certainly needs a lot of improvement especially charging monthly for video that hasn’t been good.  I have three devices, two doorbells and one spot light, all with same issues.

title: I wish I could give 0 stars
text: I have to agree with everyone on here complaining about the lag. I’ve had the ring doorbell for almost a year and no matter what I do it continues to have the same issues. Every time I get a notification the app lags to open, by the time is does the person is gone and then I need to wait a few minutes while the video loads to be able to see who it was. I’ve also noticed that when UPS or mailman are delivering a package the ring doesn’t start recording till they are already walking away. Yesterday was my breaking point though! My daughter called me and said some car had pulled up in front of our house and started taking pictures of our house. He then drove away and sat at the end of the street for a few minutes. I just on the app to see the footage and the doorbell never caught anything!!! Don’t waste your money on this junk. There are better ones out there.

title: Does Not Work as Advertised
text:
You get alerts when someone rings the doorbell or motion is tripped.  You can see these alerts pretty fast on WiFi.  However on LTE you have to wait for 30% or more to be buffered before it shows you what triggered the motion.  This can take a few minutes to buffer/download.  It can also take a few minutes for ring to create the alert in your history so you can view what triggered the alert on LTE which occurs first.  So seeing who is there real-time only works on WIFI. I have had the service for 6 months and there has been no improvement with app updates yet.

Update about 1 year - Lag has improved to 2-4 minutes on LTE.  You can still not talk to them or respond real-time while on a cell phone (LTE).  The idea is great, the motion alert, recording to see what happened is great, the response time needs allot of improvement.

title: Not happy with this video system
text: We got this RING as a recommendation from the sales rep who sold us a security system package after there was an attempted home invasion in our house last October. At first we were happy with the RING. It worked great during the first month. But then it started to provide us with poor quality viewing, freezing video recordings, black screen videos and interrupted sounds or no sound at all. I contacted RING customer service in December and we were sent a replacement and we sent the original back. There was a software update yesterday and it’s the same crap again. Most of the videos recorded are in black, no sound and when I press the delete icon, I get an ALERT message that there is a problem.  This is frustrating. I’ve tried calling customer service but am put on a long hold. I’m ready to give up on RING and purchase a different video doorbell with another company.

title: Quite good but could be better
text: One week now and I’ve enjoyed using the Ring app. Appreciate the configurability and UI in general. However, one area of functionality that seems weak or a missed opportunity is motion zones. Concept is great but implementation needs improvement. Need to be able to control sensitivity (and ideally frequency) by zone.  Currently, settings are only applicable globally except perhaps for privacy zones. Why create multiple zones if the behavior is the same for all?  Also consider this. Given the cheap cost of cloud storage and broadband speeds near 1G , I would strongly argue for full resolution on the 3 second previews of Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus. There’s really no reason to limit the resolution in today’s world. Other than that, very pleased with app.

title: Awful app, slow connection time to cameras
text: The app is pretty awful. Whenever I try to connect to cameras, it’s extremely slow if it connects at all. Our year of the protection plan is over with that, the option to view past footage has been cancelled. This wouldn’t be that big of a deal if viewing live footage was possible but it’s not really. It takes so long to connect to live footage after a notification that what is there is likely gone if I can even get connected at all. Recently, all my husband and I see on the app is “streaming error: more info, reconnect” neither button (more info or reconnect) help. Ring is completely pointless without the protection plan so we are contemplating signing up for it again, however, the app wasn’t great with the protection plan but at least you could view the old footage later if something happened.

title: Speaker volume is useless
text:
The chime sound is nice and loud, but the two-way audio speaker is inaudible. This has been going on for the entire year that we’ve had the device. Anyone at my front door has to put their ear right up against the speaker to hear.
We decided to just live with it, but after a few missed deliveries and a package theft we decided to contact Ring for help. We received absolutely no support. All they do is tell me to reset the device. They told me to take a video of what I am experiencing, so I did. Three weeks later and Ring hasn’t even acknowledged the effort. There is a thread on the Ring community site that’s been active since early 2019. Lots of other customers are having the same problem, and Ring isn’t even acknowledging it. I like everything else about the doorbell, and I want to buy more devices, but the lack of support from Ring is extremely worrying and forcing me to look elsewhere.

title: Update! More like a downgrade
text: As other reviewers have previously stated these updates are horrible. The “lag” now renders these cameras useless. Someone can pull in my driveway and enter my garage before I get an event notification. Then I open my camera and it takes another 30 seconds to a minute for the video to load up. Ring has changed the video view mode. Instead of clicking on the camera to bring up its prospective video it brings up the setting menu. Why? Why did you think this was a good idea? Now You have to click the HISTORY menu and scroll through ALL your cameras videos and hope to find the video you’re looking for. Thankfully I have 2 cameras. I was going to pick up 2 more but the hassle Ring has created with these updates, I think I’ll hold off on that purchase. The updates take the app from user friendly to now being cumbersome. You did add a panic button. That’s nice.

title: Getting better
text:
I’ve had about it for several months, and have seen the stream of updates. There is, however, more to do. 

1. Most critical: need date/time stamp overlay on the video itself. Couldn’t this be done with firmware update? The smartphone already has that info. 

2. Need ability for user to change the default recording duration. Also, please provide option for user to enable any feature that is provided on the wired systems, on the battery units; someone at Ring is deciding that a feature is too power hungry for a battery... let the user decide. If they don’t mind recharging batteries more often, to get less constraints, so be it. Of course, many bought the solar panel as well, as I did, and are very happy with how quickly it recharges the batteries - power is NOT an issue for me.

title: I LOVE RING♥️♥️♥️♥️
text: My family and I absolutely love ring! It allows us to see whose at our home whether we’re there or not! There is a two-way talk on the video doorbell, in door camera, and the flood light camera, so that I can talk to whoever is at the door or around my home! I ABSOLUTELY LOVE the security system even when our lights were out for 5 days plus during the Texas snow storm my alarm was still actively working from the backup which was AWESOME! I also love that the indoor cams have sirens that can be connected to your alarm system as well as the flood light cam! And the police will be notified immediately. The most important part about ring to me and my family is that it’s AFFORDABLE and it’s quality!

title: Ring is a game changer
text: Not sure about all the negative feedback. I have had no problems at all since getting the ring alarm system. I have two motion sensors, 15 contact door and window sensors, an extender, keypad, and hub. I got that all for about 485 including taxes. All alerts are instant whether on WiFi or cellular on multiple phones on multiple carriers. You can’t beat 10 dollars a month for pro monitoring in addition to the 50 dollar permit I have to get annually for the cops to show up if my system goes off. Plus you get 10% off all future ring products if your on the $10 pro plan.  The app is flawless in my opinion but I don’t have ring cameras. I have a separate camera system for that. Ring cameras are too pricey for me.

title: Bad Devices, poor quality and ridiculous staff
text:
1st off the HD write up on their products is not very accurate.  

It’s not HD at night,.. it’s NOT HD during the day.  

It’s HD as long as there is nothing happening in the view screen. 

Lag time is unacceptable and it’s worse if anything is actually happening.  Random blank spots, missing video and blurry images.

It’s so blurry that you cannot identify a make of car if it drives by.   You cannot zoom in to read a license plate. 

And then you have the unacceptable staff editorial staff who gets to decide if you get to post or share from your PAID PREMIUM RING MEMBERSHIP- who block posts of people trespassing or theft of vandalism because the staff “feel for the criminal”and block you from sharing your video or images on the RING APP.

Really!  A truck is trespassing on private property and is going into every garbage can taking mail, trash or what every they want.   And RING staff think that this person should get a free pass to rummage through your personal information and trash on private property,... without anyone reporting it.  

RING is a scam.  The clarity is only good for 5-7 feet from the camera.   You cannot zoom in - the fake HD pixelated into blur. 

At best RING is designed so you can watch “somebody” steal your packages or  Vandalizing your property,.. and all you get to do is watch it happen.

title: Unusable
text:
Updated: The app is now completely unusable. Live view will not load at all after the last update, which is the last “straw” of my patience with this horribly overpriced product. I plan to purchase Nest from Costco tomorrow ($200 for the Nest, 1 year of recording for free, and the Google speaker).  

Ring (eventually) achieves what it sets out to do: provide access to a camera outside my home and notify me of a doorbell ring. 

However, I experience anywhere from 3-90 seconds delay when trying to “answer” a ring, rendering that feature impossible to use. 

For the network-at-fault naysayers; I’m running Ubiquiti AMPLIFI mesh through a bridged Comcast gateway, and have less than 1ms latency internally (below 30ms to Google DNS) with nominal jitter internally (and under 5ms average external). One of the WiFi extenders is just seven feet from the doorbell. My phone runs on the same network as well.

Additionally, the 30 second recording limit isn’t enough time because the camera doesn’t even pick up the first 2-5 seconds of the motion sometimes. People stand at the door longer than that. If someone is damaging my property, that’s hardly enough time to capture a full event. 5-10 minutes should be an option included with the monthly subscription. 

Two stars because I can check the door when I want (though delayed to start) and have some past recordings available.

title: Happy Customer!
text: I’m not having all the issues everyone is complaining about. I have the Ring Pro, and optional CHIME, that I installed myself, works perfectly,  two Small issues That I do have are :CHIME sound quality is not as good as my iPad tiny speaker, thought it was a defect, returned it and second one sounded just as bad,also the blue indicator ligh is so faint, you can’t see it for blinks during setup! Second is the camera only focuses a narrow area, I have five steps down to ground, and camara can’t focus on a sign I have ten feet out from camera, because it’s not in the sweet spot for lens, with everyone competing in this security category, RING has to step up their design. Don’t let these issues stop you from purchase, hope this helps both sides.

title: Huge delays
text: We love the idea of Ring, so much so that we bought the doorbell, several cameras, and the security system. This review is primarily for the doorbell. The motion detector often doesn’t alert or record until several seconds after someone has passed through the motion detection range. Yet somehow it alerts us to cars driving down the street. Additionally, the app rarely (20% tops) allows us to open the doorbell alert. We click on the alert immediately, with full cell service,  and the app opens to a black screen with the answer/Hangup buttons and an indication it is loading, but never loads. Therefore, we cannot use it to see who is ringing the bell and speak to them, which defeats our primary purpose. It’s really disappointing that so many users have complaints like this and they are not being resolved. We do like the interface for the security system in the app, it’s really easy to use.

title: Also so delayed video
text:
I have had this problem since I bought and installed Ring. When I asked support the only response was your wifi is too slow, although the app said the wifi strength was good.  When I replied to them that the video delay doesn't happen when I have the live view going I didn't get any response. Starting to think about going to other door video company maybe their customer service actually respond to questions. On the positive side I was able to catch my mailman tossing packages at my house thanks to Ring.  Thank you for that.
Update: 
At this point, the software can’t get any worse.  Live video works without any problems or delays. The motion video however delays within two seconds of playback. The help desk just brushes off the issue saying it’s the Wi-Fi speed even though the software itself indicates the speed is good and the speed is twice the minimum required.

title: Disappointed
text: I can’t get customers service so I guess I let my feelings known here. My stickup camera is completely blank , camera health is good no issues with my wifi. I believed that ring purposely cause this without any notification, as the camera was  partly focus in my neighborhood back yard , but the motion is set for my yard only. I only now realized that , that might be the reason why this happen. I tried to set the privacy settings , but you can’t do it on a blank , black screen. This was not purposely done and I should have been sent an email , so now my back yard live stocks is compromised , and there is no customer support. For that I have to gave a 3 star as I’m very disappointed

title: Camera’s Can’t Be Reconnected Remotely
text:
After updating the Wi-Fi information, prepare to deal with an absolute nightmare.

Ring’s base station can easily be re-connected but the cameras are a different situation altogether. This is an unnecessary security issue because if you need the cameras, say to watch your kids outside, there’s nothing you can do to reset it. I’ve tried everything but nothing worked. The base station and the camera(s) don’t operate together as one would think. Only the sensors are an actual issue for the base i.e. if one goes offline — arming the alarm would be pointless. It’s weird that there’s no silent alarm either. I think it would be better in certain situations. Ring has sat by idly while there’s thief’s, potential predators or other criminals taking pictures, and possibly other vandals sitting on my house (no exaggeration: these things are reported where I live). Don’t get Ring. You’ll regret it.

title: Ring doorbell is great but  Can’t add Neighborhoods feature
text:
I purchased the Ring because a neighbor shared a video and note about a package thief in our neighborhood on a local facebook group page.  I was intrigued by the whole “neighborhoods” thing that works with Ring. 

So. Ordered the Ring and set it up.  Video works great.  Alerts.  That was easy.  Not so fast it seems. Bearing in mind I purchased it because of the neighborhood feature it’s now rather ironic that I cannot get THAT bit working on the app. 

Spent over an hour last night with support (via chat) trying to add the neighborhoods feature to my app.  It seems like if you first add a Ring device (and create an account) you then have no way to add the neighborhood feature (it’s nowhere in my app). No icon for neighborhood is anywhere in my app. No swiping left or right on the devices page shows anything either. 

After trying many things (logging out, logging back in, deleting app, re-installing app) the support person gave up and said he’ll forward my issue to 2nd level support and they’ll “get back to me” when it’s fixed.  So far nothing. No acknowledgement of my support issue has appeared in my email.  So will I get a response? 

Pretty disappointed in my first experience with support.

title: Still no motion unless doorbell rung
text: I have taken off, reset as new, tried every setting possible and my Video Doorbell 2 will not detect motion without the doorbell being rung. I’ve heard others had same issue. I can’t recommend this doorbell. I bought from Costco maybe two years ago. At about 6-7 months this problem arose. Over time I’ve thought maybe an update would cure it, nah. I’ve just learned to deal with it. Today was the last straw. A porch pirate struck and no video. Don’t waste your money on this doorbell.  Look for another reliable home camera system. There are really good systems out there for about $400-$600 including four 4K wireless cameras and hard drive and no monthly! Yes someone responded from Ring last year and they were no help. I did all the resetting etc to no avail. Very disappointed. Again, this unit will not detect motion without doorbell button being pressed. Maybe a sensor is defective?

title: Allow Vertical change in motion alert parameters
text: We have the Ring 2. I live in a house that has an elevated front door which allows you to see the roadway. I’ve looked for an alternate ring backplate that allows you to shift the focus of the motion sensing downwards but Ring has not released one for the Ring 2 as of yet. We like the capability of the ring doorbell 2 but are frustrated with the sensitivity and not being able to control that. I see that you can adjust the motion sensors left and right, and outwards but none of those seem to work for our house. We continue to get ring chime alerts saying a car is going past our house ALL DAY. We’ve tried changing the distance the motion sensor but to no avail. I wonder if Ring can modify/make an update to allow for a user change in the vertical motion sensing just as it does for the horizontal?? Or, simply manufacture a downward adjusting backplate for the Ring 2 right now?

title: So disappointed
text: We started with the Ring doorbell a couple years ago and loved it. We added spotlight cams since and they seemed to work pretty consistently. NOW it’s hit or miss whether motion will be picked up. Doorbell- We come home to find packages on the front porch and no corresponding activity. Spotlight cam - We get activity  notifications that we can’t view until the person is gone or the 30 second activity is viewable. Sporadically, the live view just spins and never displays. Today the spotlight can at our garage has totally stopped working. I know our sons came and went twice and Ring never recorded anything (worked fine last night). I’ve checked the battery level (we have a solar panel) and WiFi connection and both are strong. At a time when there have been several incidents in our area, we need something reliable and I no longer feel Ring is reliable. 5 down to 2 stars.

title: Love the products but hate the app
text: Services offered and pricing on products are decent but the app itself is terrible. Viewing “live” always seem to freeze for me when I need to view it the most. So it inconveniently freezes and doesn’t work again for at least 30minutes. Also when it catches movements it starts recording but even after changing the settings to record longer, for some reason it cuts off again inconveniently at the important scenes. And they added a new feature to customize motion zones but it cuts off half the frame and you can’t zoom out to get the entire frame. So if you wanted to set a motion zone on the top half of whatever angle you have, it’s impossible. So frustrating that consumers have to deal with this while paying for the services.

title: DO NOT PURCHASE RING PRODUCTS!!!
text:
I have owned Ring products since they came out. I have spent a small fortune on Ring products and spent more time on the phone troubleshooting a product that doesn’t work. Why should I be repairing a product(s) that I paid top dollar for. At this point they should be paying me for my service! 
I’m so disappointed in RIng and so glad to see it’s not my problem because other people are having the same issues. When hundreds of other Ring customers are having the same issues as myself customer service needs to be honest and tell you they are working on the problem but right now you are screwed! Not even we will give you credit for your troubles or something. Shame on you Ring for not adequately caring for the people the have supported you!
Could you please revise your app to work properly instead of freezing up when you answer it and to be able to communicate through the Ring doorbell as advertised!!

title: App is worse now
text:
July 2021 update. The latest version of the app keeps logging me out so I have to login again, several times a day. And the login is overly complicated with obligatory codes sent by email, no true two factor authentication, and not recognizing trusted devices.

 Awful. An App Store rating only covers the app itself, not the related hardware or service. The Ring hardware is pretty decent, especially for the price, compared to other brands, but the app needs a lot of improvement. The layout and navigation are very confusing. Response is slow. The display disappears when switching to another app or back to the Ring app. The app keeps flipping to portrait mode even when your device is kept in landscape position. Viewing videos does not automatically rotate when rotating your device. App does not work well in landscape view (keeps flipping to portrait mode). A lot of room for improvement.

title: Just a fancy doorbell
text:
We really wanted to like it! So much so, that we bought one for each set of our elderly parents.  Unfortunately we've all had so much difficulty, and we have honestly tried everything.  They are all three hard-wired, we all have great internet speeds and a repeater near the device.  The doorbell rings, however by time you are able to access through the app notification, it takes too long to connect and whoever was there is long gone.  Not once in a whole year and a half has that feature worked for any of us. The only good feature, if you pay $40 for the year, you can access the recorded view after the fact, to see who came by your door.  Also, the neighborhood posts are nice.  

I would not recommend this doorbell to anyone however.
Too many people have the same problem and it should have been addressed in this amount of time.

title: Fizzled fast...
text: I cannot even tell you how excited we were to get this product. I was hoping for a game changer.  It really kicked my paranoid obsession up a notch. So exciting! My husband installed it right away, and it seemed we were ready to go. Within a day or so, we found it to be so unreliable. Getting alerts were sporadic. “Live view” was unreliable and just gave us the circle that indicated that it was loading. I would check the signal strength and everything ship-shape, and nothing seemed wrong.  Just sporadic. My husband disassembled it took it all down and re-attached it last night. We set it up again, and again it was unreliable. Today it worked all morning and I got alerts, but then suddenly around 2 o’clock in the afternoon I started NOT getting alerts. It just stopped working. I could not even get a live view. Needless to say I am completely disappointed.  Boo hoo!  Don’t know what to do!

title: Ring review 😌
text:
I bought a ring doorbell pro for a Christmas gift I hired someone to install it for me and when it got installed a week later their were some bugs whenever a car would pass at night we would never get a motion alert it records all the motions in the morning but after 7pm 
it’s cutoff we don’t get motion alerts after7pm when we get home and go in the driveway doesn't pick up our car  and everyday day we had to call ring the problem is still there I’m not done   After 30days I was never informed that it would stop recording and not save footage and after the 30days was up we got an alert saying we had to pay to let our ring record our house and that’s not fair To customers that have spent their money on the doorbell and not be informed about that I am very disappointed about my ring doorbell pro this is very unprofessional for them to do if I had known that it wouldn’t not record continuously I would have never Bought it

title: Not bad but I wouldn't buy it again
text:
Overall I'm pretty happy with the ring doorbell. It works most of the time. It doesn't work when I try and view the camera from a notification though. It just spins without ever showing the picture. If I click live view directly from the app then it works most of the time. 

The notification sound for motion is the most annoyingly long sound and they don't provide options to change it. I end up turning the motion detection off because I go crazy every time I hear the 5 minute wind chimes that play.  

If I were in the market for a new video doorbell I would not buy this unit again. While it does work most of the time, the fact that I can't click on a ring or motion notification and actually view the camera is a deal breaker. Also the fact that I can't use motion notifications because of the unchangeable sound is another deal breaker.

title: My ring device
text: It keeps burglars and home invasions down 100 percent of the time.  Where were you when I needed you four years ago.  Your here now so that’s good.  Your ring product is good.  Keep the price (s) down on your product.  Don’t start raising prices like other security products do or ring will end up being a thing of the pass for me as well.  Keep upgrading and inventing your product.  Do not become like ADT or other security products that carry a very extreme high price tag or this product will become a thing of the pass for me and my family.  Also one last thing; make the pictures a little more clearer at night and day.  Thank you.

title: Excellent product and app
text: This is an excellent product and the app works great. It records everything you want based on the settings you choose with great quality. It reached from my home all the way across the street until I adjusted the settings to reduce the range, and the width is incredible reaching both walls 20ft apart on my porch. The only thing people may complain about is if it takes awhile to load live view BUT that is solely based on your internet speed at your home AND your phone, has nothing to do with the app. I have Verizon mobile and it loads live view very fast, but my wife has AT&T and it tends to los slowly when we aren’t home. At home we have no issues since we have fast internet speed.

title: Feel like Another social media app
text: I personally do not like social media app. The reason I wanted to try ring cameras because I wanted to see who is on the other side of my door when someone visits me. Well first this app feel like another social media app. You get lots of notifications from neighbors around and some neighbors make some inappropriate comments about people stealing packages. There is no way to opt from neighbors watch. The only way is to opt is to go to settings and create a small circle so you don’t get notifications from other neighbors. This is not good. I want privacy and I don’t want to get notifications from neighbors that are 20 blocks away or 10 blocks away. For this reason I will try another camera device. For now good bye. Also ring video doorbell 2 is not ready. So many delays and I have 100 mbps connection and no one is using my internet besides my phone and laptop.

title: App is difficult to use
text: I’ve had a Ring Pro doorbell for several years. I’ve struggled with power and signal issues and had many long calls with their customer service, who are nice enough but haven’t been able to actually resolve the issues. I’ve upgrade my doorbell transformer twice and moved my wireless access point at least five times. It’s currently leaning against the inside of a window five feet from the doorbell and I still see signal issues that can only be caused by the doorbell itself. This review is about the app however. The UI is not great and it is almost impossible to locate a recording and play it without a video clip starting up and blasting audio at you while you fumble around to pause/stop the video. I’ll keep using the Ring Pro because I don’t know of a better solution but I’m very careful who I recommend it to.

title: Not worth the money
text:
Horrible audio, and video wasn’t the best. Delay in the video/lagging - sometimes up to 20-25 seconds. Couldn’t access live feed for the most part unless you were sitting in your living room. Didn’t always pick up motion when someone was at the door. Just didn’t do what we paid for it to do. Contacted customer support. Got responses (not answers) Was told our internet/wi-fi were good, was told to reset. Did that - didn’t fix the problem but no support. The average time of a response- 2 days. Average time of day of responses- night time 😐 A 2 day response time tells me they aren’t big on customer service. We returned ours and got a refund. Will look to buy another product from another manufacturer. We may have just gotten a defective one, but when you can’t get a response- how do you know. 
Was very excited when we purchased it, very disappointed after installing. I personally cannot/will not recommend this product.

title: Good but not great...
text:
I have recently noticed more and more lags in time when I get notifications and when I don’t. I also have a bad connection when trying to use the microphone to talk to anyone while they are at my door. There is a big delay in timing and static sound on the receiving end. It just seems jittery as a whole. All of my wireless devices work great on my network, so it is not a connectivity issue.

I do agree with others that there is a 3-5 second delay in motion versus when I receive a notification. Many times the object which causes the motion is gone by the time I am able to see the live motion view. 

I do not dislike the product, but I do wish there was further support to fix the issues that many users are having. I have begun to look elsewhere for security options in the event that Ring does not start supporting updates that address the concerns of it’s users.

title: Bought 2. Back Door Dies In Days
text:
The app itself is fine but I bought 2 video cams and the 2nd one has had to be charged twice now and I have had the sensor area turned off after the first time. I hate losing work to make calls and deal with getting it replaced. If I had to do it again I wouldn’t purchase the ring.

Update. Spoke with customer service and it was fixed with a reset. Hoyt was fabulous!  He convinced me to buy the Solar Mounts, feeling I would not have to charge them again, as I had a stroke and walking and standing is a big work out, but they don’t work. The solar chargers slow it down ALOT, so that is fine. Nothing is perfect. I love the product, just have a lot of family in and out I suppose.

title: When it works, it’s great
text: Since the latest update, it records up to about 5-7 seconds of action and then freezes which supposedly their way of supporting battery life because there’s “nothing to see” but it will free when I’m still walking up to my door when I get home from work so if it’s doing that, it’ll clearly do that if a person was walking to my door to steal/drop off a package, knock on my door, etc. this is a stupid function that can’t be turned off. The live view option when doing it manually or when a get a notification that someone is at my door leaves a black recording or screen and so I can never do love view if I want an actual recorded video when I get a notification someone is at my door. I have only had this for a month and just subscribed to the yearly service and am pretty disappointed.

title: Update: they won't fix the simplest of problems
text:
As an update: I have asked ring to put a time delay on the motion alert setting so that every waving flag, passing car or someone walking down the street doesn't set it off....I have asked three times for them to fix this annoying omission. I get at least 20 false alarms per day. I'm turning this feature off which negates the purpose of buying this device in the first place.

I've had the Ring Pro for about a year and the standard product for about 18 months before that. I like the features for the most part and they have the right idea on functionality.

I would offer the following feedback/improvement ideas:
1. The product requires a fairly high upload bandwidth (most people who complain about a spinning circle would be helped by more bandwidth). I didn't get mine to function until I was above 2.5mbs upload speed. The designers should compress this better.
2. There should be a timer setting in the product to allow the user to set a time delay for motion. My flag in the front yard waves and I get an alert up to 20 times/day if the wind is right. A timer to allow me to require 2 seconds before alerting would solve this....it's annoying.
3. The pricing for the cameras is too high. There should be a flat fee for a household for a year.

I still would buy it again but it's got some bugs.

title: IS IT TRULY BUILT FOR SECURITY?
text:
When will Ring do some of the most common, logical things especially when you pay a monthly subscription!?
Dark mode & being able to view all cameras live at the same time! & not have to keep activating the camera because you can only watch it live for a short moment!? 
These are the basics for any security system!
What does it say about a security system that is modern & pay for monthly & does not have the most logical common basics in the year 2020?!
That’s the real questions but they are coming out with a Sentinel Drone that flies around your home!
Furthermore then they advertise a separate app called,” Rapid Ring,” that says it’s the fastest way to respond to notifications & built for speed & the simplest way to check on your home & GOD knows what further permissions it needs to be running a second app. 
It’s a security application, it should be centered & seamless, for SECURITY reasons.
Am I in my own world but shouldn’t the Ring app do this already.
I am paying for it!???
Humans really need to see the TRUTH about products & the relationship with consumers. 
 Which brings the question of its true purpose of the app, is it built for your true use for security or what’s going on behind the curtain to actually monitor your activities & the devices that you download there applications too?

title: Why can’t I control all notification to different devices?
text: This app is actually decently well made. It has plenty of features, but lacks one very important thing that is kind of a no brainer imo. As far as I know, you can’t control the notifications between all devices. If I snooze notifications because I don’t want the camera tracking my motion and notifying everybody, it just snoozes MY DEVICE ONLY. This is extremely annoying for my wife or invited guests, as it spams their phones with notifications as I am doing yard work, taking out the trash, etc. Sure, they can snooze the notifications in their app, but I should be able to do it as the main account holder. There needs to be an ability to stop motion notifications across any account linked to the main account.

title: Very good but...
text:
Ring is a very good app. It makes me feel very safe with camera around my house, but I think there could be some changes.
1. Needs to be faster: When ever so thing just happened at a camera and I get the notification and I tap on the app, then I will go through everything and etc. then it will take over a minute for it to load the video. Maybe I have really bad wifi but if this is a problem for everyone, could you please work with that.
2. Can’t find the video: recently someone rang my doorbell (that’s were I have a ring doorbell and camera) and I can’t seem to find the video. It does not even say it’s processing, so if you could please help with that to. Otherwise it’s a great app and creation.

title: Terrible product!!
text: This product has never worked properly since I installed it.  I’ve called customer service numerous times, it’s always the same story. “Let’s restart it, lets reinstall the app, everything looks good on our end, etc etc”.  I still cannot connect to live feed or talk to or see anyone when the ring the bell.  It’s actually worse now than when I installed it.   Now it says I have all this motions and recordings but hardly any of the recordings open and when they do it’s a completely black video.  Smh.  Awful!!!  Just awful!!   And in the beginning I was told my WiFi wasn’t stating enough, so I got a new router and made sure I had the fastest service possible. I also tried their chime PRO to I have the connection.  Nothing made a difference.  I give up!!!  I think ring should offer some sort of reimbursement or replacement or send me a different product all together.

title: Love it... BUT...
text: I love my ring cameras (I have 2), but one thing that would make it so much better would be the ability to filter events by day/time... I hate having to scroll through a bajillion recordings to find what I am looking for.  We have a lot of problems with nighttime prowlers, and it would be convenient if I could filter events to only see things that happened between like 11pm-5:00am.  I know I can turn the camera off during the daytime, but I want the option of having those recordings in case something noteworthy happened.  It would also be a good feature in case one of my neighbors says “hey, did anybody catch anything on their cameras last Tuesday between 3-5pm?“ it would be so much easier to locate.

title: Not so great
text: I am an officer and thought that the ring would be great to keep my family and neighbors safe! Upon seeing suspicious activities in front of my home at 248 am I called the police in the neighborhood they responded and canvassed the neighborhood. I went to share this information and the video with neighbors and it was declined by Ring! That is correct a car that nearly drove up my front yard and let someone out at nearly 300am was not considered concerning enough to be shared with my neighbors! However, you can watch unlimited amounts of videos of your neighbors wild animals! It’s really cool! I’ve seen Fox, coyotes, squirrels, various birds and deer! However, you won’t see suspicious activity occurring in your neighborhood unless Ring approves! Coming from an officer, this is scary to know considering activity maybe denied and your safety compromised because Ring didn’t find safety information to their liking! Find another company that puts your safety as their priority!

title: Good but needs work (a lot)
text:
Love using Ring to be aware of what’s going on around our house, but there are some drawbacks of the app that really hold me back from the complete and efficient experience of using Ring. For one, the app desperately needs iPhone X support. The entire UI looks unappealing on the iPhone X. Second, there are always delays and frequently “can’t connect to Ring” errors, especially when a camera’s motion goes off. Clicking the motion notifications causes the app to endlessly connect to the camera and never loads. You either have to force close the app, or keep pressing “live view” and the red “end” button to see video feed. The app in general also runs slow. It clearly needs optimizations.

Also, most importantly, I never told Ring to make dog barking noises to go off every time there’s a neighborhood activity reported.

title: Scheduling
text: This app and products are really great. I can keep an eye on multiple properties at once. However, there is one problem in my opinion. Scheduling. The app allows you to schedule when alerts are pushed after motion is detected. Sadly, if you leave the motion zone active and schedule a time for alerts to not be sent, it still logs ALL the activity. Think of a front door. I think it would be really nice to schedule when the motion zones are active, not just when alerts are sent. For example, turn off the motion zones during the weekend day time when there is a lot of in and out from your front door. That way, it doesn’t log a bunch of you and your family and friends coming and going. Just captures events that are pertinent to the security of your home.

title: How do you know that was a ring recording?
text:
If you see a recording of someone leaving a residence, but never saw them approach the house ... that was probably a ring video. I choose to upgrade to the Pro 3 with pre-roll and now I get to see a shadowy figure in Black and White - yippee. So I pay for a service that I still cant tell who is taking stuff off my front porch. Well a guy can wish for a product to do what is expected. 

Remember thieves don’t stick around waiting at the door when they just want to get away. Also, don’t use this service for piece of mind. Mine only records a third of the activity. I was outside and saw something happen like just now and went to check the recording and you guessed it - No recording. When it does notify me of motion and I go check the video it says processing for maybe 5 minutes and by then the person has already left. You go Ring (AI rocks).

title: Delay in accessing live feed
text: We've had this installed for about a week. I was so excited about getting the flood light camera for view and lighting of our driveway and front yard. Every time we get a motion alert and click on the banner, forget ever seeing a live view because it just spins and tries to connect. It takes closing out the app two or three times to finally get the live camera to connect. By that time 5 minute can pass and the purpose of having the camera is moot. Also, many times I try to go back and see what the motion detected was at least while the lived feed is buffering, and alas it says that is “processing “. We are beyond disappointed and won’t every purchase another Ring product unless this app has some significant improvements. I don’t think I’m expecting too much to access my live feed.

title: Great Product/Long Load Times
text: The Ring itself is great. The quality is awesome and it looks nice as a doorbell. The ONLY downside of having this product is that it sometimes doesn’t load when I receive a notification that someone is at my front door. I’ve reset my wifi, used cellular data, even used different wifi and it would still say “Activating Device” when trying to load my live feed on the app. The app is updated so I’m not really sure how to alleviate this problem.. This happens probably 1-10 times I use it, so I’m not saying it’s a bad product at all. It’s just annoying and sketchy when I’m trying to see if there is activity at my front door and can’t because my Ring app won’t load.

title: False sense of security...
text: These cameras, the app, the user interface, it’s all garbage... We have used them for about 3 years now and I keep trying to give them a chance. No more... We have crazy fast internet, but for some reason (yes all app and firmware updates are current) it’s always glitchy. The sounds cuts in and out. The video is color, then black and white, then  no picture at all. It’s always something, always! And you know what’s funny? It’s never their fault... It’s always our internet speeds, our distance from the router, too cold, too hot, too foggy, the hardwire connection.... Thank goodness I have decide to share my amazing RING experience with my 48k Instagram followers. I have had a HUGE response in my weekly Ring tests that I post. When it does “work”, it’s so delayed that whoever comes to the door is always shown walking away, which is great for a facial ID... Take my word, don’t waste your money!!!

title: A disappointment in Ring overall
text: Trying to be patient, but it’s difficult when the app and/or device is defective. I should have done more research before investing in the spotlight camera, solar charger, and extra battery. There are too many inconsistencies with both the app and the device. Recording is spotty even with signal strength RSSI -21 (really solid connection) and two batteries at 100% almost constantly (drops to 95% at the lowest). At times it doesn’t work at all. I can literally stand in front of the camera during a sunny 78 degree day and jump around like an idiot without the camera triggering the recording. What is the point of this “security camera/system” if it doesn’t actually do what it is advertised for? As I said to begin with, if only I better researched before buying, I could have avoided this whole headache. Most of what you will find in researching is much of the same. You got a 50/50 chance of being satisfied. Good luck!

title: Great System with Need For Improvement
text: Biggest complaint right now is that for Home Mode, where you are in your house and not planning on leaving for the night, the options for entry/exit delay are 0s-30s+. So if someone breaks into your house, you have 30 seconds before the alarm even triggers, then another 30 seconds before the system calls you to verify, then who knows how long until help arrives. Unless of course you choose 0 seconds, which is the most expedient, however if you ever forget the alarm before you open a door/window in the morning, the alarm will go off immediately. I recommend that there be a 5 or 10 second option so people can set their alarms and feel safer, and also gives them a chance to punch in their codes if they forget to disable before they leave their home.

title: Easy to use with tons of features
text:
When shopping for security cameras, I looked into all the options and felt that the slightly higher price of the Ring cameras was justified by their features and ease of use. I’m glad that I went with Ring and have been loving my cams ever since I installed them.

The app is straightforward when accessing the settings of your security system, and also has a neighborhood incident map where people report everything from suspicious activity and lost pets to break ins and criminal activity. 

Overall, I think the cameras were a good value and feel that the app is essential to getting the most out of your Ring system.

title: Works for Six Months and Awful Afterwards
text: Purchased the first system that cam out and took it back for the same reasons I am having now. Waited and purchased the Ring Pro after hearing of improvements and was happy for six months.  Seems the consensus from all users is that after six months everyone has the same issues with recordings, live views and connection issues.  I have a I.T. tech who takes care of all my issues and none of my other WiFi products are having issues like the Ring and it’s app.  Customer service is indifferent and you can tell the are reading off a script.  Looking into another product because Ri g doesn’t care or have good customer service.  I’ve emailed and called several times to get all of these issues fix to no avail. I know have a over $200 camera that works sporadically.

title: Overhyped product
text: It takes forever to load a live view and almost always missing whatever happens in those first seconds. Many times seeing the mailman leaving or already there when motion is detected and even chopping out clips not allowing me to see more. Lots of time it just hangs and stays loading. After reading about Nest doorbells I think I might make a switch. I mean they have continuous 24/7 recording so you won’t be missing anything. Ring doesn’t seem reliable. I wish Ring stepped their game up and make this useful. I don’t think recording chopped out clips is it. Even my CCTV cameras log in faster and at least able to see through them all at once. I’m not saying Ring should do everything like CCTV devices but come on. Give us at least a way to record whatever the doorbell see 24/7 using a local network hard drive or something. If this is the way Ring will work forever then I don’t see it going far.

title: Disappointed in Ring 2 Doorbell
text: Was looking forward to a way to see who was knocking on the door etc since we don’t have a peephole or other ways to see who’s at our door. I assumed since Ring seemed to be the most commonly used product, that we couldn’t go wrong. We purchased our Ring Doorbell 2 late February and it worked alright for a few weeks. There were slight delays when wanting to use the “Live View” feature and our extra chime accessory would occasionally show “offline” when looking at the app but overall we were pleased. It seems that since the update, the product is basically useless except for wanting to see things after they happen. “Live View” only works MAYBE 1/10 of the time. Most of the time it says it’s having problems connecting or just loads endlessly. Will most likely be making a switch to a different security camera system and, at this point, not recommending this to anyone.

title: Hard to Cancel Subscription
text: I signed up after the free introductory period, which was great and all the features worked perfectly. After that, I never was able to use it except to review clips after they were uploaded several minutes later. The live features for recording and answering the door stopped working completely. After several months waiting for that to be fixed in an update I tried to cancel subscription, but to my dismay I learned you cannot do this simply via your device. I had to call in and spend several minutes on hold and explaining to their reps I was not interested in their trouble shooting ideas, as I had already checked my system end to end myself, and I have plenty of other security cams with no such problems so I just wanted to cancel. They finally cancelled and I am pretty disappointed in the whole experience as it seems more like a bait & switch gimmick than a credible company.

title: Broken Device
text:
I have owned a ring pro doorbell for about a year and a half and early on, I was there biggest fan. However, about four months ago the doorbell stopped alerting us of motion once it becomes dark. I have made numerous calls but it appears they don’t care and have no plans of correcting the issue. I have decided to take the doorbell off and secure another product. It appears as if they grew too fast and can’t support the numerous products they offer. A quick search of their products and you see the review scores are dropping for Ring. No more Ring Products in my future

Update - your polite attempt to make us believe you are really trying to help is sad. You just reply to feedback to appear proactive. I have logged my issue many times and still no help. Also told I was a priority and a specialist would contact me...well shocker but that never happened. All false claims by what once was good company. Please stay away from Ring!

title: Love Ring
text: If it weren’t for Ring I would never answer the door anymore. I love being able to decline solicitation without even opening the door. I had a porch pickup a while ago and the guy went to grab all the stuff on my porch, I scared him when I spoke through the Ring “not that stuff” lol. Was hilarious! There are a few glitches every once in a while, like the WIFI kicks the doorbell off a lot, or if the weather is bad the streaming isn’t great. We recently added a flood light camera on the other side of our house and I am so happy with it! Pretty much see a pesky raccoon every morning, but other than that it gives me peace of mind to help prevent burglaries.

title: Great quality during the trial period and then...
text: The minute I could no longer watch videos on our ring doorbell because our 30 day trial had expired and I had to buy a monthly plan, our videos are super glitchy and freeze and black screen constantly, on probably 90% of the videos. When before- the videos were clear all of the time, never glitchy, never froze, it was exactly what we have been looking for... even when the battery would run low, never had any issues... Kind of irritating. It’s almost like they rope you in pretending to be such a great security option, and then the minute you start paying, the quality goes to crap... I am hoping this clears up soon, if not I will be trashing this thing. I don’t care if the fees are inexpensive, if it doesn’t work right it’s not worth a penny in my opinion.

title: Nice try but not worth it.
text:
When we first got the ring it worked great, a few updates ago it began to be so delayed that it’s worthless, it no longer makes the doorbell ring sound inside the house (only makes noise outside) and now it’s frozen on a picture and even more worthless. It doesn’t capture motion or anything it’s just a corrupted frozen image. I have an alert that the doorbell rang at  8am (which is not typical delivery time around my neighborhood deliveries are always in the late afternoon) and I’m left wondering what was going on. Before the thing started to glitch, it had gotten so delayed that people have come and gone before the video kicks in. I’m really irritated with the amount of money that was spent on this product only for it to break and become completely obsolete (it’s not even a functioning doorbell- like I’m at a lesser point than I started with my standard ol doorbell)!
Save yourself the money and shop elsewhere.

title: Works, but slightly problematic.
text:
I have three complaints. First is that the time it takes to connect via the app leaves people at the door walking away before you can even see them in the app. It doesn’t matter if I am away or at home on my network. 

Second, also a delay issue with the recording... I get a notice of motion, but the camera will show me a delivery person walking away. Why did it not start recording as they approached? If this were package/porch pirate instead, I would get a great photo of their back. :-/

Third is the camera sensitivity. I keep restricting the sensitivity of the camera, and at this point I have pulled the zone in quite close to my front door, well away from them road, and any passing vehicle larger than a pickup truck notifies me that I have motion. If I restrict it any further, the camera won’t pick up anyone at my door until they ring the bell.

title: Good system but could be a lot better.
text: I really like the ring lights and have installed several of them. It seams that the the area that needs the most improvement is the app. It would be really nice if the videos would start instantly in a lower resolution then ramp up to full resolution and also I would really find it useful if the motion that set it off was highlighted in some way. A very basic feature that I would really like is a simple button that would allow me to override all the lights on or off simultaneously. And last I don’t understand why the products can’t be team players, If you hit the siren button they should all set off for that location as well as you should be able to talk through all at the same time as a option.

title: So Far, So Good
text:
Hoping to see a change for the iPhone X coming in the next update. I like the Ring Doorbell and the app since we got one installed. I would definitely recommend it to anyone especially if you live in a city or high traffic neighborhood with a lot of activity.
It’s super sensitive to be sure,  picking up movement from my next door neighbor’s porch even with the Zone setting as low as it can get but overall I’m satisfied with it. 

I would to see the app dumbed down some and made simpler to look at or at least cleaned up so it doesn’t look so cluttered that the less than tech savvy won’t bother to try to use it. Customers who aren’t willing to try or give up easy will stay away from something like this. Oh did I mention, fix the app for the iPhone X? 😁

title: Expected more/One camera will not stay connected
text:
I planned on giving the ring cameras a good review. The cameras are decent overall. Day time the video is great. Night vision is okay. I don’t like how in medium light they constantly switch back and forth. 

However I don’t care for app itself. The last few days the app will barley load if at all. The whole app just feels clunky and not very well optimized. The geofence worked great the first few weeks but now it rarely works. 

Additionally I now have one camera that will not stay connected. It’s shows it’s connected in the settings. However anytime I try to view live feed it will not load and says no wifi. If I leave the premises it shows it’s completely disconnected. I’ve tried restarting the camera and router to no avail. The other cameras work fine. Pretty frustrating when the cameras are only 4 weeks old. SMH

title: App need work
text:
Just added a solar floodlight.  But I’m having issues. Not sue if it is the app or the light or combo of both or what. 

So the app says my battery is dead every 2 days. Being solar that is excessive right?    So I swapped batteries and plugged the one that was in the light in to charge and 3 mins later the light turn green to indicate it is fully charged. So nope battery wasn’t dead. 

But while the light wasn’t working there were setting options in the app I didn’t have before. Options to stop motion detections during certain hours, to snooze them for 4 hours etc. but it would not let me save these options.   

I replaced the battery and now these options do not show- what the heck!  This is what I needed bc this is just a flood light - it doesn’t need to send me motion detection alerts 24/7!  I have cameras for that. Plus could be why the battery drains so fast bc it is using it constantly. 

I like the system and the idea of everything on one app etc but if it can’t work better than this for the price we are paying it isn’t worth it!    I shouldn’t have to climb a ladder every two days to swap my battery on a light attached to a solar panel either!

title: Fantastic with glitches
text:
I said keep it simple. There’s too many updates adding an overkill of bells and whistle‘s. When it first came out it was easy to operate without all the different options making it confusing. Keep the options simple so elderly people can use as well 

whistle‘s making the features EXTREMELY TEDIOUS. Want to call customer service I give them my input but I believe that info goes nowhere but they will take care of most problems.
While watching the video you cannot control the timeline feature of it anymore you have to start from the beginning each and every time to view something over.
THIS is the biggest glitch and I hope they fix it.
I have other types of cameras but RING supersedes their ability and replacement offers. I hope they fix the timeline so I can view any part of the video at any time without having to start from the beginning.
They need to go back to user-friendly set up so you can hear the video as soon as you click on it without having to press all the icons, and keep it simple.
They are the most reliable in comparison to other cameras simply because of the customer service care!!

title: No geo-fencing support!
text: I have the entire ring system and monitoring set up at my place. However Ring is missing some critical integrations and isn't taking full advantage of the z-wave 2 capabilities. One particular feature I would like for ring to add support for is the Geo-fencing so I can lock and unlock the yale door locks I have installed and linked to my ring system as I leave my house or arrive closer to my house. This would simplify and help me automate some of the tasks. I was surprised they haven't added support for this basic capability that many competing products seem to offer. I should have researched a bit more before I spent a lot of money buying and installing the whole system in the house and I'm unfortunately stuck with it now. I'm very disappointed, Ring! 😟 Hope you are listening and acting on the feedback!

title: Add still images to Ring Alerts
text:
I have two Ring doorbells and a Ring floodlight.  I am enjoying the products and feel they provide a  nice sense of security that was missing before.

A feature that I would love to have with these products is an option to receive a still image from the Ring cameras (via Text message/Ring alert) whenever motion or a ring is detected.  We receive frequent motion alerts and receiving a still image with the alert would make it possible, with a glance at my phone, to determine if there is a need to go to the Ring app and review any videos.  I am certain that this feature would be very popular with your customers, especially ones that may have delay issues when viewing a video.

Hoping to see the Ring app enhanced with this feature in the near future...

title: Eh
text: Love the concept but for the money I paid for this it’s garbage. It constantly loses connection with every update on the phone and sometimes just randomly. My WiFi is right next to it, so I know it’s not my connection. There is absolutely no notification to tell you it went offline - so each time I finally notice, a week has gone by. The lag time between when you get notified of movement or the doorbell ringing is ridiculous. By the time I open the app and it loads the person is gone and I have to go back to look at the recorded video. I also didn’t like getting tricked into purchasing a $250 product only to find out after installation there’s a monthly fee if you want to be able to view your recordings. It’s only free if you view live - and like I said that is useless since the app doesn’t load in time. Wondering if this is a bad design or just a scam.

title: Good App but Needs Improvements
text:
The Ring app has been reliable and proven itself very useful in conjunction with the Ring Video Doorbell.  It's a great piece of home security for checking visitors at door. I recommend the doorbell and app to anyone, noting the following:

I would give 5 stars for 2 key improvements and ask that Ring add these to their enhancement list:
1.  Enable video deletions without confirmation prompt, and/or allow bulk deletions.  I get a lot of videos and deleting 1-by-1 also with confirmation request is very tedious. 
2.  Increase video load speed.  Other apps displaying video display much faster than Ring.  I know there is a limit to load speed based on connection speed, video quality, etc. but seems this could be faster. This is especially important when trying to remotely respond to doorbell ring.

title: Gone downhill drastically
text:
When Ring first came out it was a market leader but now unfortunately the quality is lagging. I’m not sure if it is due to the new update of iOS or just lack of development testing but this version is slow to perform, seems to freeze and crash and oftenIs just generally not responsive. I have an iPhone 11 Pro Max , so find it hard to believe that it’s my hardware.

In terms of features it is a very dated application, and doesn’t seem to have been updated with new features in a long time. It seems that Ring is more interested in promoting Nextdoor than they are developing user interface.
