Why do we still not have any ability to jump straight to a specific time or even get updates when someone actually rings your doorbell?

When someone does actually ring your doorbell and you try and preview, the processing time takes so long that they have already left by the time you even get an image not sure if this is by design or just poor execution. Either way it’s not very useful if you are actually using this as a device to filter who you should be answering the door to.

Overall it seems that they are somewhat resting on their laurels as the most well-known smart doorbell.

title: Mr & Mrs Jennings
text: My husband had this installed and we absolutely love it. Especially when he has to travel out of town for work. Even though we have a security system the ring makes me relax with no worries!! Our cameras and speakers are flawless!! Ex..we were both at work and my phone alerted me to let me know someone was at the front door. I asked the guy, can i help you? He kept asking was i home. I told him I’m not opening the door so if he has a business card to leave it. He says i don’t have one I’m a walking business card, so are you home. I told him he has 2 seconds to get off my porch. Of course he wanted to try me and i activated the alarm and he took off, and we live in a extremely nice neighborhood.

title: Recent updates messed with settings
text: I used to be able to adjust where motion started with all of my cameras, but with recent updates, I can no longer do that with the spotlight cam that I have on my driveway. Instead of picking up people and cars that go right past my driveway, I’m now getting alerts on every little movement. The worst is the tree at the top of my camera that never used to set it off. I’m now getting about 50 alerts a day where I used to get a dozen, and 40 of them are the dang tree blowing in the wind. If I set my camera for people only, then I wouldn’t get alerts for other motion in the cul-de-sac that I want. I still have control of how far out the doorbell goes, and I would like to have this control for my other cameras too. Please put them back!

title: Lost notifications
text: Worked great up until a few weeks ago. Now it stopped sending me notifications. It still records all movements, but i dont know about them unless i open my app to see 20 missed movements. When i checked the notification button i noticed it was in the off setting(which i never turned off). When i click it it says that i was to go into my phone settings and turn notification on to allow ring to access it. Well i did this and its already on and ring has access to it, but it wont allow me to turn notifications on in the ring app! Whats the point of this if i can see whose on my property the moment it happens! Ive got 2 other cameras on my house i paid $50 for that dont send me notifications that work the same as the ring camera does right now!

title: Such great equipment and idea but poor app
text: I am honestly shocked, the ring is the biggest name in smart home security right now so I expect the best equipment, best app, best customer service, etc especially for the price I pay. I have no complaints about the equipment and customer service (which I’ve already had to call) but the app is a disaster. App crashes all the time or claims that my equipment is offline or gives an error message when trying to use the apps functionality. My fiancé accidentally triggered my alarm and when I attempted to disarm remotely, I got ANOTHER error message. So when I need the app to work like it’s supposed to at its most dire situation, guess what? It didn’t. This worries me for the future when a serious situation happens and my technology fails me. Ring, you are the big dog of this industry and you should really act like it and optimize your inconsistent band buggy app.

title: Used to love it, but...
text:
I’ve had my ring doorbell for a bit over a year. At first, it was great, I could see who was at my door, I could respond, etc. I can’t remember the last time I was actually able to view something happening at my door in real time. The amount of time it takes to load anything upon receipt of a notification is painful. A full minute, sometime 2. By the time the “live” video loads, anyone who was at my door is long gone. Then, if I want to review the video, I have to wait a full 2-3 minutes before it’s available in the history. Was great, now, too slow to be useful.

UPDATE:

I have lowered the rating to 1 star. I can no longer actually connect to my ring with any alert. It makes no difference if I’m on WiFi or cellular. When I tap the alert to see it, I get nothing but a spinning circle no matter how long I wait. The only way I can view it is to wait until it appears in the activity section.

title: App is horrible after the free trial
text: So I was very happy with the ring doorbell while I was on the free trial. Motion would alert me and I would go into the app and instantly be connected. All that changed the minute my free trial ended and I signed up for the monthly subscription. The doorbell will alert me sometimes and sometimes once the person is driving away is when it alerts me. When people ring the doorbell I can no longer go into the alert and answer. I have to go to the live view button and hope and pray it connects. My router is no more than 15 ft from my ring doorbell so it not a connectivity issue. The neighborhood updates I can never see them.  I was going to purchase the flood lights from ring but I made the better choice and installed a camera system in my home. More than likely going to cancel before the end of this month because the doorbell is useless. I would not recommend anyone to purchase the ring doorbell.

title: Live view not working with cellular data after iOS update
text:
Live view does not work with cellular data, it did work about a few months before I did the iOS 11.2.6 update. The live view works perfectly on WiFi though. So I did everything from uninstall ring app and power phone off, clear history and cookies, clear network settings. I have an old phone with iOS 11.1 still live view not working thru cellular data, but I finally tried older phone with iOS 9.3.1 and live view works thru cellular data.  My conclusion is the iOS update from apple. Not cellular service cause tried on different cellular carriers and still live view blue circle keeps spinning, until I try older iOS 9.3.1. 

Summary findings: Ring app please find a patch or update to ipv6.  Your app is still on ipv4, therefore T-Mobile/Apple iOS using ipv6. I really like your product, but if live view does not work via cellular data, your motto always home serves no purpose!

title: Ring Doorbell 2, Floodlight Cams, Stickup cam, Chime extender
text:
We bought a bunch of Ring stuff to setup home video monitoring while we were on vacation at Disney World for a week. Setup is easy and everything works very well, given there is adequate wi-fi signal. I really like the motion zone customization on the floodlights and the two way audio with siren options. 
One of our floodlight cams is at the APEX of our garage and couldn't get a signal, so I did have to buy a 3rd party range extender to get a signal to it, as the Chime extender was not sufficient.
We plan on adding a few more devices to our Ring network in the near future. 
It has been fun playing with the functionality of the system and tweaking the motion zones and settings.

title: Early Customer with upgraded equipment
text:
Early in Ring’s release I had one stickup camera monitoring our front door.  I encountered some minor configuration issues that their support worked out quickly.   Later I added a second initial stickup camera to monitor the driveway.   

I have since replaced both of the older stickup cameras with the newer, improved spotlight battery cameras, both with dual batteries.  What a great idea.   I added a third in my backyard.   Perfect HD video.  

A few months ago I added the Ring Alarm System to protect the doors.  I am slowly adding sensors so all windows will be protected as well.  Added monitoring and I couldn’t be happier.   Thank you Ring Team!!

title: New updates have serious flaws
text:
The new updates have made the ring doorbell useless unless I keep a light on; it was fine before.
Video given to police was useless as they couldn’t tell characteristics of the people trying to open my car parked within a few feet from the doorbell.
Also, now it takes a while to open the video; once again it was fine before. It has nothing to do with WiFi and I’ve the latest iPhone.
I own multiple ring cameras and am simply disappointed specially when I called ring for help with the doorbell and the ring rep told me to buy a Security System instead of using the doorbell. 🤯

title: Tech support for Ring Doorbell 2
text: The Tech Support was great in helping me resolve a low battery warning that I thought was coming from the doorbell.  After reinstalling the App and re-establishing wifi and set up, we did find the software was not up to date and was corrected.  Since this did not correct the problem.  Tech Support recommended I video record the doorbell when the low battery alert went off. They were puzzle too.  It would go off about every 1/2 hour.  After monitoring the doorbell outside for a hour we figured out the warning was coming from another source, a smoke detector that was located at the front door.  Ring’s Tech Rene was responsive, patient and professional.

title: Frustrated
text: My boyfriend and I were so excited to buy a ring doorbell and spotlight camera. The doorbell doesn't detect motion unless the person is right at the door and no matter how much I mess with the motion zones and the motion wizard I cannot for the life of me get it to catch better motion of someone walking up to my door!! It says it should see up to 30 feet and we don't live on a hill or have steps.. Also I'm so confused reading their help guides or watching the motion video tutorial that tells me to correct issues by clicking this and that because my app doesn't have those functions! I know we have the ring doorbell original so does that mean this is outdated?? We just got this like a month or so ago and we are just very let down. There's been an increase of crime by us and I wanted to feel more secure but how can I feel secure if my ring doesn't detect whats going on?

title: Great app but it needs dark mode
text:
I’ve had my Ring alarm (keypad, door & motion sensors) for a little over 6 months now and it’s great. No issues with any of my devices except for a one time issue of notification delays but it was short lived. 
I would like for an added dark mode feature for the app. The Ring app is clean and easy to use but checking it at night is annoying in a pitch black room. The sudden white screen is blinding and almost too bright to use in the dark. Apple added support for dark mode, and lots of apps have added support for it. I would hope to see Ring follow suit with their app making it easier on the eyes.

title: Ring Floodlight
text:
Ring really got it right with this device. Great camera with two way communication, outdoor siren and floodlights.
I installed two of these, support is great as well. Resetting the camera is a pain, because you would need to get on a ladder to do that if your cameras are installed at the suggested height. 
If you have a good wi-fi signal, there should be no problem in viewing the live view. With the chime pros installed, my cameras show Rssi -40ish and -55ish. And both show the live view within 3 seconds most of the time. 
My advice to ring, please do not let existing functionality break with new updates and remember there is always scope for improvement. 
Also please allow downloading of better resolution videos than what we can view within the app.

title: Great app; still no iPhone X support?!
text:
This is a great app. The app does exactly as it is supposed to: it notifies you just as motion is detected or the doorbell is rung. And, when you answer the alert, it is very responsive and the two-way talk feature works very nicely. There have also been great features released in the newest update. I really enjoy using the snooze feature. Also, being able to FINALLY select the tone of my alerts is great!

There is, however, on VERY, VERY annoying aspect of this app: there is STILL, after 3 months of the iPhone X being released, NO iPhone X support! Instead, the app is cut off to be much smaller than the actual screen size of my iPhone X. There are very few large mainstream developers  that haven’t updated their apps to support the iPhone X screen, but Ring still has yet to update the app.

title: Selective but Nice
text: The app and system have been great. I enjoy the alternative and affordable option for monitoring my home and after 2 years, I can say I honestly have had very few issues. The only thing that has been upsetting is the sensorship of the “neighbors” section. I completely understand the need to sensor it, but many of my neighbors post funny or unnecessary posts that sometimes encourages rude conversations underneath them. The few times I genuinely had concerns around my home like people or even bears on my property and submitted a post, it never makes it to the “neighbors” feed to warn others or get information. It looks like it’s only for lost pets and jokes so that feature has been the least helpful, but I really enjoy the rest of my Ring app.

title: Takes forever to preview
text: Ever since last update the app takes forever to open and then takes forever to see video. I took a long time too before the update but now it’s even worse.  I get an alert and I go open the app and it takes a while. Then I go to history and alert is not there so I go to camera and I get video processing for about three minutes. Eventually it does also show up in the history but it’s ridiculous. By the time I can actually see what the alert was the culprit (if there was a problem) is long gone. Also some days it picks up the car in the driveway and some days it doesn’t. Totally unreliable. Not happy with Ring Doorbell Pro. Oh and also when I finally see the video the delivery person is usually already leaving. I stood in porch the other day for a couple minutes before it noticed me. Just terrible.

title: Too many false positive motions detected with no solution
text:
I thought I would be pleased with having this device, but continue to find myself frustrated by the many false positives. I installed wedges to angle the device slightly away from the street. That did not help. Ring customer service attributes the false positives on heat signatures from passing vehicles. However the street is well outside the advertised range of the Ring device. If your Ring device will be pointed towards a street, expect the same results. 

Also, the device/app can occasionally be slow to respond to valid motion at the door. For example, a UPS/FedEx/USPS delivery dropped at the door can result in a video only of the delivery person’s back as they are walking away. I’ve checked the WIFI connection and speed, and know this is not the problem.

title: Updates are making the app useless!
text: I have the Ring floodlight cam setup for my Mother’s front. She is 85 and lives alone. At first it was perfect, I was able to instantly see who was coming her door. After the first few updates to the app, when I would get an alert, instead of seeing what was going on, I would have to enter my email address and password. By time I get that done, it would be too late to see who was there. Now, after the last update, if I get an alert, it works fine, the next alert I always have to turn off my IPhone, them turn it on again. It will work for one alert, then I would have to do it again. I need to be able to quickly see who is at her door, but this now leaves me frustrated. I will be looking at other systems, as Ring is no longer dependable.

title: Waste of money
text: We have the floodlight, and spotlight cameras from ring. I got the chime pro because a support agent told me it would help with our floodlight camera connectivity. We plugged the thing in and it actually made our signal strength worse. Every so often the thing would talk to us and say that it was disconnected from wifi and we had to set it up all over again. If we hadn't already hardwired the floodlight camera I would return that too. The app is so slow and picks up motion that isn't happening often. The video lags and it's impossible to see faces when you zoom in on a person the video quality is so bad. We have the spotlight camera too and plugged that in to test it right next to the wifi router and it had the same issues as the floodlight. Slow video, took forever for the live view to open. Every support agent out there just says it's our internet which clearly it isn't.

title: Weekly Safety Report Forced On You
text: I love the Ring doorbell... as a doorbell with video; that’s what I wanted, and that’s what I bought. I’ve adapted to many of your updates, most notably the creation of the Dashboard. Frankly, the previous design was much more intuitive, but I understand you are creating an app for a broader perspective than mine.  Now, however, I’m forced to get notification of a Weekly Safety Report. Please provide the ability to shut off this incredibly presumptuous notification. Just because you created a report you think is clever doesn’t mean everyone who bought a doorbell wants it. I want a doorbell with video. That’s what I bought, and that’s what you do well. Stop trying to do too much, else I’ll just use another manufacturer’s doorbell with video.

title: So far so good, but.......
text:
Love my Ring doorbells. Had live stream issues in the beginning but after 2 days of being a dunce I rebooted my router and they work great. Video and audio are clear. I really love it BUT it would be spectacular if you’d have an app to work with the Apple Watch. At least to be able to answer a ring or to see live feed. I get notifications on my watch but have to use phone to look. Sometimes if I’m at work I can’t pick up my phone, that’s why it would be great to be able to just take a quick gander on your watch and not be driven crazy bc I can’t look at my phone. Just a suggestion but I’m sure I’m not the only one who would appreciate this. 

Thanks! Lisa

title: Doesn’t connect to my phone
text:
When I first got my ring pro doorbell when someone rang my door bell it would automatically connect to my cell phone pretty quickly, that was about two yrs ago. Now when someone rings my bell I have to manually go to the app and click on it to see who’s at the door, it takes time to connect. I don’t know if it’s something in the updates that had thrown it off. I have deleted the app downloaded it again it still doesn’t pick up the way it use to.  Now when my door bell rings I look out the window to see who it is, faster then waiting for the app to connect. Maybe  it will be fixed one day. Maybe someone can look into it
Thank you.

title: Ring is working great—Now
text:
I had the same problem described previously— lights coming on without any motion trigger, light coming on even though I had turned it off in the app minutes prior, & floodlight staying on until daybreak. I discovered it wasn’t the fault of Ring at all. I have a type of front porch light switch that is more than simply off and on. Flipping the switch on once will set the light to go out and come on again when motion is detected. If I flip the switch twice, the light will stay on continuously until turned off manually. Once I had the switch in this second mode Ring has worked perfectly. I am very satisfied with this product.
Longhorngal1025

title: App needs ...
text:
Our camera stopped recharging by solar and ring support helped us pinpoint the problem. Support service was quick and personal... no robotic auto-reply... and the situation was successfully resolved. 

One thing we discovered in the process is that the "power source" indicated by the app is not the camera's actual power source. It’s the RECOMMENDED power source for the video speed selected in settings. 

For a long time we thought there was an additional problem with our camera because the app said the power source was solar even when the camera was on battery or USB. Perhaps the app team could make it more clear by altering the power source label in a future update.

title: Live View stopped working on my 1 year old SE
text:
Since your latest update My one year old iPhone SE can not access Live View. My spouse’s 3 year old iPhone 11 can. I’ve deleted & reloaded the application & removed & replaced the battery in the doorbell several times. Please fix. This is the kind thing that stops me from upgrading to more devices on the system. *even removed and re-added to the system and ‘live view’ still won’t work. Really glad I didn’t spend money on security system, because I’d be livid right now.
**UPDATE** it appears ring has corrected the software issue, but I am leaving this review up for others to read. It was down for at least 4 days.
I’d also like to add I found their ‘’Rapid Ring’ app on day 3 & it worked fine, but I object to needing 2 apps. However, maybe you just need access to your video feed. This was an “ok” substitute.

title: Ring is the worst
text: My Ring after a yr died called for support, what a joke calls go to the Philippines not the US. Over an hour on the phone finally get escalated to level 3 support to the most disrespectful person ever. He did not care that it’s not working he said well you had it for a year so nothing I can do to help. I ask him to talk to a manager he very arrogantly said he is the highest person in the company, so I guess that means bezos is answering phones now. He said as high as you can talk to no one above me talks to customers. Wow really, you sell junk that fails after a year and no one above him talks to customers which proves to me they know they are relaxing by their pools laughing at the fool customers buying these things that are junk. Maybe bezos should stop racing to space and fix the problems with the products they are ripping normal non millionaire customers off with.

title: Update or upgrade
text: For the past few months I am getting alerts of motion but it doesn’t play the video. I have motion  zone on but does start recording as in the motion zone. All of my recordings are half of the designated motion I zoned. There is a huge lag when it starts to record. The blame game. It seems that Ring always blame the internet or wifi. They have upload and download on their end stating its our internet. I do my own testing It states differ. I have great internet and wifi in my area. All of my other devices connected to the same internet all work flawless except Ring devices. Maybe the infrastructure? Maybe upgrading? Regardless it seems to be getting worse. Today... no one alert as I see people walk by my cams. What a joke. There is nothing securing about this. A dangerous example.

title: Keeps Fouling Up
text: When installing the Ring Doorbell Wired, it displayed an error message and stopped.  I got on the phone with support.  It actually worked, just showed an error.  Today I installed a Chime so we could hear the doorbell in the house without having a phone on us.  Installation went poorly, asking to allow the Ring app to join Ring’s network.  I had already allowed that, but it wouldn’t work.  Failed several times.  Tried it from a different device (my iPhone rather than my iPad) and it worked.  Then thought I would try out some chimes.  It takes 2 to 3 minutes to change chime tones, and usually fails — “Something Went Wrong”.  I have settled on a chime tone simply because I don’t know whether I can ever change it successfully again.  It is working at the moment.

title: Highly disappointing
text:
The app stopped working and would just tell me that my internet wasn’t working. No longer able to access the device, I was forced to update the app, only to be met with new security protocols that stopped me from logging in to see my own camera. 
Years later and I’m just as disappointed as I was when I wrote this:
This product could have been fantastic but after a short time the app no longer allows you access TO YOUR OWN VIDEOS!!?  So all that money spent and it's basically just a door bell that violates your privacy, it won't let you setup motion without asking where you live and now it can take videos of my home without my permission and I can't even view them! Horrible. Terrible. As much as I paid for this thing they shouldn't be begging for more just to use the product. Awful. Disgraceful. So much potential to be such a failure.

title: The app is ruined with the latest update
text:
The latest update has compmetely ruined the app. The designer of the new app layout should be fired.

It used to be a great little app where all I needed was on one screen — the list of events including missed ones, the list of devices with little marks showing whether or not the chimes are currently in the silent mode (it’s extremely important to see it right away.) Now it’s all on three different screens, the main dashboard contains zero useful information — why do you need such a dashboard at all? Now you have to press like a million buttons to get to the features previously available right on the front page. And the worst thing — now they don’t show little “night mode” badges over the chimes so you have no idea if your chimes are currently muted. Terrible design choice!

To sum it up: the worst UI update ever! Please fire whoever’s responsible and bring back the old app layout!

title: Delayed detection motion rings constantly
text: I’ve had my ring a couple years...used to be on battery, we moved now connected by wired doorbell...in February the 24th actually the motion went off constantly firing the night...now the last week, the motion ring has started to go off constantly again,  all settings are correct..there is nothing that should set it off.  In addition when it needs to be detecting motion, it does not..people are at my door or leaving before I get a motion detection ring...the motion detection should be going off as soon as someone starts walking up my walkway...no deliveries are already at my door and they are leaving...the live isn’t loading...my ring used to detect actual motion before they got to my door and not detect phantom..as it is doing.  Something needs addressed and quickly...can see purchasing more if I can’t trust what I have.

title: Works pretty good.
text:
I have 4 cameras around my house and appreciate the multiple view screen so I can see at a glance what’s going on. One of my previous complaints was when skipping through events I wouldn’t know what date/time the current view was from. The new timeline view is nice, except:(1) I don’t like that it immediately goes into live recording and (2) it would be nice to be able to switch between timeline view and list view without having to change settings. 

Also, I have an Apple Watch. When I get the neighborhood watch messages there is a screenshot of the video, so it would be nice when I get en event notice on my watch (when someone rings the doorbell) if the notification would also include a screenshot so I can know if it’s someone I need to talk to (whip out my phone) or not.

title: Better than nothing
text:
I wanted to love this. I really wanted to love this. I have found that the only useful aspect is the (paid for) video log. 

I wanted a fast live feed to my front door to see who is there in real time.  After correctly installing the door bell I found that there is a significant lag between the doorbell and the video feed.

I continue to get “ weak connection”.  I paid for and added their booster. Still weak connection. adjusted my connection-
Still poor connection. Hired my tech guru - still weak connection. 

The doorbell works. But the feed does not connect fast enough to see who is there.  Well after I walk to the door and ask “who’s there”.  Even when they stand there and wait for me to open the door -no connection. I can later check the video to see them but that’s not the point. 

Do not expect any real time connection. The TV person scaring away two men with live feed? It doesn’t happen unless those scofflaws spent significant time in his camera before he “caught” them. 

So. If you pay for video storage, this will be useful to see what happened past tense. There is a “neighborhood” connection to share videos is past crimes, usually theft, that will be also be useful. 

Just do not expect any real time connection.

title: Mechanical doorbell ring delayed
text:
The mechanical doorbell does not ring immediately when the button is pressed. We’ve only had the doorbell a month and already it’s caused a lot of embarrassment with people standing at our door for awkwardly long times before it is answered. Several times I’ve opened the door to find that the person walked away. 

My understanding is that this is “by design.” I do not live with my phone glued to my hand so I don’t always get the alerts, nor does everyone in my household have a mobile device. Changing the fundamental way a doorbell has behaved for over a century is poor design. People who do not want to hear their doorbell already have the option to disable it in the app. This is such an awful user experience. 

Please add an option in the next update to disable the delay and allow the mechanical chime to ring immediately.

title: App has gone down the toilet
text: We have a Ring 2 at our business. The app worked well on our iPhones, though we were never able to get the chime to work. Honestly, we enjoyed it so much we thought we’d get one at home. BIG MISTAKE!!!!! Once we installed the second and installed the apps on our phones it has been nothing but a NIGHTMARE!! The app for work disappeared. Reinstall, the home disappears, then they both are gone. Or some variance. Uninstall the app, reinstall. One or the other disappears within a day or so. Over and over and over and over and over.....who has time for this crap??? Ring is supposed to make life easier!! The home is one thing. But at work it is important. Especially when my husband and I are spending a lot of time away right now dealing with my cancer treatment. We thought we could depend on this system to help us though. Not so much - at all. Huge disappointment!!! Get it together Ring!!!!

title: Good at first...
text: The doorbell was great the first couple of months. Then I started noticing that it would take minutes after a video is captured before I could view it. So if you happen to miss the ring but try to view the recording literally a second later, it does not load until whoever was at your door has been long gone. However that issue has been mildly annoying compared to the most recent issues. At least once per day, I will get a recording that is all black with no sound or image. Today I received a motion notification, but did not find a recorded video of the event on the list. I have had to resort to accessing live view to deduce where the motion detection came from (like if a certain family member's car is in the driveway). My WiFi connection is fine, everything is fine according to the device health information.

title: Suggestion for a “Dawn to Dusk” feature in the Device Schedule
text: I noticed that the motion sensors trigger the lights on our floodlight cam even during daylight. I’ve programmed a schedule to keep the lights off during certain daylight hours. However, I noticed the device settings in the Ring app don’t have a “Daylight to Dusk” feature to schedule to have the lights off during daylight hours. This would make the scheduling of having the lights off much easier since the user wouldn’t have to constantly change the schedule depending on the time of the year. Having this feature would help to conserve energy & bulb life.

title: Great equipment. App could be better.
text:
I recently started looking into camera since my old one stopped working. At first I tried the Ring floodlight. Connection and setting was easy and everything worked good. But randomly the floodlight would come on and would not goes off unless I manually log in and turn it off. It keep happening often enough that it started to bother me. Plus the warm light is not something I liked it. I also notice that the range of detection for light trigger is not good compare to my old motion only spotlight. So I switch all 5 to the wired camera only ring. 

So far I am happy with the products. But the app could uses many improvement compare to it competitor Arlos. My friend has that and their app seem very superior.

title: Good but issues
text: This is a really good idea. We have both the ring doorbell 2, and the spotlight cam. For a while, I couldn’t get live view to work on either one. Now, I just can’t get it on the doorbell. And all my equipment checks out. Great connections, high internet speeds, etc. all tests out perfect. I read someone on a 3rd party website about changing the channel on my router or something. I have NO idea how to do all of that, and I shouldn’t have to. I think there was an update that fixed the spotlight cam, maybe there will be an update for the doorbell. I love being able to check to see what’s going on at my house. And if I could get the live view faster on the spotlight cam, and I could just GET the live view on the doorbell, that would be great!!

title: Not worth the money
text: We’ve had the ring doorbell for a year now. It tells us we have motion at the door when cars drive by and when the wind shakes the trees, but when the mailman comes to drop off packages on our doorstep, we get no notification. Also, if you try to look at the live view it takes over two minutes sometimes, if it loads at all (and yes, our internet works fine). So basically it serves us no purpose other than being a normal doorbell. If you pay for the subscription on top of the doorbell, I’d give it a 2 star review instead because you can look at the recordings after the fact to see who was at your door, but for how much the doorbell costs to begin with, seems unreasonable that you should need to pay that for such a simple feature. Overall, would never ever recommend this app/doorbell to anyone.

title: Horrible app n Customer Service!!
text: I’ve been a longtime customer of Ring, but it’s time to move on. Customer service is terrible and they only tell u the same thing over n over. When viewing recorded videos, the app crashes. It has a glitch. The rep told me it’s my Apple phone and it needs to be updated. I knew it was a lie when it came out of her mouth. Then she tried to over talk me. I’ve called on many, many other issues regarding their products, n it’s the same thing. We as consumers deserve better than this. This is unacceptable. There’s a glitch going on with their APP on IPHONES, n they can’t fix it. Unbelievable!!

title: Not great...
text:
After paying for the hardware and hiring a Geek Squad rep to set up our wired ring doorbell, it appears to have been a waste of time and money. 

As many others have said, despite having a good WiFi connection, it takes so long for the app to open up after getting a motion detection alert it makes it pointless. 

Despite having increased the motion detection area, we still are not alerted within that range until someone is already practically directly in front of our door. 

Now having updated the app, I get a notice saying “Recording Subscription Inactive”. Sooo, I purchase this home surveillance camera/doorbell and pay for installation but I can’t even look at the video history without paying an additional *monthly* fee? Yeah, all I get is the live view. 

To top it off, mine is wired as I’ve said. Before the tech left it was working fine when he pushed the button to make a noise within our apartment. As soon as he left and we wanted to test it and the app, it no longer did that. Of course all “tech support” did was advise us to spend more money and buy yet another one of their devices, the chime, which essentially is just the part you plug in so it can make the sound inside our house; so we solely rely on the app.

title: Works great!
text:
Overall a very good interface. A couple of areas for possible improvement:
1. In order to hear the app audibly notify you when someone rings at your door, the volume on your phone needs to be raised, which can be a distraction when ads or other app notifications pop up at a very loud level. Would be nice if the app notify volume could be tied into the ringer volume instead of the speaker volume. 

2. When adding another user, the first step for that invitee should be to download the ring app and then create an account. Currently, it has the invited user create an account through its online website and never has them download the ring app.

title: It’s ok
text:
So there’s good & bad. First off RING support is horrible. Chat support is bad. Calling is just as bad. They’ll do the whole canned “we’re so sorry” but when you get down to the actual problem you get transferred to no where. 

The actual products are decent. But my issue is with the solar pathway lights. I love the idea, but you can’t disable them during the day. So they’re constantly turning on/off which is draining the batteries. Then I get notifications that the batteries are low despite them being in full sun. I’ve tried to seek tech support but like I said in the first paragraph I’ve gotten no where. 

The solar lights would be awesome if you could disable them during the day. RING would be awesome if they actually had tech support. So they get 3 stars.

title: Happy but some suggested improvements
text: Mostly happy with Ring. Trying to resolve some freezing issues with a boosted WiFi. Also, a nice improvement would be to either enable a longer snooze option(perhaps for a whole day when visitors go in and out say for a party) plus please consider a better option for deleting multiple unwanted videos.  Maybe click on a whole day to delete rather than individual videos, which is so very difficult because you have to hit exactly on the circle or it doesn’t work in edit mode. So frustrating , if you don’t hit the circle exactly it exits the edit mode and you have to start all over again to delete!

title: Terrific!
text: We absolutely love our ring products! We have the ring pro (upgraded from ring original) and have had a ton of success with it. The app is intuitive and seems to work fine. Fortunately, we haven’t experienced any delays after receiving a notification. The live feed shows up quickly. We’ve used this to turn away several unwanted solicitors and have used it to be reimbursed for damaged deliveries. I do wish Ring would add categories to the neighborhood app so folks could use it for things other than just suspicious people... the people on neighborhood can be pretty toxic. Anyways, it’s a great product and awesome app! One of the few I give 5 stars! 👏👏🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

title: Motion zones and vibrate sound
text:
Please consider bringing back the ability to draw your own motion zones wit the spotlight cams. These new “wizards” and the on/off zone semi circle with the newer models really limits the users ability. I can’t draw around trees or other structures to eliminate unwanted notifications when it’s windy. I want to purchase more cams but won’t until Ring brings back that option.
Also please please please consider vibrate as an option for sound. At work I can’t have my phone constantly going off for notifications, so I have to put my whole phone on vibrate and then miss important calls and texts. If you can make jingle bells for X-mas, vibrate shouldn’t be too hard.

title: Audio static noise since update
text:
Update: now video recording/playback is extremely slow and the app keeps crashing for, as well, after this last update. I sent numerous emails to the ‘help at ring’ email, only o have a reply that says they no longer use that email for customers to send help requests or feedback to and then was blocked from sending any more emails to that address.  Please fix these issues!!

Since the most recent update, my once wonderful and working properly ring floodlight cam now has audio interference when recording or in live view. I see there is now an option to turn off the audio record - perhaps something with this new feature has messed up the once working audio.  Please fix this. I didn’t pay this much for a floodlight-cam and cloud video storage to deal with issues like this.

title: Live View Slow to Load; Sometimes Can’t
text:
The number one thing you want to do. Look at a live feed. Sorry, can’t. Either you get an hourglass for 2 or 3 minutes or sometimes you just cannot see a live view. Almost never does the live view pop up quickly. Does not matter if you have full wi-fi signal on camera and phone. Does not matter if you have full bars of cell data. 

Do not buy this camera thinking you are going to see what is happening at your door in real time. That will not happen. No real time conversations with people at your door. Forget it. Every thing you will see will be past tense only. 

It will record. But you wont be able to see a recording until maybe 5 minutes after it’s done. Plenty of time for whoever it is to be gone already.

title: I liked the old version better
text:
I love the Ring Cameras and the system in general. I would say though that making the “Timeline” feature standard is not making for as fluid an experience as was the previous update. It’s now three keystrokes to get the full screen live view whereas before it was just one. And while you can get can get back to the listing of “events” by going to settings, it’s not the default now. I would like to have the option of “opting in” to the “Timeline view”... you had it that way when it was an option on the now disappeared “New Features” menu. Please bring that back!

And how about a 4K option? I’m still struggling to read license plate numbers of cars entering my property even from 15 feet away.

title: Awesome product!!!
text:
I have owned this product for a little over a year now and have nothing but great things to say. The doorbell is very durable and picture quality for this small of a camera is awesome. Customer service is an A+++. I would highly recommend purchasing a ring product. I always know who is at my house at all times so i never have a worry in sight when i am on vacation or at work. 

I am looking forward to the new products ring hopefully has in the works for the future. There is no other door bell product out there like this that can top what they are doing.

Do yourself a favor spend the money for the safety of not only your home but yourself.

title: Good commercials, bad experience
text:
We bought the ring doorbell, spotlight cams, pro chimes, and the floodlight cam for our property, spending over $1500. We’ve experienced the same issues as the previous review with the video cameras not recording everything, sometimes appearing black sometimes appearing gray before becoming clear. 

Sometimes the camera will start, then stop and then restart when the person has walked past the property. If the video cameras are not going to record the full episode, what is the point? We agree with the person in the previous review about needing to fix these issues. We have likewise called Ring for customer support, troubleshooting, and other related issues. 

We are quite frustrated, but are willing to give ring a chance to fix these issues.

title: Spotlight cam is great, app needs more work
text:
Overall, the app works decent for me. I have the Ring spotlight cam, which has been solid so far. With that said there a couple of features that I would really like to see added. 
1. Please add a setting that gives me the option to put the light on a schedule, much like you already have for the motion sensing.  It’s a bright cool white light, and I would prefer that it not come on in my driveway between say 6 and 10 in the evening. Currently the only way around this is to turn the light off altogether, which I don’t want to do because I do want it to come on in the middle of the night if it detects motion.
2. iPhone X support?
3. (May be related to 2) the app will not let me exit out when I swipe up to go home within the app on my iPhone X. This happens about once a day, and I have to restart my phone to exit out.

title: Undependable
text: Ring app states that connectivity is good yet it often takes up to two minutes to view live feed. What use is that? Absolutely unacceptable. Even as a doorbell it’s not too great. We get the notification instantly, but still, good luck getting the live feed. After a video has been recorded, it cannot be accessed for about two to five minutes, saying “processing.” We also have a Blink camera which is in our alley- about 45 feet away from our router. Takes about two seconds to begin live feed when we get a notification. You can view the recorded video in less than ten seconds after recording. Blink was less than half the the price of the Ring and it outperforms Ring in many ways. We are moving from our house and leaving the Ring to the buyers as a “gift.”

title: Not what I bought.
text:
Does the app deserve 1 star.  The app is a 3 star.  I gave 1 star now because the product I bought had a 30 day video history for free for as long as I owned it. This means that I didn’t have to hover over my phone every second to see if the movement at my door was a crime, or someone coming to say hi. I do now.  That has now gone away.  Now for a fee I can get 60 days of video history.  Or, pay nothing and get no video history.
If I had bought with the intent of paying a fee I would be okay with this.  But, to delete a function that was part of what I bought, I will not accept giving Ring anymore money.
I prefer to pay more to a company if I expect a monthly service fee.  Then less to a company that changes after I buy a product.  I want to be clear, I did not buy this with the expectation that this would be on a trial basis.

title: Serious issues
text: This app messes with your iPhone ringer audio level on a regular basis and I have had my phone ringer turned off and than turned all the way up when in the app. The app also fails to load the live video on many occurrences as well. As other people have had it happen, my ring camera out front decides what to record and what not to record. I have people coming and going from my house and it doesn’t capture them on a regular basis, but it sure captures every car that drives by my house but fails to capture people and cars in my driveway. I’ve turned all the settings up and still have the same issue. If I could do it again, I would go with a different company due to the app and lack of settings. Also there is not way to get alerted when you are in do not disturb mode, but it’s not like it would alert me anyway.

title: Love the new update!
text: This new update is great. I love how I can now view a snapshot of all of my cameras and devices at once. I have recommended Ring products to many of my friends, family, and neighbors....2 of which have purchased your products recently. I own the Ring 2 doorbell and 2 of your floodlight cams. I plan to add 2 more of your floodlights in the future after I have my electrician set up wiring. I also plan on getting the alarm system as well. Just 2 days after I set up my devices, it captured a burglar at our home. From the camera footage, the police were able to identify him and issue a warrant. Your customer service team is outstanding. Thanks Ring.

title: Love it, just has a few kinks to work out
text: Love the system I have a few cameras. Convenient usage especially with the app. I just hope they make some sort of update that can make some of the camera picture qualities a little better. My flood light camera puts out great quality especially at night. My door bell quality is so so, and my spot light cam at night is eh when the light is off . There just needs to be a setting to adjust exposure, contrast and other picture options so I can dial in the quality. Especially the door bell because my front porch has an awning and creates shade but beyond that in the street and on the sidewalk is pure whiteout from the daylight. Over all it’s great just a few kinks they need to work out.

title: Update Ruined the App
text: Since the last update, when I click on the notification that someone is ringing my doorbell, it takes forever to load. Also it doesn’t take you directly to the live view anymore. It also says “reconnect” every time and you have to wait all over again. I live in a two story home and have a medical condition that prevents me from running up and down the stairs, but that’s what I have to do every single time. I waste 2-3 mins trying to pull up “live view” then run down. As soon as they leave, I pull up the app again and it works fine. I have 100 mbps internet service and have done a reset many times. I would not recommend Ring at this point. I used to tell everyone about it! Even referred my coworker who purchases the whole home system! Update your app or I will look at other options. Orbi has some awesome systems at Costco and they have better video.

title: Slowly getting worse and worse
text: It seems that after each update, I lose more and more functionality out of my ring cameras. My porch cam (spotlight battery) has so many false alarms due to the wind blowing on the bushes that it’s effectively useless and I end up just snoozing the alerts and am forced to charge the battery all the time. My doorbell (Pro)doesn’t activate the house’s chime anymore (I’ve rechecked all the connection). My backyard cam (spotlight wired) is set to people only, but picks up every single bug that flies within 10 feet and doesn’t activate when I stand directly next to it. My internet  hasn’t changed in any way since I got them, but the notifications are now 5+ mins after the event, so there is no chance of catching the event live. Very disappointed with each “update”.

title: Disappointed and undependable.
text: We purchased the Ring 2 about 2 months ago and about 90% of the time it just records a black screen. It also tries to record with every single movement. I set up the settings to record only 5ft ahead and it still recording every car that drives by and we live on a busy street. Also, the app is crazy slow. Every time someone rings our doorbell we can’t even answer or view the video because it takes too long to load. I have even tried switching to live view and we just get a screen of it trying to load/buffer. By the time it works the person is gone. I have tried reseting it, checking out WiFi strength and nothing seems to work. On a positive note When it does actually work the video quality is very clear but like I said most of the time it’s a black screen of nothing.

title: Not ready for prime time
text:
I get alerts when cars pass on the street sometimes. The street is about 40 feet away. The sensitivity function does work too well. I get alerts and there is no activity. Sometimes no alert when someone comes to the door. When someone rings the doorbell it sometimes doesn't record any activity. Customer service is great however. Bottom line... not very reliable.
Update
After several software updates and playing around with the sensitivity function I’m still getting alerts when cars pass on the street but nothing if someone crosses my lawn. If somebody comes to the door I may get the coming or going but usually not both. Also recently I’m having trouble connecting to Ring when away from home. I get a message that the phone can’t connect to Ring. It takes about three minutes before I can view the alert. 
Still not reliable in my opinion

title: What Now!
text: Boy I was rooting for this shark tank product.....but have been let down over and over again by the performance (now on my 3rd replacement) and the issues what seems like a daily occurrence 😧. Every update seems to have yet more issues and I’ve stopped calling about issues letting others call as I don’t have much patience to keep removing device and going through set up again & again. Distance adjustments don’t make sense as 5 to 30 ft never change!  I pay the yearly recording fee (2nd year) but am sadly looking for a replacement cam for my front door & yard. I leave my front door am picked up by cam, go across the street to pickup mail and return the exact way back & am never detected coming back to the front door AT ALL!!  This is a continual occurrence. Sorry Ring I’m retired, single and unprotected by your device. Looking for replacement

title: Bait and switch
text:
The app works great...while you’re paying a monthly fee as a subscriber. Once you let your subscription lapse, “Live view ended” is all you get in response when trying to view live, as well as *every time*, a reminder that you are not paying Ring regularly anymore; “more info” or “dismiss.” How about “dismiss forever” as an option??

If my ring doorbell were not a gift, I would have returned it already. It’s the only smart device I own that requires a monthly fee, and for what, cloud-based storage? My other cameras offer a built-in cloud option, but exactly as that, an OPTION. Don’t push your cloud storage on people like it’s the only medium for keeping recordings. Why doesn’t this support a micro sd slot through the back, accessible only after removing the torx screws? Oh yeah, you wouldn’t be able to push the cloud service on people.

title: Takes long and sometimes doesn’t record
text: I’ve had the rind stick up cams for about 4 months now and after fine-tuning sensitivity to get the cameras to respond in a timely manner, they seem to work well at times and not so well at other times.  It takes a lonnnng time for the live video to connect and stream.  And sometimes (even when settings are set to sensitive to be alerted right away) the camera doesn’t alert or record.  I gave three stars because when everything works, everything is great... And at times when you need it most, you may not be able to capture or see what you need.  I think Rings time and efforts should be spent updating what ever is underneath the hood to get maximum speed and response.

title: The new update, preview, notifications
text: We first got the Ring devices in December of 2019 as a Christmas present and we loved it. Fast forward to today and we have some serious concerns. 1. With new update the preview is gone and it may or may not notify you of motion or person in the designated area and it may or may not light up as it used to and is set up to do so. I left last night and light, camera, and flood light never illuminated and was not recorded. Again this morning I left the house and none of them illuminated or recorded. I also no longer get a low battery notification as I have in the past! Wifi is working and batteries are fully charged. I used to love the Ring line of devices but I’m starting to think it’s time to use something else. Massively disappointed! If you’re looking for home security I would look elsewhere!!!

title: Good hardware, bad software.
text: While the setup process for the ring hardware is quite easy, the application is atrocious. I had some problems earlier with how long it took to access the camera’s live view, and it turned out that it was a weak signal to my router. So, I purchased a range extender and that somewhat fixed the problem. About 2/3 times I try to access the live view, it just fails to do it. Another HUGE problem that I’ve seen very frequently, and also in some forums, is people getting multiple notifications for the same event. This is happening to me right now, and it’s very frustrating. My phone will buzz anywhere from 2-6 times for a single event, and just that single event will be in my event history. Not sure what that’s about, but it needs to be addressed promptly.

title: Definitely not worth it
text: Unfortunately the ring pro has given me zero comfort owning. It never goes off when supposed to but always when it shouldn’t (when absolutely nothing is outside it detects things). Zero consistency which is what we look for when buying anything security related. The motion sensing is the worst thing but we can mention a few other things. The quality of the picture is awful. You can not see faces when zooming or licensed players etc. There is a lag when someone is walking or driving by so you see tracers. ALL of this keep in mind Ring says all of my equipment is working really great as far as signal, WiFi strength etc so it has to be the lack thereof quality on all ends. I gave it 2 stars because it does give a picture but that’s all it’s good for.

title: Not as Advertised
text: We have had the Ring doorbell for 2 months. It seldom detects movement even directly in front of the camera. When movement is detected it isn’t until the subject is leaving, gone and most times not at all. I’ve been home when the gardeners and pest control are working right in front of the ring doorbell and it does nothing. I am thoroughly disappointed in this product and it’s functionality. They want you to pay monthly to store videos from the device but then I would be spending money for unusable footage. Ring Doorbell is a scam. They sell peace of mind without the ability to deliver it. The two stars is for Ring’s ability to allow me to access the camera from remote places, on my phone, however, unless I’m in live view, I’m not going to see anything that would give me piece of mind. Do not purchase.

title: Slow video processing / missing functionality
text: I have both Ring and Nest cameras and the Ring app/system is by far inferior. Motion alerts are pushed to my phone immediately, but the video of the motion that triggered the alert is not available until several minutes later, so i have to wait to find out if a bird or burglar just went by my camera. All my cameras are on wired Ethernet and I don’t have the same issue with Nest, so the problem is with Ring’s servers/processing. Also, it would be great if the motion alerts included the video so that I can quickly review and dismiss (another feature Nest has that Ring does not). Also, if you have live view open, you can’t rewind if you happened to miss something. You instead have to close live view, wait for the clip to process/upload, then open that clip and look for what you missed. Would love to see this functionality added.

title: Good app, but needs work
text: This has real potential, but the app is nowhere near what it could be. You need to be able to infinitely adjust the sensitivity. Right now mine is set to react to people, but I’d like to be able to do more. If I increase sensitivity the smallest possible amount every time a blade of grass moves in the breeze it responds. That can be a real pain. I don’t want to turn it off at night because that’s when I really want to be able to see what’s going on. It is fun to use when people come up on the porch. Startles the hell out of them!  It would be nice to be able to copy, or enlarge the area neighbors alert pictures also. That way you might be able to pick up a license plate, or facial details to pass on to the police department. Like I said, this app has real potential!

title: Bigger Issues
text: Thank you for the updates and working to make this product / app better. I appreciate this dedication to your product and customers. With that said, here are a few of my current issues. Last two updates have caused my Ring products to work less, not more. After update of adjusting zones my ring doorbell catches nothing now! Could walk past it 100 times and maybe once or twice it will alert. I bought it to assist in protecting my family not be more blind to what’s going on around me. Cameras inside my home spend more time off line now than on. Constantly dropping the WiFi when nothing else is off line. Your products are cheap, but right now they aren’t worth what I’ve paid since they aren’t doing what they are supposed to!

title: Ring Tech Support does NOT support
text:
Several months after installing Ring the inside doorbells STOPPED working. The only way I knew someone was at my door was via phone notification. When I called Tech Support they said there was a known issue with temperature inside the doorbell box, and they were working on it, and they would advise me. I do not know exactly how many months it has been down now, but I would guess it’s been six months or more. 
Separate issues are:  
1) Even though I am notified that someone is at my door when I am away I cannot answer the bell when I am using LTE and not WiFi. I have no idea how that can fixed. 
2) Because of the angle/location the Ring doorbell must be set it cannot be adjusted to eliminate cars being driven down the road, no matter how much I adjust the sensitivity. What they need is separate devices; one to “ring” and one to capture the perimeter needed/wanted.

title: Jack
text: I have the ring video door bell 2.  It is a excellent device the camera is flawless as far as picture quality and video. The talk feather could’ be better it works but not clear at all times. Also the customer service is Great and if it’s not working correctly when you get it installed, just call and it will be resolved by the Ring staff. You should also consider getting the chime pro to improve the WiFi strength and the device will work even better. If the sound was better I would have given 5 stars you can’t beat the customer service and the product speaks for itself  in my opinion it is very well made and at a fair price. The ring app works with no issue on my iPhone at all.

title: Revised - Version 3.12.2 and 3.12.3 won’t alert iPhone
text:
Doorbell (wired) won’t alert my iPhone 6 iOS 11.0.1 or 11.0.2.  The iphone can access the doorbell to see activity, but a doorbell activation won’t cause the phone to recognize ir.  Also, the iPhone won’t install the Ring app on my Apple Watch 2 with Watch OS 4.0 (doesn’t show up on the app list in the Watch app on the phone).  Talked to a nice but clueless lady at Ring customer support about it, but no resolution.

Revised 10/16

After a couple of conversations with customer support, things got fixed.  Notification settings were apparently reset during iOS and Watch OS upgrades (to 11.0.3 and 4.0).  Things seem essentially normal now after removing and reinstalling app, spmI changed the rating.  Good service.

title: Annoying Notification Error for Apple Watch
text: This app normally works great, but within the last month or so they made an update to include image previews of your camera for motion alerts. Now there is a really stubborn and annoying glitch on my Apple Watch where with every motion alert, the notification appears, self dismisses, then appears again, for a total of about 5 times. While this message is appearing and disappearing over and over, it makes my watch completely unresponsive to any user input. I expect bugs to occur with anything, but I’ve tried really hard to report this bug to Ring and there is no clear way to within the app, and when trying to contact support through live chat on their website there is no technical support option.

title: Ring NEEDS A NOTIFICATION WHEN WIFI IS LOST
text: The whole point of having the ring is to know whats going on outside/inside one’s property. Whats the point of having this device if you cant get a notification that the ring lost wifi connection and you need to fix it. If we have no wifi then obviously no alerts are sent and we have no way if knowing that whats happening on the property is not being recorded, let alone not knowing wifi was lost. You wouldn't know if you lose wifi unless you randomly decide to do a live stream and then you’ll see “offline”. Ring really needs to look into adding a “lost wifi” notification feature into its devices. With all the technology out there I’m sure it can be done.

title: Misleading
text: What I didn’t know was that in order to store video, you need to pay a minimum of $30 annually. I know it isn’t that much money, but it was nowhere listed in set up or on the box. Without storage of video, I can’t see what happened 30 minutes ago or even 5 seconds ago. The only option given is “Live” view. Secondly, the audio quality is so poor that it’s impossible to have a conversation with the person on my porch. The video quality is decent for a wide angle shot of my porch, but the quality is reduced drastically when a person is in the frame. The face is washed out, so I can’t identify anyone coming to the door. For $99, I guess it’s peace of mind for me when my husband leaves town, but next time I’ll be purchasing something with higher quality video and audio with the ability to store on a server.

title: Great products and app with good connection
text:
As long as the WiFi connection is good for the cameras and doorbell, and as long as the app keeps up to date, Ring is amazing.

Other reviewers complain about not seeing anything until it’s too late, or the footage they do see is blurry or blacked out. However, that is not an issue with the Ring device itself, or the app, that’s an issue with the device’s connection. As long as the ring device is installed properly and has a stable connection, you get notified the second motion is detected (per your personal device’s settings) and you can watch in real time with pretty decent quality video.

text:

title: Not as good as I had hoped
text: Worked great for the first 30 days then video started freezing basically just getting a screen shot of something.  Often whatever it froze on could not even be identified.  Now nothing had changed on my end so I find it odd that come day 31 I start having issues.  Called customer support, after speaking with them all they could say is it must be my internet speed and I should contact them about it.  Funny how everything else works on my internet speed, including Ring for 30 days, and now my internet speed is too slow.  Seems odd.  I’ve updated app, moved router but video still freezes. I have better luck looking out the door peephole and identifying what’s setting off the motion detection than watching the video.  Would not recommend.  I’m a 65 year old widow living alone and thought this would be a great safety feature for me.....what a joke!

title: Live View Doesn’t Work on MTU-restricted Networks + SU Cam v3
text:
I’m trying to get the attention of someone at Ring who actually understands this issue - the level 1 techs that screen and answer support queries do not understand and are not able to escalate this.

Have multiple Ring products (Doorbells of various generations, Floodlight Cam, SU Cam v3)
SU Cam v3 is only product observed /w this issue
Have Ring app on various iOS devices (iPhones, iPads)
iOS devices are provisioned with an always-on VPN (IPSEC) connection
On WiFi networks, there is no issue /w Ring App + VPN
On cellular (TMobile 6to4 NAT), all Ring cameras works EXCEPT SU Cam v3. The Live View will just not come up!
Packet capture analysis reveals that /w the SU Cam, Ring’s cloud servers are sending RTP packets via UDP /w length of 1438 bytes
It appears that b/c of TMO’s 6to4 NAT + the IPSEC VPN we use, those 1438 byte RTP packets are not making it due to MTU size restrictions
Tried various tricks to force VPN clients to negotiate a lower MTU but nothing tried has affected the size of the incoming UDP packets
The RTP packets for other Ring products’ live view are small enough to traverse these various restrictions.

title: Already helping us in week 1
text:
We just installed our ring and it was so easy with the videos and step by step instructions. We also added a Chime and again it was easy to install and is working well. 

The Ring has already become useful with a few issues around our home (tracking a delivery and another confirming who did damage to our home). 

My only note is how it seems to take a bit for the video to show when someone rings the doorbell. I am usually already at the door or they have started walking away before I can see who is on the screen. If we can speed that up, we’ll be incredibly thankful!

title: Not Dependable
text: I bought a Ring 2 about a year ago after confronting a porch thief involved in multiple credit card thefts. When the Ring works it’s good. It continues to lose WiFi connection. I have become an expert at setting up my doorbell because I have to do it so frequently. I have speeds of 123Mbs download and 18 upload at the front door. My modem is literally on the other side of the wall from which the doorbell is attached. I just received a new doorbell and had the same error message of not connecting to my WiFi. Restart the modem and go through the process AGAIN. I would give 1 star but customer service has been very good. The people are very nice. If this thing stops again I will return it and ask for a refund then shop for something else. Frustrating

title: Come on, Ring, it’s 2020!!!
text:
To be fair, I’m rating the overall Ring “software”, not the app. The app alone would be a 4 in my book, ie not bad but could use some tweaking and improvements (esp. in the area of consistency and logic).

But the software which would have been a 5 in 2015 is not one in 2020.

My biggest complaint? In the age of AI, Big Data and facial recognition technology, it’s absolutely inexcusable that your software does not have a feature to exclude/hide/not record certain people. I DO NOT need 500 videos of ME leaving from and returning to my place. I shouldn’t have to snooze notifications just because I’m cleaning or hanging out on my porch.

Since I usually have my phone on, near me, you should at least say, we’ll record it but stick it in a folder called Probably unimportant and delete it after so many days.  Or we won’t record at all (allow us to choose). I can see arguments about recording should someone sneak up and assault me.

Allow me to train the app to exclude other “known and ok” people/household neighbors.

So I can focus on the bad ones. But as it is, this camera, app and system has been more useless than useful. The novelty of reviewing video alerts has quickly worn off when it’s me 98% of the time.

title: Weird streaming while live
text:
I have the Ring wired outdoor camera and when going live (whenever it does allow me), it streams but image starts deteriorating gradually to the point that you can hardly identify what you are looking at. Then, all of the sudden it refreshes the image and the cycle starts again. Not sure if this is a firmware issue or what but its very annoying if I’m trying to see the live feed. 

The videos are recorded perfectly, its just the live streaming thats causing the issue. My wifi is 10 feet away and I have 100mbps for upload and download so I know that’s not the issue. The video issue does not happen with the floodlight camera. 

Ring...I love the concept but this is a mayor issue that other competitors have figured out somehow... please fix asap.

title: Attn development team
text: I feel every user who has this ap should have their own unique user name not just neighbor number, reason being is that there are so many false and BS reports of incidents that don’t fall under the guidelines of the purpose of this ap. We need away to report such abuse of this nature as it is really taking away from what the idea of this is.   With a user Id I feel one can report abuses of the service and a ring admin. Could suspend a user and terminate an abuser.   Please consider some sort of ap upgrade to weed out the bored house wives and house husbands.   That is why a 2 star rating was given. All else with ap and product meets my expectations.

title: Good but not great!
text: I have a doorbell and floodlight camera for my driveway. The  doorbell is the first edition and is incredibly slow at notifications. Most times all you see is someone walking away. It also lacks night vision, so identifying someone at night is practically useless. The floodlight camera has a beautiful picture and is faster at notifications. You cannot, however set the motion lights to not activate during a certain time. It’s either on, off or motion activated. Also, you cannot sync between devices. You have to manually enter each device on your phone, iPad, and computer even though I’m signed into my account. Wish I had known that before we installed the floodlight camera on the roof of our second story house and threw away the box.

title: Nonexistent Customer Support
text:
Update:  It took a week for Customer support to contact me but they did resolve my problems.  Not as timely as I expected, but they did help.  Thank you.  Now the doorbell works as intended and I must admit it is great.  

Just purchased my Ring Video Doorbell 2.  Worked great for 2 days.  Can not determine why it stopped.  Used online help, didn’t work.  First, app stopped working on my IPhone.  Called customer support Monday, hold for 15 minutes, no answer.  Sent email Monday night, no response.  Tuesday tried chat, after 10 minutes it terminates.  Wednesday, called on hold 15 Min, no answer.  Tried chat twice, no response.  I now Have a doorbell that doesn’t work.   This is where I was 2 weeks ago, no doorbell.

title: Pretty Decent Security
text: We love the ability to see what’s going on at home. If it had sad card back up in case the WiFi goes out that would be awesome. Sometimes the motion does nor go off until the motion event is over. The WiFi on theses cameras are exceptionally weak but we added WiFi repeaters in the house to alleviate this problem. We still feel this is the best outdoor system. The price for monthly service is reasonable and the servers are zippy. In internet goes out then your security is DEAD!! 🤢 I guess the engineers did not think his through. We use a T-Mobile hotspot as our back up internet. An sd card slot would help. You absolutely cannot beat the customer service. 100% great customer service and warranty.

title: Too slow, getting worse not better
text: Like many others here the latency is terrible when motion is detected or a ring occurs. By the time you can get past the spinning wheel opening the app the person is long gone. The latest update renders the night vision a green grainy view that’s awful and would be of no use in identifying anyone. Why this was changed I have no clue, the black and white night view was at least somewhat acceptable. I’ve had this several months, hardwired to my doorbell. It stopped ringing the bell, was told I needed a bigger transformer. Spent $30 and luckily am handy enough to install or it would have been more. Then told to add a wifi booster to help with the latency. Now the doorbell won’t ring again and the latency delay no better despite $100 in extra expense. Luckily I got the Ring at the warehouse club and they’ll still take it back. Concept is great but execution is terrible.

title: Great for recording visitors, poor for checking immediately.
text:
The good first: it does seem to reliably capture footage whenever someone comes around so you can review it later, which is a nice security feature.

Takes a minute to connect to the doorbell, which kind of defeats the purpose of the whole system since you want to see who’s knocking quickly, but end up just going to the door anyway rather than waiting on the app.

The constant badgering to set up two-factor authentication every time you try to use the app was what really got under my skin. I had no interest in that, but the app tries to make it as difficult as possible to bypass, again adding time and annoyance to using it.

title: So not happy
text: I cannot explain how disappointed I am in the Ring.  I have had it for a year now, have called customer service several times, researched you tube videos, even updated our router to a much “stronger” wifi range and paying much more for it, yet still the ring barely catches anything.  We had so idiots put a mattress on our front lawn and the ring didn’t pick it up!!! Yeah, the cops were real impressed in our security system. When it does pick up people it’s on a major delay.  The person is typically in the house or out of the range for us to see.     The battery dies way too often, especially if we get more company in a month then previous.  It takes a year and a day for me to see what is going on because it is always telling me that the WiFi signal is low or there is none.  It’s ridiculous. So frustrating.  I seriously wanted to love this.

title: Bad from the start, progressively getting worse
text: I love the concept, but it’s actual functionality is laughable at best. 9/10 times I cannot access my doorbell camera after I get a notification about motion. Ring loves to pass the blame, saying “your internet must not be strong, or too far away” but this is a ridiculous attempt to shift responsibility for their half developed product. It’s 2018. If your router is in your house, you should have strong internet, ISP are on top of this, you, ring, are not. I have TWO 200 m/s signals going around my property. When signal strength is tested, WITH THE RING APP, it always comes back perfect. At this point I am just waiting for my contract with Adt (who has also royally failed in recent years) to expire so I can move on to a home security system that actually works. Do not waste your time with ring.

title: Poor customer service
text:
Do not purchase this product if you live in a rural area with limited internet such as Hughes net or other limited satellite services.

Operation under those circumstances is sketchy at best and ring’s customer service is horrible they offer no help what so ever. Hugged net was just a waste of money as well... together they offer a shoulder shrug and an oh well for the hundreds of dollars you have invested.

I truly thought I had found a way to secure my home remotely but found after power outages the ring system would not reconnect leaving our home unprotected. This was also a struggle to come home and go through the setup process every time the power blinked. While some of you will roll tour eyes at this review those in rural areas and farms will understand what I’m talking about.

I have horses and thousands invested in equipment that sits unprotected while we are away at work or in town visits and it was nice when it worked but left you stressed when it didn’t...(which was a lot)

The other problem was Hughes net only offers limited band width before they throttle your connection speeds which would leave us out of bandwidth within ten days of our data cycle. They ring cameras were literally chewing it up.

title: I Just Threw Mine Away
text: All I did was change my Wi-Fi network password and now my Ring will no longer connect to any Wi-Fi network INSIDE of my house. I spent an hour going through all the tutorials, re-setting WiFi, doing different things that it wants me to do to baby it through the process of a simple Wi-Fi password change. It’s sees all the Wi-Fi networks belonging to my neighbors and even to my printer but not the main network with the highest signal. I reset my Wi-Fi device and finally set the Ring right on top of it and it still couldn’t read it. I have had trouble with this device since day one! We tried to set it up to a doorbell and it wouldn’t work so we were stuck using battery only. We went through all the materials, and the tutorials then finally asked for help from customer service. They stopped answering our emails. I will never buy one of these ever again.
